verses.pt: Observando todos do mundo por todas as épocas, não encontro quem tenha entendido o meu coração.
verses.en_6th_ed: Looking all over the world and through all ages, I find no one who has understood My heart.
verses.ro: yorozuyo no sekai ichiretsu miharasedo   mune no wakarita mono wa nai kara
verses.jp1: よろつよのせかい一れつみはらせど
verses.jp2: むねのハかりたものハないから
verses.kanji: 万代の世界一列見晴らせど   胸の分かりた者は無いから
verses.english: Looking all over the world and through all ages, I find no one who has understood My heart.

verses.pt: É natural que assim seja, pois nunca o expliquei, não é sem razão que não saibam coisa alguma.
verses.en_6th_ed: So should it be, for I have never taught it to you. It is natural that you know nothing.
verses.ro: sono hazu ya toite kikashita koto wa nai   nanimo shiran ga muri de nai zo ya
verses.jp1: そのはづやといてきかした事ハない
verses.jp2: なにもしらんがむりでないそや
verses.kanji: その筈や説いて聞かした事は無い   何も知らんが無理で無いぞや
verses.english: No wonder that you know nothing, for so far I have taught nothing to you.

verses.pt: Desta vez, Eu, Deus, revelando-me diante de todos, farei ouvir-me explicando os detalhes de tudo.
verses.en_6th_ed: At this time, I, God, reveal Myself and teach the truth of all things in detail.
verses.ro: konotabi wa Kami ga omote i arawarete   nanika isai o toite kikasuru
verses.jp1: このたびハ神がをもていあらハれて
verses.jp2: なにかいさいをといてきかする
verses.kanji: この度は神が表へ現れて   何か委細を説いて聞かする
verses.english: This time I, God, revealing Myself to the fore, teach you all the truth in detail.

verses.pt: Embora estejam chamando este lugar de Jiba, Morada de Deus, em Yamato, não sabem a origem.
verses.en_6th_ed: You are calling this place the Jiba, the Residence of God, in Yamato, but you may not know the origin.
verses.ro: kono tokoro Yamato no Jiba no kamigata to   yute iredomo moto wa shiromai
verses.jp1: このところやまとのしバのかみがたと
verses.jp2: ゆうていれども元ハしろまい
verses.kanji: この所大和の地場の神館と   言うて居れども元は知ろまい
verses.english: You are calling this place the Residence of God at the Jiba in Yamato; but perhaps you do not know the origin.

verses.pt: Se ouvirem detalhadamente esta origem, seja quem for, todos serão tomados pela saudade.
verses.en_6th_ed: When you learn of this origin in full, a great yearning will come over you, whoever you may be.
verses.ro: kono moto o kuwashiku kiita koto naraba   ikana mono demo mina koishi naru
verses.jp1: このもとをくハしくきいた事ならバ
verses.jp2: いかなものでもみなこいしなる
verses.kanji: この元を詳しく聞いた事ならば   如何な者でも皆恋しなる
verses.english: If you are told of this origin in full, great yearning will come over you, whoever you may be.

verses.pt: Se desejarem ouvir e vierem me procurar, explicarei a original predestinação de todas as coisas.
verses.en_6th_ed: If you wish to know and will come to Me, I shall teach you the original cause of all things.
verses.ro: kiki takuba tazune kuru nara yute kikaso   yorozu isai no moto no innen
verses.jp1: きゝたくバたつねくるならゆてきかそ
verses.jp2: よろづいさいのもとのいんねん
verses.kanji: 聞きたくば訪ね来るなら言うて聞かそ   万委細の元の因縁
verses.english: Therefore, if you wish to hear and will come to Me, I will tell you the original Preordination of everything in detail.

verses.pt: Se Deus se revela e explica tudo em detalhes, o espírito de todas as pessoas do mundo se animará.
verses.en_6th_ed: As God is revealed and teaches the truth of all things in detail, the minds of all in the world will become spirited.
verses.ro: Kami ga dete nanika isai o toku naraba   sekai ichiretsu kokoro isamuru
verses.jp1: かみがでてなにかいさいをとくならバ
verses.jp2: せかい一れつ心いさむる
verses.kanji: 神が出て何か委細を説くならば   世界一列心勇むる
verses.english: When I, God, reveal Myself and teach you everything in detail, all people of the world will become equally cheerful.

verses.pt: Por apressar a salvação de todos igualmente, começo a animar o espírito de todas as pessoas.
verses.en_6th_ed: As I am in haste to save all of you quickly, I set out to make all minds in the world spirited.
verses.ro: ichiretsu ni hayaku tasuke o isogu kara   sekai no kokoro isame kakarite
verses.jp1: いちれつにはやくたすけをいそぐから
verses.jp2: せかいの心いさめかゝりて
verses.kanji: 一列に早く救けを急ぐから   世界の心勇め掛かりて
verses.english: As I hasten to save all of you equally, I will set out to cheer up the minds of the world.

verses.pt: Se os espíritos vierem a animar-se gradualmente, haverá prosperidade em todos os locais do mundo.
verses.en_6th_ed: As your minds become spirited step by step, there shall be rich harvests and prosperity everywhere.
verses.ro: dandan to kokoro isande kuru naraba   sekai yononaka tokoro hanjo
verses.jp1: だん／＼と心いさんてくるならバ
verses.jp2: せかいよのなかところはんじよ
verses.kanji: 段々と心勇んで来るならば   世界よのなか所繁盛
verses.english: If your minds become cheered up step by step, rich harvests will prevail all over the world, and every place will become prosperous.

verses.pt: Doravante, ensinando os movimentos das mãos do Serviço de Kagura, espero sua execução com todos completos.
verses.en_6th_ed: Hereafter, I shall teach you the hand movements of the Kagura Service and wait for all to assemble and perform it.
verses.ro: konosaki wa Kagura-zutome no te o tsukete   minna sorote Tsutome matsu nari
verses.jp1: このさきハかくらづとめのてをつけて
verses.jp2: みんなそろふてつとめまつなり
verses.kanji: この先は神楽勤めの手を付けて   皆揃うて勤め待つなり
verses.english: Henceforth I will teach you the hand-gestures of the Kagura-Zutome, the Service with the Holy Masks, and wait for you to perform the Service in full numbers altogether.

verses.pt: Se todos completos executarem logo o Serviço e os próximos se animarem, Deus também se animará.
verses.en_6th_ed: When all are assembled and quickly do the Service, as those close to Me become spirited, God, also, will be spirited.
verses.ro: mina sorote hayaku Tsutome o suru naraba   soba ga isameba Kami mo isamuru
verses.jp1: みなそろてはやくつとめをするならバ
verses.jp2: そばがいさめバ神もいさむる
verses.kanji: 皆揃ろて早く勤めをするならば   側が勇めば神も勇むる
verses.english: If you perform the Service quickly in full numbers, God will become cheered up as those close to Me become cheered up.

verses.pt: Se, em tudo, o espírito de Deus se desanimar, as colheitas serão também todas desanimadoras.
verses.en_6th_ed: When the mind of God is depressed over everything, the growth of all crops will be depressed, too.
verses.ro: ichiretsu ni Kami no kokoro ga izumu nara   mono no ryuke ga mina izumu nari
verses.jp1: いちれつに神の心がいづむなら
verses.jp2: ものゝりうけかみないつむなり
verses.kanji: 一列に神の心がいずむなら   物の立毛が皆いずむなり
verses.english: When the mind of God is depressed about everything, every crop will be depressed, too.

verses.pt: É lamentável o espírito que causa a colheita desanimadora. Para não ser desanimadora, animem-se depressa.
verses.en_6th_ed: The mind that causes depressed crops is pitiful. Quickly become spirited so that the crops are not depressed.
verses.ro: ryukei no izumu kokoro wa kinodoku ya   izuman yo to hayaku isame yo
verses.jp1: りうけいのいつむ心ハきのとくや
verses.jp2: いづまんよふとはやくいさめよ
verses.kanji: 立毛のいずむ心は気の毒や   いずまん様と早く勇めよ
verses.english: It is pitiful that you are of a mind that causes depressed crops. Therefore quickly become cheerful lest the crops be depressed!

verses.pt: Se pensam em obter uma colheita animadora, realizem o Serviço de Kagura e Teodori.
verses.en_6th_ed: If you wish that the crops grow spiritedly, do the Kagura Service and the Teodori.
verses.ro: ryukei ga isami deru yo to omou nara   Kagura-zutome ya Teodori o seyo
verses.jp1: りうけいがいさみでるよとをもうなら
verses.jp2: かぐらつとめやてをとりをせよ
verses.kanji: 立毛が勇み出る様と思うなら   神楽勤めや手踊りをせよ
verses.english: If you desire that the crops spring up vigorously, perform the Kagura and the Teodori!

verses.pt: Desta vez, comecem depressa o Teodori. Isto será o sinal para as coisas maravilhosas.
verses.en_6th_ed: At this time, begin the Teodori quickly. That will be the sign for miraculous things to come.
verses.ro: konotabi wa hayaku Teodori hajime kake   kore ga aizu no fushigi naru zo ya
verses.jp1: このたびハはやくてをどりはじめかけ
verses.jp2: これがあいずのふしきなるそや
verses.kanji: この度は早く手踊り初め掛け   これが合図の不思議なるぞや
verses.english: Now set out to perform the Teodori in haste! Taking this as a signal, I will work marvels.

verses.pt: Este sinal dito maravilhoso não é visto. Se esse dia vier, poderão entender certamente.
verses.en_6th_ed: Speaking of the sign and miracles, they are not yet seen. When the day arrives, you will understand clearly.
verses.ro: kono aizu fushigi to yute miete nai   sono hi kitareba tashika wakaru zo
verses.jp1: このあいずふしぎとゆうてみへてない
verses.jp2: そのひきたれバたしかハかるぞ
verses.kanji: この合図不思議と言うて見えて無い   その日来たれば確か分かるぞ
verses.english: This signal and the marvels have not yet been seen. But you will see them when the day comes.

verses.pt: Quando esse dia chegar e o entenderem, seja quem for, todos irão admirar.
verses.en_6th_ed: When the day arrives and understanding comes, whoever you may be, you will all be filled with admiration.
verses.ro: sono hi kite nanika wakari ga tsuita nara   ikana mono demo mina ga kanshin
verses.jp1: そのひきてなにかハかりがついたなら
verses.jp2: いかなものてもみながかんしん
verses.kanji: その日来て何か分かりが付いたなら   如何な者でも皆が感心
verses.english: When the day comes and you understand what they are, whoever you may be, you will be all filled with admiration.

verses.pt: É comum explicar os fatos após serem vistos. Eu os deixarei explicado antes que sejam vistos.
verses.en_6th_ed: To teach of things after they appear is the way of the world. I teach of things before they appear.
verses.ro: miete kara toite kakaru wa sekainami   mien saki kara toite oku zo ya
verses.jp1: みへてからといてかゝるハせかいなみ
verses.jp2: みへんさきからといてをくそや
verses.kanji: 見えてから説いて掛かるは世界並   見えん先から説いて置くぞや
verses.english: To begin to preach when things have come into sight is worldly; I will teach you beforehand what is still unseen.

verses.pt: De agora em diante, que o espírito dos superiores se acalme gradualmente, e a paz e a concórdia sejam feitas.
verses.en_6th_ed: Hereafter, I desire that those in high places gradually calm their minds and make peace.
verses.ro: konosaki wa kami taru kokoro dandan to   kokoro shizumete waboku naru yo
verses.jp1: このさきハ上たる心たん／＼と
verses.jp2: 心しづめてハぶくなるよふ
verses.kanji: この先は上たる心段々と   心静めて和睦なる様
verses.english: Henceforth, I desire that the minds of the upper people will become step by step pacified and make peace.

verses.pt: Embora esta paz e a concórdia pareçam difíceis, Deus dará a providência gradualmente.
verses.en_6th_ed: This peace may seem difficult to attain, but it will come step by step through God's protection.
verses.ro: kono waboku mutsukashi yoni aru keredo   dandan Kami ga shugo suru nari
verses.jp1: このハほくむつかしよふにあるけれと
verses.jp2: だん／＼神がしゆこするなり
verses.kanji: この和睦難しい様に有るけれど   段々神が守護するなり
verses.english: This peace may seem difficult to attain, yet I, God, will protect them and step by step lead them to it.

verses.pt: Este é o mundo conduzido por meio da razão, e conduzirei tudo com a razão da poesia.
verses.en_6th_ed: This is a world constructed on reason. So I shall press upon you everything with the reason in verse.
verses.ro: kono yo wa rii de semetaru sekai nari   nanika yorozu o uta no ri de seme
verses.jp1: このよふハりいでせめたるせかいなり
verses.jp2: なにかよろづを歌のりでせめ
verses.kanji: この世は理で責めたる世界なり   何か万を歌の理で責め
verses.english: This is a world constructed on reason. So I will press upon you everything with the reason expressed in poetry.

verses.pt: Digo conduzir, porém, não será impondo a força, nem por meio da boca, e sim, pela ponta do pincel.
verses.en_6th_ed: I shall press, though not by force or word of mouth. I shall press by the tip of My writing brush.
verses.ro: semeru tote tezashi suru dewa nai hadoni   kuchi demo yuwan fudesaki no seme
verses.jp1: せめるとててざしするでハないほどに
verses.jp2: くちでもゆハんふでさきのせめ
verses.kanji: 責めるとて手差しするでは無い程に   口でも言わん筆先の責め
verses.english: Though I say I press, I will never press by force or by mouth, but with the tip of My writing brush.

verses.pt: Será ótimo não errar em coisa alguma, mas, se errar, avisarei com a poesia.
verses.en_6th_ed: It is all very well if you err in nothing. But should you err, I shall inform you by verse.
verses.ro: nanimo kamo chigawan koto wa yokeredomo   chigai aru nara uta de shirasuru
verses.jp1: なにもかもちがハん事ハよけれども
verses.jp2: ちがいあるなら歌でしらする
verses.kanji: 何もかも違わん事は良けれども   違い有るなら歌で知らせる
verses.english: It is all very well if you err in nothing. But should you err, I will warn you in poetry.

verses.pt: Sinto pena, pois, ao avisar, se manifestará. Todas as doenças se originam do espírito.
verses.en_6th_ed: I pity you when My warnings become manifest. Know that any illness is from the mind.
verses.ro: shirashitara araware deru wa kinodoku ya   ikana yamai mo kokoro kara tote
verses.jp1: しらしたらあらハれでるハきのどくや
verses.jp2: いかなやまいも心からとて
verses.kanji: 知らしたら現れ出るは気の毒や   如何な病も心からとて
verses.english: It is a pity that when I warn you, things come to light. But it is inevitable, because any illness comes from one's own mind.

verses.pt: Quanto à doença, não é algo comum. É a ira de Deus, que ora revelo.
verses.en_6th_ed: What you are calling an illness is not an ordinary one. It is the anger of God now being shown.
verses.ro: yamai tote sekainami dewa nai hodoni   Kami no rippuku imazo arawasu
verses.jp1: やまいとてせかいなみでハないほどに
verses.jp2: 神のりいふくいまぞあらハす
verses.kanji: 病とて世界並では無い程に   神の立腹今ぞ現す
verses.english: What you are calling illness is not an ordinary one. Now I, God, am manifesting My anger.

verses.pt: Por não ter ouvido até agora os dizeres de Deus, fui obrigado a manifestá-la necessariamente.
verses.en_6th_ed: Because you have not obeyed the words of God even until now, I could not avoid showing it.
verses.ro: imamade mo Kami no yu koto kikan kara   zehi naku omote arawashita nari
verses.jp1: いまゝでも神のゆう事きかんから
verses.jp2: ぜひなくをもてあらハしたなり
verses.kanji: 今迄も神の言う事聞かんから   是非無く表現したなり
verses.english: Hitherto also you had not yet obeyed what God had told you. So I was obliged to show it.

verses.pt: Por ser grande o pesar manifestado de Deus, nem médicos nem remédios poderão solucionar.
verses.en_6th_ed: So much of God's regret is now being shown, the matter is beyond the help of doctors and medicines.
verses.ro: kora hodono Kami no zannen deteru kara   isha mo kusuri mo kore wa kanawan
verses.jp1: こらほどの神のざんねんでてるから
verses.jp2: いしやもくすりもこれハかなハん
verses.kanji: こら程の神の残念出てるから   医者も薬もこれは敵わん
verses.english: The regret of God appearing in this illness is so severe that doctors and medicine are all powerless.

verses.pt: Não pensem que isto seja comum ao homem. Seja como for, orientarei tudo com a poesia.
verses.en_6th_ed: Never think of this one matter as being ordinary. By all means, I shall admonish you with My verses.
verses.ro: kore bakari hitonami ya towa omouna yo   nandemo kore wa uta de semekiru
verses.jp1: これハかりひとなみやとハをもうなよ
verses.jp2: なんてもこれハ歌でせめきる
verses.kanji: こればかり人並やとは思うなよ   何でもこれは歌で責め切る
verses.english: Just this, never think that it is an ordinary illness! By all means I will drive it away with poetry.

verses.pt: Desta vez, mostrarei realizando completamente a limpeza da Residência. Fiquem observando-a.
verses.en_6th_ed: This time, I shall clean the Residence thoroughly. Watch, as I show you how.
verses.ro: konotabi wa yashiki no soji sukiyaka ni   shitatete miseru kore o mite kure
verses.jp1: このたびハやしきのそふじすきやかに
verses.jp2: したゝてみせるこれをみてくれ
verses.kanji: この度は屋敷の掃除清きやかに   仕立てて見せるこれを見て呉れ
verses.english: This time I am determined to sweep this Residence clean. So watch and see it!

verses.pt: Se ao menos a limpeza for feita completamente, saberão a verdade que será contada e recontada.
verses.en_6th_ed: When this cleaning is thoroughly done, the truth shall be known and it will be told and retold.
verses.ro: soji sai sukiyaka shitaru koto naraba   shirite hanashite hanashi suru nari
verses.jp1: そふじさいすきやかしたる事ならバ
verses.jp2: しりてはなしてはなしするなり
verses.kanji: 掃除さい清きやかしたる事ならば   知りて話して話するなり
verses.english: When I finish this sweeping thoroughly, the truth shall become clearly understood and it will be told and retold.

verses.pt: O que pensam ser o meu pesar de até agora? A deficiência da perna é o meu maior pesar.
verses.en_6th_ed: What is the cause of My regret thus far? The lameness of your leg is My prime regret.
verses.ro: koremade no zannen naru wa nanino koto   ashi no chinba ga ichi no zannen
verses.jp1: これまでのざんねんなるハなにの事
verses.jp2: あしのちんばが一のさんねん
verses.kanji: これ迄の残念なるは何の事   足の跛が一の残念
verses.english: What do you think the reason is for My severe regret thus far? The lameness of the leg is the cause of My prime regret.

verses.pt: Quanto a esta perna, embora estejam dizendo ser doença, não é doença, e sim, a ira de Deus.
verses.en_6th_ed: You are saying that your leg is affected by illness. It is not an illness but the anger of God.
verses.ro: kono ashi wa yamai to yute iru keredo   yamai dewa nai Kami no rippuku
verses.jp1: このあしハやまいとゆうているけれど
verses.jp2: やまいでハない神のりいふく
verses.kanji: この足は病と言うて居るけれど   病では無い神の立腹
verses.english: You are calling it illness. But really it is not an illness.It is indeed the expression of the anger of God.

verses.pt: Esta ira não é uma coisa insignificante, é a conseqüência do seu acúmulo e empilhamento.
verses.en_6th_ed: My anger is not a small matter. It is the result of causes accumulated and piled up.
verses.ro: rippuku mo chotto no koto dewa nai hodoni   tsumori kasanari yue no koto nari
verses.jp1: りいふくも一寸の事でハないほどに
verses.jp2: つもりかさなりゆへの事なり
verses.kanji: 立腹も一寸の事では無い程に   積り重なり故の事なり
verses.english: My anger is not a slight one. It is a result of causes accumulated and piled up.

verses.pt: Se perguntarem o porquê desta ira, é em razão do mal que não foi afastado.
verses.en_6th_ed: To say why it is that I am angry: it is because the wrongdoing has not been removed.
verses.ro: rippuku mo naniyue naru to yu naraba   akuji ga nokan yue no koto nari
verses.jp1: りいふくもなにゆへなるどゆうならハ
verses.jp2: あくじがのかんゆへの事なり
verses.kanji: 立腹も何故なると言うならば   悪事が退かん故の事なり
verses.english: If you ask the reason wherefore I am angry, it is because your wrongdoing has not yet stopped.

verses.pt: Se não afastarem completamente este mal, saibam que será um obstáculo para a construção.
verses.en_6th_ed: Unless this wrongdoing is completely removed, know that it will stand in the way of the construction.
verses.ro: kono akuji sukiyaka noken koto nitewa   fushin no jama ni naru to koso shire
verses.jp1: このあくじすきやかのけん事にてハ
verses.jp2: ふしんのしやまになるとこそしれ
verses.kanji: この悪事清きやか退けん事にては   普請の邪魔になるとこそ知れ
verses.english: Unless this wrongdoing is entirely done away with, it will stand in the way of the construction. Understand it well!

verses.pt: Não importa quão persistente seja este mal, Deus o dominará e mostrará como afastá-lo.
verses.en_6th_ed: No matter how stubborn this wrongdoing may be, it will be removed by the admonishment of God.
verses.ro: kono akuji nanbo shibutoi mono ya tote   Kami ga semekiri nokete miseru de
verses.jp1: このあくじなんぼしぶといものやどて
verses.jp2: 神がせめきりのけてみせるで
verses.kanji: この悪事何ぼしぶとい物やとて   神が責め切り退けて見せるで
verses.english: However obstinate this wrongdoing may be, I, God, will continue to attack and get rid of it.

verses.pt: Se afastarem este mal completamente, a deficiência da perna se curará inteiramente.
verses.en_6th_ed: If this wrongdoing is completely cleared away, the lameness of your leg, also, will be cleared away.
verses.ro: kono akuji sukiyaka noketa koto naraba   ashi no chinba mo sukiyaka to naru
verses.jp1: このあくじすきやかのけた事ならバ
verses.jp2: あしのちんばもすきやかとなる
verses.kanji: この悪事清きやか退けた事ならば   足の跛も清きやかとなる
verses.english: Only if this wrongdoing is entirely done away with, the lameness of the leg will be completely cured.

verses.pt: Se ao menos a perna for curada completamente, depois será somente o preparo da construção.
verses.en_6th_ed: If only your leg is made completely well, nothing will remain but to prepare for the construction.
verses.ro: ashi saika sukiyaka naori shita naraba   ato wa fushin no moyo bakari o
verses.jp1: あしさいかすきやかなをりしたならバ
verses.jp2: あとハふしんのもよふハかりを
verses.kanji: 足さいか清きやか直りしたならば   後は普請の模様ばかりを
verses.english: Only if the lameness of the leg is completely cured, you can devote yourself single-heartedly to arrangements for the construction.

verses.pt: Uma palavra! Delimito o dia trinta do primeiro mês para mandá-la de volta porque é a vontade de Deus.
verses.en_6th_ed: Just a word: returning her by the thirtieth of the first month is also from the mind of God.
verses.ro: choto hanashi shogatsu misoka to hi o kirite   okuru mo Kami no kokoro kara tote
verses.jp1: 一寸はなし正月三十日とひをきりて
verses.jp2: をくるも神の心からとて
verses.kanji: 一寸話正月三十日と日を切りて   送るも神の心からとて
verses.english: Just a word! It is the intention of God to send her back to her home by the thirtieth of the first month.

verses.pt: Embora os próximos estranhem o que estou fazendo, é por não conhecerem os fatos futuros.
verses.en_6th_ed: You close to Me may question what I do. This is because you do not know the future.
verses.ro: soba na mono nani goto suru to omoedomo   saki naru koto o shiran yue nari
verses.jp1: そバなものなに事するとをもへども
verses.jp2: さきなる事をしらんゆへなり
verses.kanji: 側な者何事すると思えども   先なる事を知らん故なり
verses.english: You close to Me may feel strange about what I intend to do, but it is because you cannot foresee what will happen in the future.

verses.pt: Ao chegar esse dia e o fato for visto, os próximos saberão que não há erro algum nas palavras de Deus.
verses.en_6th_ed: When the day arrives and things are seen, you close to Me will know that God's words never err.
verses.ro: sono hi kite mietaru naraba soba na mono   Kami no yu koto nanimo chigawan
verses.jp1: そのひきてみへたるならバそばなもの
verses.jp2: 神のゆう事なにもちがハん
verses.kanji: その日来て見えたるならば側な者   神の言う事何も違わん
verses.english: When the day comes and things appear, you close to Me will understand that what I, God, tell you never proves wrong.

verses.pt: Até agora, duvidando das palavras de Deus, diziam que tudo era mentira.
verses.en_6th_ed: Until now, you have doubted the words of God. You have been saying that they are all false.
verses.ro: imamade wa Kami no yu koto utagote   nanimo uso ya to yute ita nari
verses.jp1: いまゝでハ神のゆう事うたこふて
verses.jp2: なにもうそやとゆうていたなり
verses.kanji: 今迄は神の言う事疑うて   何も嘘やと言うて居たなり
verses.english: So far you have doubted what I, God, have told you. You have been saying that it is all false.

verses.pt: Nas palavras de Deus, que iniciou este mundo, não existe absolutamente um mínimo de erro.
verses.en_6th_ed: Among the words of God, who began this world, there is not even a single mistake in a thousand.
verses.ro: kono yo o hajimeta Kami no yu koto ni   sen ni hitotsu mo chigau koto nashi
verses.jp1: このよふをはじめた神のゆう事に
verses.jp2: せんに一つもちがう事なし
verses.kanji: この世を初めた神の言う事に   千に一つも違う事無し
verses.english: There is not a single mistake even out of a thousand in what I, God, who created this world tell you.

verses.pt: Quando os fatos vierem gradualmente a ser vistos, convençam-se que qualquer espírito, tudo será revelado.
verses.en_6th_ed: If you begin to see this step by step, be convinced. Every kind of mind will all be revealed.
verses.ro: dandan to miete kita nara tokushin se   ikana kokoro mo mina arawareru
verses.jp1: だん／＼とみへてきたならとくしんせ
verses.jp2: いかな心もみなあらハれる
verses.kanji: 段々と見えて来たなら得心せ   如何な心も皆現れる
verses.english: When things appear one by one, become convinced of the truth of My words! Minds of whatever kinds will all appear.

verses.pt: Se observarem o mundo inteiro por todas as épocas, verão que há também vários caminhos.
verses.en_6th_ed: Looking all over the world and through all ages, I see various paths of life.
verses.ro: yorozuyo no sekaiju o miwataseba   michi no shidai mo iroiro ni aru
verses.jp1: よろづよのせかいぢふうをみハたせバ
verses.jp2: みちのしだいもいろ／＼にある
verses.kanji: 万代の世界中を見渡せば   道の次第も色々に有る
verses.english: Looking all over the world and through all ages, I find there are various ways of life.

verses.pt: Doravante, direi alegorizando num caminho, e não digo absolutamente de onde se trata.
verses.en_6th_ed: Hereafter, I shall speak in the metaphor of a path, not indicating any place in particular.
verses.ro: konosaki wa michi ni tatoete hanashi suru   doko no koto tomo sarani yuwan de
verses.jp1: このさきハみちにたとへてはなしする
verses.jp2: どこの事ともさらにゆハんで
verses.kanji: この先は道に例えて話する   何処の事とも更に言わんで
verses.english: From now on I will talk in the metaphor of a road. But I will not indicate any person in particular.

verses.pt: Se transporem ladeiras e montanhas, e sarças espinhosas, e trilhas em precipícios, e espadas...
verses.en_6th_ed: Over steep mountains, through tangles of thorns, along narrow ledges, and through brandished swords, if you come,
verses.ro: yamasaka ya ibara guro mo gakemichi mo   tsurugi no naka mo torinuke tara
verses.jp1: やまさかやいばらぐろふもがけみちも
verses.jp2: つるぎのなかもとふりぬけたら
verses.kanji: 山坂や茨くろも崖道も   剣の中も通り抜けたら
verses.english: Passing over steep mountains and thorny paths, along ledges, and through the blades of swords,

verses.pt: Verão ainda no meio de chamas e abismos profundos. Se os ultrapassarem, terão um caminho estreito.
verses.en_6th_ed: Yet ahead through a sea of flames and a deep abyss, you will arrive at a narrow lane.
verses.ro: mada mieru hi no naka mo ari fuchinaka mo   sore o koshitara hosoi michi ari
verses.jp1: まだみへるひのなかもありふちなかも
verses.jp2: それをこしたらほそいみちあり
verses.kanji: 未だ見える火の中も有り淵中も   それを越したら細い道有り
verses.english: Further, passing through a sea of flame and a deep abyss, you will come to a narrow lane.

verses.pt: Se passarem pelo caminho estreito passo a passo, terão um amplo, que é certamente o real.
verses.en_6th_ed: After following the narrow lane step by step, you will come to a broad way. This is the trustworthy main path.
verses.ro: hosomichi o dandan koseba omichi ya   kore ga tashikana honmichi de aru
verses.jp1: ほそみちをだん／＼こせばをふみちや
verses.jp2: これがたしかなほんみちである
verses.kanji: 細道を段々越せば大道や   これが確かな本道で有る
verses.english: After passing through the narrow lane step by step, you will come to a broad way. This is the trustworthy main road.

verses.pt: Esta narração não é senão a do próprio caso, que é o da devoção única a Deus.
verses.en_6th_ed: This talk is not someone else's concern. It is a matter of your own and your single-heartedness with God.
verses.ro: kono hanashi hoka no koto dewa nai hodoni   Kami ichijo de kore waga koto
verses.jp1: このはなしほかの事でわないほとに
verses.jp2: 神一ぢよでこれわが事
verses.kanji: この話他の事では無い程に   神一条でこれ我が事
verses.english: You must not take this metaphor as other people's concern. This is a matter of My own and of all who go single-heartedly the way of God.

verses.pt: Até agora, era apenas sobre os fatos internos. De agora em diante, mudarei de expressão.
verses.en_6th_ed: Until now, I have spoken solely about matters within. Now, I shall change the topic.
verses.ro: imamade wa uchi naru koto o bakari nari   mo korekara wa monku kawaru zo
verses.jp1: いまゝでハうちなる事をばかりなり
verses.jp2: もふこれからハもんくかハるぞ
verses.kanji: 今迄は内なる事をばかりなり   もうこれからは文句変わるぞ
verses.english: So far I have admonished you about the family affairs alone, but from now on I will change My topic.

verses.pt: Observando o mundo por todas as épocas, não há em absoluto quem seja mau.
verses.en_6th_ed: Looking all over the world and through all ages, I find no one who is evil.
verses.ro: yorozuyo ni sekai no tokoro miwatasedo   ashiki no mono wa sara ni nai zo ya
verses.jp1: よろづよにせかいのところみハたせど
verses.jp2: あしきのものハさらにないぞや
verses.kanji: 万代の世界の所見渡せど   悪しきの者は更に無いぞや
verses.english: Looking all over the world and through all ages, I find no one who is essentially evil.

verses.pt: Entre todos, não há o mau propriamente dito, mas, maculado por um pouco de poeira.
verses.en_6th_ed: Among all humankind, there is no one who is evil. It is only a bit of dust stuck on.
verses.ro: ichiretsu ni ashiki to yute nai keredo   choto no hokori ga tsuita yue nari
verses.jp1: 一れつにあしきとゆうてないけれど
verses.jp2: 一寸のほこりがついたゆへなり
verses.kanji: 一列に悪しきと言うて無いけれど   一寸の埃が付いた故なり
verses.english: Among all mankind, there is no one who is essentially  evil. If there is, it is only because a few specks of dust have stuck to him.

verses.pt: Daqui em diante, reflitam serenando o espírito de maneira que não se arrependam depois.
verses.en_6th_ed: Hereafter, calm your minds and ponder. Make sure you will not be remorseful later.
verses.ro: konosaki wa kokoro shizumete shiyan seyo   ato de kokwai naki yoni seyo
verses.jp1: このさきハ心しづめてしやんせよ
verses.jp2: あとでこふくハいなきよふにせよ
verses.kanji: この先は心静めて思案せよ   後で後悔無き様にせよ
verses.english: Henceforth deeply ponder well with a calm mind so that you need not repent of it afterwards!

verses.pt: Até o presente, nesta longa caminhada da vida, devem ter sentido um tédio muito grande.
verses.en_6th_ed: Long have you wandered on your path until now. You must be very tired of it.
verses.ro: imamade wa nagai dochu michisugara   yohodo taikutsu shita de aro na
verses.jp1: いまゝてハながいどふちふみちすがら
verses.jp2: よほどたいくつしたであろをな
verses.kanji: 今迄は永い道中道すがら   余程退屈したで有ろうな
verses.english: So far you have wandered such a long way. So perhaps you are very tired of it.

verses.pt: Desta vez, o local certo para adoração já surgiu diante da vista. Convençam-se disso.
verses.en_6th_ed: Finally this time, a trustworthy place of worship has begun to appear. Be convinced of it!
verses.ro: konotabi wa mo tashika naru mairisho   miete kita zoe tokushin o seyo
verses.jp1: このたびハもふたしかなるまいりしよ
verses.jp2: みへてきたぞへとくしんをせよ
verses.kanji: この度はもう確かなる参り所   見えて来たぞえ得心をせよ
verses.english: But now a definite place for worship has made its appearance. So be convinced of it!

verses.pt: Doravante, explicando, farei ouvir a longa caminhada da vida. Reflitam profundamente.
verses.en_6th_ed: From now on, I shall teach you about the long journey of humankind. Ponder over it firmly!
verses.ro: korekara wa nagai dochu michisugara   toite kikasuru tokuto shiyan o
verses.jp1: これからハながいどふちふみちすがら
verses.jp2: といてきかするとくとしやんを
verses.kanji: これからは永い道中道すがら   説いて聞かする篤くと思案を
verses.english: From now on I will teach in detail on the long journey of man. Ponder over it seriously!

verses.pt: Doravante, preparo a pacificação interna, pois Deus está apressado.
verses.en_6th_ed: Hereafter, I shall arrange for the settling of matters within. The mind of God is hastening it.
verses.ro: konosaki wa uchi o osameru moyodate   Kami no ho niwa kokoro sekikomu
verses.jp1: このさきハうちをおさめるもよふだて
verses.jp2: 神のほふにハ心せきこむ
verses.kanji: この先は内を治める模様建て   神の方には心急き込む
verses.english: Henceforth I will arrange for settling the family affairs. The mind of God is truly hastening it.

verses.pt: Escutem gradualmente os dizeres de Deus. Não digo nada que seja mau.
verses.en_6th_ed: Please listen to what God tells you step by step, for I shall never tell you anything wrong.
verses.ro: dandan to Kami no yu koto kiite kure   ashiki no koto wa sarani yuwan de
verses.jp1: だん／＼と神のゆふ事きいてくれ
verses.jp2: あしきのことハさらにゆハんで
verses.kanji: 段々と神の言う事聞いて呉れ   悪しきの事は更に言わんで
verses.english: Step by step listen to what I, God, tell you! For I will tell you nothing wrong.

verses.pt: Dizem em educar a criança por dois ou três anos. No entanto, ela está afastada das mãos de Deus.
verses.en_6th_ed: You say that you wish to train the child for two or three more years. But she is no longer in the hands of God.
verses.ro: kono kodomo ni nen san nen shikomo to   yute iredomo Kami no tebanare
verses.jp1: このこ共二ねん三ねんしこもふと
verses.jp2: ゆうていれども神のてはなれ
verses.kanji: この子供二年三年仕込もうと   言うて居れども神の手離れ
verses.english: You say that you wish to train this young one for two or three years. But from this one the hand of God is removed.

verses.pt: Reflitam! Por mais que os pais pensem, nada podem fazer se ela está afastada das mãos de Deus.
verses.en_6th_ed: Ponder well: however dear she may be to you, her parent, you can do nothing if she is out of the hands of God.
verses.ro: shiyan seyo oya ga ika hodo omotemo   Kami no tebanare kore wa kanawan
verses.jp1: しやんせよをやがいかほどをもふても
verses.jp2: 神のてばなれこれハかなハん
verses.kanji: 思案せよ親が如何程思うても   神の手離れこれは敵わん
verses.english: Ponder over it well! However beloved she may be to you parents, when the hand of God is removed from her, you will be powerless.

verses.pt: Por estar o mundo mesclado de maus fatos, não devem impregnar-se de más causalidades.
verses.en_6th_ed: This world is mixed with wrongdoing. You must not attach yourself to bad causation.
verses.ro: kono yo wa akuji majiri de aru karani   innen tsukeru koto wa ikan de
verses.jp1: このよふハあくしまじりであるからに
verses.jp2: いんねんつける事ハいかんで
verses.kanji: この世は悪事混じりで有るからに   因縁付ける事はいかんで
verses.english: This world is mixed with wrongdoing. You must not attach yourself to bad causation.

verses.pt: Embora pense estar já com cinqüenta anos, aos olhos de Deus, ainda há muitos anos.
verses.en_6th_ed: You are thinking that you are already near fifty. Yet in the eyes of God you have many years ahead of you.
verses.ro: waga mi niwa mo goju ya to omoedomo   Kami no me niwa mada saki ga aru
verses.jp2: 神のめへにハまださきがある
verses.english: Although you may think that you are near fifty, yet in the eyes of God you have many years ahead of you.

verses.pt: Os sessenta anos, a partir deste ano, serão assegurados por Deus firmemente.
verses.en_6th_ed: Sixty more years from this year, God promises you with certainty.
verses.ro: kotoshi yori rokuju nen wa shikkari to   Kami no ho niwa shikato ukeyau
verses.jp1: ことしより六十ねんハしいかりと
verses.jp2: 神のほふにハしかとうけやう
verses.kanji: 今年より六十年は確りと   神の方には確と請け合う
verses.english: I, God, guarantee you sixty more years from this year assuredly.

verses.pt: Doravante, reforme firmemente o espírito, espane os maus fatos e tenha uma esposa jovem.
verses.en_6th_ed: From now, replace your mind firmly. Sweep away the wrongdoing and take a young wife.
verses.ro: korekara wa kokoro shikkari irekae yo   akuji harote wakaki nyobo
verses.jp1: これからハ心しいかりいれかへよ
verses.jp2: あくじはろふてハかきによほふ
verses.kanji: これからは心確り入れ替えよ   悪事払うて若き女房
verses.english: From now  on replace your mind definitely, sweep away the wrongdoing, and take a young wife.

verses.pt: Mesmo que isto possa parecer deveras difícil, se Deus sair, voltará trazendo-a.
verses.en_6th_ed: This may seem difficult to do, but God will go forth and receive her without fail.
verses.ro: kore totemo mutsukashi yoni aru keredo   Kami ga deta nara morote kuru zo ya
verses.jp1: これとてもむつかしよふにあるけれど
verses.jp2: 神がでたならもろてくるそや
verses.kanji: これとても難し様に有るけれど   神が出たなら貰ろて来るぞや
verses.english: This may seem difficult, but when I, God, make the request Myself, she will come without fail.

verses.pt: Se dedicar dia a dia o espírito, Eu o incumbirei da direção de todas as coisas posteriores.
verses.en_6th_ed: After you have devoted yourself day by day, I shall leave you entrusted with the management of everything.
verses.ro: nichinichi ni kokoro tsukushita sono ue wa   ato no shihai o yorozu makaseru
verses.jp1: にち／＼に心つくしたそのゑハ
verses.jp2: あとのしはいをよろづまかせる
verses.kanji: 日々に心尽くしたその上は   後の支配を万任せる
verses.english: If you devote yourself to My will day by day, I will entrust you with the management of everthing in the future.

verses.pt: Das cinco pessoas existentes, deixem duas em casa, as outras três ficarão a encargo de Deus.
verses.en_6th_ed: Of the five, keep two at home. God will take charge of the other three.
verses.ro: go nin aru naka no ni nin wa uchi ni oke   ato san nin wa Kami no hikiuke
verses.jp1: 五人あるなかのにゝんハうちにをけ
verses.jp2: あと三人ハ神のひきうけ
verses.kanji: 五人有る中の二人は内に置け   後三人は神の引き受け
verses.english: Of the five young ones, you may keep two at your home, but God will take charge of the other three.

verses.pt: Observando os fatos do mundo por todas as épocas, procurem refletir acalmando o espírito.
verses.en_6th_ed: Look at things in the world and through all ages. Calm your mind and ponder over them.
verses.ro: yorozuyo no sekai no koto o miharashite   kokoro shizumete shiyan shite miyo
verses.jp1: よろづよのせかいの事をみはらして
verses.jp2: 心しづめてしやんしてみよ
verses.kanji: 万代の世界の事を見晴らして   心静めて思案してみよ
verses.english: Looking at things all over the world and through all ages, ponder deeply over them with a calm mind!

verses.pt: Embora até agora também fosse o mundo de Deus, esta é a primeira vez que atuo como intermediário.
verses.en_6th_ed: This has always been the world of God, but it is the first time that I act as a go-between.
verses.ro: imamade mo Kami no sekai de aru keredo   nakadachi suru wa ima ga hajime ya
verses.jp1: いまゝても神のせかいであるけれど
verses.jp2: なかだちするハ今がはじめや
verses.kanji: 今迄も神の世界で有るけれど   仲立ちするは今が初めや
verses.english: It has always been the world of God, yet this is the first time that I act as go-between.

verses.pt: Doravante, as pessoas acharão ridículo. Entretanto, por mais que riam, isto é o mais importante.
verses.en_6th_ed: People will think this is odd. But however much they may laugh, it is of prime importance.
verses.ro: korekara wa sekai no hito wa okashigaru   nanbo warotemo kore ga daiichi
verses.jp1: これからハせかいの人ハをかしがる
verses.jp2: なんぼハろてもこれが大一
verses.kanji: これからは世界の人は可笑しがる   何ぼ笑てもこれが第一
verses.english: People of the world may think this match is odd. But however much they may laugh, this is the matter of prime importance.

verses.pt: As pessoas poderão estranhar o que estou fazendo. Deus deleita-se com o riso dos homens.
verses.en_6th_ed: Perhaps people will say: What are you doing? But the laughter of people will be God's delight.
verses.ro: sekai niwa nani goto suru to yu de aro   hito no warai o Kami ga tanoshimu
verses.jp1: せかいにハなに事するとゆうとであろ
verses.jp2: 人のハらいを神がたのしむ
verses.kanji: 世界には何事すると言うで有ろ   人の笑いを神が楽しむ
verses.english: People will ask: What is all this? Though people will laugh, God will take delight in their laughter.

verses.pt: O pensamento de cada um não está correto. O espírito de Deus é totalmente diferente.
verses.en_6th_ed: The self-centered mind will not do. The mind of God differs entirely.
verses.ro: meme no omou kokoro wa ikan de na   Kami no kokoro wa mina chigau de na
verses.jp1: めへめへのをもふ心ハいかんでな
verses.jp2: 神の心ハみなちがうでな
verses.kanji: 銘々の思う心はいかんでな   神の心は皆違うでな
verses.english: One should not do as one pleases. The intention of God is completely different from that of man.

verses.pt: Protejo-os unindo as predestinações das vidas anteriores. Isto se estabelecerá firme para todo o sempre.
verses.en_6th_ed: I bring you together according to the causality of your previous lives and protect you. This settles the matter for all time.
verses.ro: zensho no innen yosete shugo suru   kore wa matsudai shikato osamaru
verses.jp1: せんしよのいんねんよせてしうごふする
verses.jp2: これハまつだいしかとをさまる
verses.kanji: 前生の因縁寄せて守護する   これは末代確と治まる
verses.english: Uniting the causality of your previous lives, I protect you. This is settled firmly forever.

verses.pt: Doravante, começarei a abrir um amplo caminho e animarei o espírito de todas as pessoas.
verses.en_6th_ed: From now, I shall begin to open a broad path. I shall make all minds in the world spirited.
verses.ro: korekara wa okwan michi o tsuke kakeru   sekai no kokoro mina isameru de
verses.jp1: これからハをくハんみちをつけかける
verses.jp2: せかいの心みないさめるで
verses.kanji: これからは往還道を付け掛ける   世界の心皆勇めるで
verses.english: From now on I will begin to construct a broad way and cheer up the minds of all people of the world.

verses.pt: O espírito dos superiores se animará a qualquer momento. O tempo oportuno tem chegado.
verses.en_6th_ed: Those in high places will come at any moment, spirited in mind. The appointed time has arrived.
verses.ro: kami taru wa kokoro isande kuru hodoni   nandoki ni kuru kokugen ga kita
verses.jp1: 上たるハ心いさんでくるほとに
verses.jp2: なんどきにくるこくけんがきた
verses.kanji: 上たるは心勇んで来る程に   何時に来る刻限が来た
verses.english: The upper people will come at any moment with their minds cheered up. The fixed time has already come.

verses.pt: Colhendo o chá e tendo terminado a sua tosa, o que surge depois é o Serviço Alegre.
verses.en_6th_ed: After the tea is picked and the plants are trimmed, the Joyous Service will follow.
verses.ro: cha tsunde ato karitorite shimota nara   ato i deru no wa Yoki-zutome ya
verses.jp1: ちやつんであとかりとりてしもたなら
verses.jp2: あといでるのハよふきづとめや
verses.kanji: 茶摘んで後刈り取りてしもたなら   後へ出るのは陽気づとめや
verses.english: When you have finished nipping the buds of the tea plant and mowing the leaves, then the Yoki-Zutome, the Joyous Service, will begin.

verses.pt: De onde pensam que virá este Serviço? Os superiores virão a entusiasmar-se.
verses.en_6th_ed: From where do you think this Service comes? The people in high places will become spirited.
verses.ro: kono Tsutome doko kara kuru to omou kana   kami taru tokoro isami kuru zo ya
verses.jp1: このつとめとこからくるとをもうかな
verses.jp2: 上たるところいさみくるぞや
verses.kanji: この勤め何処から来ると思うかな   上たる所勇み来るぞや
verses.english: Where do you think this Service comes from? The upper people will become cheered.

verses.pt: Realizar gradualmente todas as coisas extraordinárias é a providência de Deus.
verses.en_6th_ed: Step by step, the providence of God will bring about every new and marvelous working.
verses.ro: dandan to Kami no shugo to yu mono wa   mezurashi koto o mina shikakeru de
verses.jp1: たん／＼と神のしゆごふとゆうものハ
verses.jp2: めつらし事をみなしかけるで
verses.kanji: 段々と神の守護と言う物は   珍しい事を皆仕掛けるで
verses.english: One by one the protection of God will set out to work any and every remarkable event.

verses.pt: Dia a dia, sobre a instância do espírito de Deus, o que todas as pessoas estão pensando?
verses.en_6th_ed: Day after day, the mind of God hastens. What are all of you thinking of it?
verses.ro: nichinichi ni Kami no kokoro no sekikomi o   mina ichiretsu wa nanto omoteru
verses.jp1: にち／＼に神の心のせきこみを
verses.jp2: みないちれつハなんとをもてる
verses.kanji: 日々に神の心の急き込みを   皆一列は何と思うて居る
verses.english: Day by day the mind of God is impatiently hastening. What are you, all mankind, thinking of it?

verses.pt: Seja no que for, não existem dores nem doenças em absoluto. São a instância e orientação de Deus.
verses.en_6th_ed: Illness and pain of whatever kind do not exist. They are none other than the hastening and guidance of God.
verses.ro: nani nitemo yamai itami wa sarani nashi   Kami no sekikomi tebiki naru zo ya
verses.jp1: なにゝてもやまいいたみハさらになし
verses.jp2: 神のせきこみてびきなるそや
verses.kanji: 何にても病痛みは更に無し   神の急き込み手引きなるぞや
verses.english: Illness and pain of whatever kind do not exist. They are nothing but the hastening and guidance of God.

verses.pt: Se indagarem o porquê da minha instância, é por desejar reunir o pessoal do Serviço.
verses.en_6th_ed: The reason for My hastening, if you should ask, is that I desire performers for the Service.
verses.ro: sekikomi mo naniyue naru to yu naraba   Tsutome no ninju hoshii koto kara
verses.jp1: せきこみもなにゆへなるとゆうならば
verses.jp2: つとめのにんぢうほしい事から
verses.kanji: 急き込みも何故なると言うならば   勤めの人衆欲しい事から
verses.english: The reason why I am so impatiently hastening is that I desire to gather up the members for the Service.

verses.pt: O que estão pensando ser este Serviço? É somente o preparo de todas as salvações.
verses.en_6th_ed: What do you think this Service is? It is none other than the means to universal salvation.
verses.ro: kono Tsutome nanno koto ya to omote iru   yorozu tasuke no moyo bakari o
verses.jp1: このつとめなんの事やとをもている
verses.jp2: よろづたすけのもよふばかりを
verses.kanji: この勤め何の事やと思うて居る   万救けの模様ばかりを
verses.english: What do you think this Service is? It is nothing but the means to save you from any and every distress.

verses.pt: Não julguem ser esta salvação só para o presente. Isto será o Registro para todo o sempre.
verses.en_6th_ed: Do not think this salvation is for the present time alone. It will be the Divine Record for eternity.
verses.ro: kono tasuke ima bakari towa omouna yo   kore matsudai no Koki naru zo ya
verses.jp1: このたすけいまばかりとハをもうなよ
verses.jp2: これまつたいのこふきなるぞや
verses.kanji: この救け今ばかりとは思うなよ   これ末代のこうきなるぞや
verses.english: You must not think this salvation is for the present time alone. It shall be the Koki, the Divine Record, for all ages to come.

verses.pt: Uma palavra! O que estão chamando de delírio ou loucura não é doença, e sim, a instância de Deus.
verses.en_6th_ed: Just a word: you are saying that it is a fit or madness. It is not an illness but the urging of God.
verses.ro: choto hanashi nobose kanteki yute iru   yamai dewa nai Kami no sekikomi
verses.jp1: 一寸はなしのぼせかんてきゆうている
verses.jp2: やまいでハない神のせきこみ
verses.kanji: 一寸話逆上せかんてき言うて居る   病では無い神の急き込み
verses.english: Just a word! You say that it is a fit or a distraction. It is not an illness, but the impatient urging of God.

verses.pt: Tenho explicado gradualmente sobre a verdade, a intenção única de Deus, mas ainda não entendem.
verses.en_6th_ed: Step by step, I have taught the truth of single-heartedness with God, but you still do not understand.
verses.ro: dandan to shinjitsu Kami no ichijo o   toite kikasedo mada wakari nai
verses.jp1: たん／＼としんぢつ神の一ちよふ
verses.jp2: といてきかせどまだハかりない
verses.kanji: 段々と真実神の一条を   説いて聞かせど未だ分かり無い
verses.english: Step by step I have taught the true way of single-hearted devotion to God. But you have not comprehended it yet.

verses.pt: Embora Eu deseje sair logo ao mundo, se não há caminho, mesmo querendo, não posso sair.
verses.en_6th_ed: Though I desire to go forth into the open quickly, I cannot do so because there is no path.
verses.ro: hayabaya to omote deyo to omoedomo   michi ga note wa deru ni deraren
verses.jp1: はや／＼とをもてでよふとをもへとも
verses.jp2: みちがのふてハでるにでられん
verses.kanji: 早々と表出ようと思えども   道が無うては出るに出られん
verses.english: I desire to go out to the fore quickly, but I cannot do so, because there is no way.

verses.pt: Embora deseje abrir logo este caminho, não existe outro local onde possa abri-lo.
verses.en_6th_ed: Though I desire to open this path quickly, there is no place else to open it.
verses.ro: kono michi o hayaku tsukeyo to omoedomo   hoka naru toko de tsukeru toko nashi
verses.jp1: このみちをはやくつけよとをもへとも
verses.jp2: ほかなるとこでつけるとこなし
verses.kanji: この道を早く付けようと思えども   他なる所で付ける所無し
verses.english: I desire to construct this way quickly, but there is no other place to begin it.

verses.pt: Se pensam sinceramente sobre este caminho, reflitam do íntimo do coração sobre todas as coisas.
verses.en_6th_ed: If you are sincere in desiring this path to be, ponder over everything from your innermost heart.
verses.ro: kono michi o shinjitsu omou koto naraba   mune no uchi yori yorozu shiyan se
verses.jp1: このみちをしんぢつをもう事ならば
verses.jp2: むねのうちよりよろづしやんせ
verses.kanji: この道を真実思う事ならば   胸の内より万思案せ
verses.english: If you sincerely think of this way, you should ponder over any and everything from your innermost heart.

verses.pt: O que estão pensando serem estas explanações? É a instância em ter os locais para a transmissão de Deus.
verses.en_6th_ed: What do you think this talk is about? I am hastening for the places where God's truth is conveyed.
verses.ro: kono hanashi nanno koto ya to omote iru   Kami no uchiwake basho sekikomu
verses.jp1: このはなしなんの事やとをもている
verses.jp2: 神のうちわけばしよせきこむ
verses.kanji: この話何の事やと思うて居る   神の打ち分け場所を急き込む
verses.english: What do you think I am talking about?  I am in haste to found the uchiwake-basho of God.

verses.pt: Quando este caminho se tornar um pouco visível, o espírito de todas as pessoas ficará animado.
verses.en_6th_ed: When this path can be seen, even a little, all minds in the world will become spirited.
verses.ro: kono michi ga choto miekaketa koto naraba   sekai no kokoro mina isami deru
verses.jp1: このみちが一寸みゑかけた事ならば
verses.jp2: せかいの心みないさみてる
verses.kanji: この道が一寸見え掛けた事ならば   世界の心皆勇み出る
verses.english: When this way begins to come into sight even a little, the minds of all people of the world will become cheered up.

verses.pt: Seja em que for, ouçam bem as palavras de Deus. Se a limpeza da Residência for completada...
verses.en_6th_ed: Listen to whatever God says! If only the cleaning of the Residence is completed,
verses.ro: nani nitemo Kami no yu koto shikato kike   yashiki no soji deketa koto nara
verses.jp1: なにゝても神のゆう事しかときけ
verses.jp2: やしきのそふぢでけた事なら
verses.kanji: 何にても神の言う事確と聞け   屋敷の掃除出来た事なら
verses.english: Listen attentively to whatever I, God, say! I desire to complete the sweeping of the Residence.

verses.pt: Já será visto. Sem ter tempo para um relance, as poeiras desaparecerão como um sonho.
verses.en_6th_ed: It will soon be seen. Without a moment to look aside, the dust will disappear as if you were dreaming.
verses.ro: mo mieru yokome furu ma mo nai hodoni   yume mita yoni hokori chiru zo ya
verses.jp1: もふみへるよこめふるまないほどに
verses.jp2: ゆめみたよふにほこりちるぞや
verses.kanji: もう見える横目振る間も無い程に   夢見た様に埃散るぞや
verses.english: Soon it will come into sight, without a moment to look aside. The dust will be blown away as in a dream.

verses.pt: Se espanarem completamente estas poeiras, após haverá a dedicação única a todas as salvações.
verses.en_6th_ed: When this dust is completely swept away, nothing will remain but universal salvation.
verses.ro: kono hokori sukiyaka harota koto naraba   ato wa yorozu no tasuke ichijo
verses.jp1: このほこりすきやかはろた事ならば
verses.jp2: あとハよろづのたすけ一ちよ
verses.kanji: この埃清きやか払ろうた事ならば   後は万の救け一条
verses.english: When this dust is completely swept away, nothing will be left but the single-hearted salvation of any  and everything.

verses.pt: Doravante, apressando gradualmente o Serviço, desejo somente o preparo de todas as salvações.
verses.en_6th_ed: Hereafter, I shall hasten the Service step by step, preparing only for universal salvation.
verses.ro: konosaki wa dandan Tsutome sekikonde   yorozu tasuke no moyo bakari o
verses.jp1: このさきハたん／＼つとめせきこんで
verses.jp2: よろづたすけのもよふばかりを
verses.kanji: この先は段々勤め急き込んで   万救けの模様ばかりを
verses.english: Henceforth step by step I will hasten to perform the Service, and prepare single-heartedly for the salvation of any and everything.

verses.pt: No mundo, dizem sofrer-se de males e dores, sem saberem que são indicações e orientações de Deus.
verses.en_6th_ed: Illness and pain throughout the world: you do not know that these are the road signs or guidance of God.
verses.ro: sekaiju doko ga ashiki ya itamisho   Kami no michiose tebiki shirazu ni
verses.jp1: せかいぢうとこがあしきやいたみしよ
verses.jp2: 神のみちをせてびきしらすに
verses.kanji: 世界中何処が悪しきや痛み所   神の道教え手引き知らずに
verses.english: In the whole world it is said that some part of the body is afflicted or painful. It is truly a signpost or guidance of God, though you are ignorant of it.

verses.pt: No mundo, nada há que possa ser chamado de doença. Reflitam sobre todos os incômodos no corpo.
verses.en_6th_ed: There is nothing in this world that should be called illness. Whenever there is a disorder of the body, ponder deeply.
verses.ro: kono yoni yamai to yute nai hodoni   minouchi sawari mina shiyan seyo
verses.jp1: このよふにやまいとゆうてないほどに
verses.jp2: みのうちさハりみなしやんせよ
verses.kanji: この世に病と言うて無い程に   身の内障り皆思案せよ
verses.english: There is nothing in the world indeed that can be called illness. Whenever any disorder may happen in the body, you must ponder over it deeply.

verses.pt: A instância diária de Deus está nesta salvação. O que todas as pessoas estão pensando?
verses.en_6th_ed: Day after day, God is hastening this salvation. What are all of you thinking about it?
verses.ro: nichinichi ni Kami no sekikomi kono tasuke   mina ichiretsu wa nanto omoteru
verses.jp1: にち／＼に神のせきこみこのたすけ
verses.jp2: みな一れつハなんとをもてる
verses.kanji: 日々に神の急き込みこの救け   皆一列は何と思うてる
verses.english: Day by day God is in haste to save you all. But what are youall thinking of it?

verses.pt: Mesmo a água nascida no lago dos altos montes, torna-se suja e cheia de ciscos no seu jorrar.
verses.en_6th_ed: Though it is springwater that fills the pond in the high mountains, yet at its spout, it is mixed with mud.
verses.ro: takayama no oike ni waita mizu naredo   debana wa nigori gomoku majiri de
verses.jp1: 高山のをいけにハいた水なれど
verses.jp2: てバなハにこりごもくまぢりで
verses.kanji: 高山のお池に湧いた水なれど   出端は濁りごもく混りで
verses.english: Though it is the water that springs forth in a pond in the high mountains, yet as it gushes out it is mixed with dirt.

verses.pt: Quando refletirem acalmando gradualmente o espírito, a água se tornará límpida.
verses.en_6th_ed: When you calm your mind step by step and ponder, it will change into clear water.
verses.ro: dandan to kokoro shizumete shiyan suru   sundaru mizu to kawari kuru zo ya
verses.jp1: だん／＼と心しづめてしやんする
verses.jp2: すんだる水とかハりくるぞや
verses.kanji: 段々と心静めて思案する   澄んだる水と変わり来るぞや
verses.english: But when you calm down your heart by degrees and ponder, it will change into clear water.

verses.pt: Penetrando nas águas das montanhas adentro, purificarei toda e qualquer água.
verses.en_6th_ed: I shall go into the water in the mountains and make it clear, whatever kind of water it may be.
verses.ro: yama naka no mizu no naka i to irikonde   ika naru mizu mo sumasu koto nari
verses.jp1: 山なかのみづのなかいと入こんで
verses.jp2: いかなる水もすます事なり
verses.kanji: 山中の水の中へと入り込んで   如何なる水も澄ます事なり
verses.english: I will go into the water in the mountains and make it clear, whatever kind of water it may be.

verses.pt: As pessoas que dedicam o espírito dia a dia, devem pacificar o coração e terão um futuro promissor.
verses.en_6th_ed: You who are devoting yourselves day after day, settle the heart. Then a promising future will be yours.
verses.ro: nichinichi ni kokoro tsukusuru sono kata wa   mune o osame yo sue wa tanomoshi
verses.jp1: にち／＼に心つくするそのかたわ
verses.jp2: むねをふさめよすゑハたのもし
verses.kanji: 日々に心尽くするその方は   胸を納めよ末は頼もし
verses.english: Devoting yourself to the way day by day, set your heart at peace, then a promising future will be yours.

verses.pt: De agora em diante, mergulharei no lago dos altos montes e limparei qualquer sujeira.
verses.en_6th_ed: From now, I shall plunge into the pond in the high mountains and clear it of mud, whatever kind it may be.
verses.ro: korekara wa takayama ike i tobihairi   ikana gomoku mo soji suru nari
verses.jp1: これからハ高山いけいとびはいり
verses.jp2: いかなごもくもそうぢするなり
verses.kanji: これからは高山池へ飛び入り   如何なごもくも掃除するなり
verses.english: From now on I will plunge into the pond in the high mountains and will clear the water of dirt, whatever kind itmay be.

verses.pt: Se as sujeiras forem retiradas completamente, as águas posteriores serão límpidas.
verses.en_6th_ed: If I only remove the mud from it completely, the remaining water will be clear.
verses.ro: gomoku sai sukiyaka dashite shimota nara   ato naru mizu wa sunde aru nari
verses.jp1: こもくさいすきやかだしてしもたなら
verses.jp2: あとなる水ハすんであるなり
verses.kanji: ごもくさい清きやか出してしもたなら   後なる水は澄んで有るなり
verses.english: If I just take out the dirt completely, the remaining water will be all clear.

verses.pt: Doravante, direi sobre a região dos não-esclarecidos e a dos esclarecidos. O que quer que diga, poderão não entender.
verses.en_6th_ed: From now on, I shall talk about Kara and Nihon. You may not understand whatever I tell you.
verses.ro: korekara wa kara to nihon no hanashi suru   nani o yu tomo wakari arumai
verses.jp1: これからハからとにほんのはなしする
verses.jp2: なにをゆうともハかりあるまい
verses.kanji: これからは唐と日本の話する   何を言うとも分かり有るまい
verses.english: From now on I will tell you about the region where My teachings shall spread later, and the region where My teachings spread early. Perhaps you cannot easily understand what it really means.

verses.pt: Os não-esclarecidos, entrando na região dos esclarecidos e agindo à vontade, provocam a ira de Deus.
verses.en_6th_ed: Those of Kara have entered Nihon and their willful acts cause the anger of God.
verses.ro: tojin ga nihon no jii i irikonde   mamani suru no ga Kami no rippuku
verses.jp1: とふぢんがにほんのぢいゝ入こんで
verses.jp2: まゝにするのが神のりいふく
verses.kanji: 唐人が日本の地へ入り込んで   侭にするのが神の立腹
verses.english: The people who will understand My teachings later have entered into the region where My teachings spread early and are doing as they please. This is the cause of the anger of God.

verses.pt: Dispondo-se gradualmente a salvar a região dos esclarecidos, Deus fará à sua vontade com os não-esclarecidos.
verses.en_6th_ed: Step by step, I am preparing to save Nihon. God will deal with those of Kara as God wishes.
verses.ro: dandan to nihon tasukeru moyodate   tojin Kami no mamani suru nari
verses.jp1: たん／＼とにほんたすけるもよふだて
verses.jp2: とふじん神のまゝにするなり
verses.kanji: 段々と日本救ける模様建て   唐人神の侭にするなり
verses.english: Step by step I am preparing to save those in the region where My teachings spread early. I will make those who will understand My teachings later comprehend them as freely as, I, God, wish.

verses.pt: Doravante, distinguirei entre a região dos não-esclarecidos e a dos esclarecidos. Quando houver esta distinção, o mundo se pacificará.
verses.en_6th_ed: Hereafter, I shall make a distinction between Kara and Nihon. When it is done, the world will settle.
verses.ro: konosaki wa kara to nihon o wakeru de na   kore wakaritara sekai osamaru
verses.jp1: このさきハからとにほんをハけるてな
verses.jp2: これハかりたらせかいをさまる
verses.kanji: この先は唐と日本を分けるでな   これ分かりたら世界治まる
verses.english: Henceforth I will make the distinction between the region where My teachings spread early and the region where My teachings shall spread later. When it is done, peace shall be realized in the world.

verses.pt: Até agora, os superiores, sem entenderem a verdade, vieram pensando que fosse do nível comum.
verses.en_6th_ed: Until now, those in high places have not understood. They thought My teachings to be worldly common.
verses.ro: imamade wa kami taru kokoro wakaraide   sekainami ya to omote ita nari
verses.jp1: いまゝでハ上たる心ハからいで
verses.jp2: せかいなみやとをもていたなり
verses.kanji: 今迄は上たる心分からいで   世界並やと思うて居たなり
verses.english: Until now the upper people have been unable to understand Me. They thought My teachings to be worldly common.

verses.pt: Doravante, Deus introduzindo-se no corpo, distinguirá claramente o espírito.
verses.en_6th_ed: From now, God will enter their bodies and make the distinction clear in their minds.
verses.ro: korekara wa Kami ga tainai irikonde   kokoro sumiyaka wakete miseru de
verses.jp1: これからハ神がたいない入こんで
verses.jp2: 心すみやかわけてみせるで
verses.kanji: これからは神が体内入り込んで   心速やか分けて見せるで
verses.english: From now on I will enter into their bodies and make them understand Me by purifying their minds.

verses.pt: Se rejeitarem as pessoas que se reúnem diariamente, o número delas aumentará gradualmente mais ainda.
verses.en_6th_ed: Though you turn away those who come day by day, their number will only increase step by step.
verses.ro: nichinichi ni yorikuru hito ni kotowari o   yueba dandan naomo masu de
verses.jp1: にち／＼によりくる人にことハりを
verses.jp2: ゆへばだん／＼なをもまあすで
verses.kanji: 日々に寄り来る人に断りを   言えば段々尚も増すで
verses.english: Even if you turn away people who come day by day, their number will increase steadily.

verses.pt: Embora sejam numerosas as pessoas que chegam, não se preocupem, pois Deus se encarregará.
verses.en_6th_ed: No matter how great a number of people may come, do not worry, for it is in the hands of God.
verses.ro: ika hodono oku no hito ga kitaru tomo   nanimo anjina Kami no hikiuke
verses.jp1: いかほどのをふくの人がきたるとも
verses.jp2: なにもあんぢな神のひきうけ
verses.kanji: 如何程の多くの人が来たるとも   何も案じな神の引き受け
verses.english: However many people may come here, fear nothing! Because Godis taking in charge of it.

verses.pt: O Kanrodai extraordinário do início do mundo estabelecerá a paz na região dos esclarecidos.
verses.en_6th_ed: Marvelous is the Kanrodai of this world's beginning. It will be the cause of peace in Nihon.
verses.ro: mezurashii kono yo hajime no Kanrodai   kore ga nihon no osamari to naru
verses.jp1: めつらしいこのよはじめのかんろたい
verses.jp2: これがにほんのをさまりとなる
verses.kanji: 珍しいこの世初めの甘露台   これが日本の治まりとなる
verses.english: How remarkable the Kanrodai is! It is indeed the proof of the creation of this world. And it shall be the cause of thepeace over the region where My teachings spread early.

verses.pt: Nos altos montes, estão à vista o fogo e a água. Será que não há olhos capazes de vê-los?
verses.en_6th_ed: I can see fire and water in the high mountains. Can you not see this with your own eyes?
verses.ro: takayama ni hii to mizu to ga miete aru   tare ga me nimo kore ga mien ka
verses.jp1: 高山に火と水とがみへてある
verses.jp2: たれがめへにもこれがみへんか
verses.kanji: 高山に火と水とが見えて有る   誰が目にもこれが見えんか
verses.english: On the high mountains, fire and water are coming into sight. Can you not see them with your own eyes?

verses.pt: Tenho feito gradualmente quaisquer explanações, pois antevejo todos os acontecimentos seguramente.
verses.en_6th_ed: Step by step, I have given you teachings on every matter, for I have seen what is certain.
verses.ro: dandan to ikana hanashi mo toite aru   tashikana koto ga miete aru kara
verses.jp1: たん／＼といかなはなしもといてある
verses.jp2: たしかな事がみゑてあるから
verses.kanji: 段々と如何な話も説いて有る   確かな事が見えて有るから
verses.english: Step by step I have foretold you everything that is happening, because I have foreseen it with certainty.

verses.pt: Como me preocupo em dar uma maior felicidade, ela se impregnará plenamente. Tenham prazer.
verses.en_6th_ed: Everything has been fully arranged for your happiness. Look forward to it!
verses.ro: shiyawase o yoki yoni tote jubun ni   mi ni tsuite kuru kore o tanoshime
verses.jp1: しやハせをよきよふにとてじうぶんに
verses.jp2: みについてくるこれをたのしめ
verses.kanji: 幸せを良き様にとて十分に   身に着いて来るこれを楽しめ
verses.english: For your happiness, good luck will stick to your person in full. Enjoy yourself with this expectation!

verses.pt: Se tiverem desmedida ambição em tudo, a ira de Deus será vista.
verses.en_6th_ed: If you indulge in extreme greed, the anger of God will begin to appear.
verses.ro: nanimo kamo goyoku tsukushi sono ue wa   Kami no rippuku miete kuru zo ya
verses.jp1: なにもかもごふよくつくしそのゆへハ
verses.jp2: 神のりいふくみへてくるぞや
verses.kanji: 何もかも強欲尽くしその上は   神の立腹見えて来るぞや
verses.english: If one indulges in greediness in any and everything, then the anger of God will be manifested.

verses.pt: Gradualmente, a partir do dia quinze começará a ser visto. Todo o bem e o mal será revelado.
verses.en_6th_ed: Step by step, from the fifteenth day, you will begin to see it. Good and evil will both appear.
verses.ro: dandan to ju go nichi yori miekakeru   zen to aku towa mina arawareru
verses.jp1: たん／＼と十五日よりみゑかける
verses.jp2: 善とあくとハみなあらハれる
verses.kanji: 段々と十五日より見え掛ける   善と悪とは皆現れる
verses.english: Step by step on the fifteenth day it will begin to emerge. Good and evil will both appear.

verses.pt: Não digo de onde se trata esta explanação. Convençam-se todos quando tornar-se visível.
verses.en_6th_ed: By this talk, I do not indicate anyone in particular. Become convinced, all of you, when it is seen.
verses.ro: kono hanashi doko no koto tomo yuwan de na   miete kitareba mina tokushin se
verses.jp1: このはなしとこの事ともゆハんてな
verses.jp2: みへてきたればみなとくしんせ
verses.kanji: この話何処の事とも言わんでな   見えて来たれば皆得心せ
verses.english: By this talk I do not indicate any place in particular. All of you should understand the truth when it appears.

verses.pt: O preparo para distinguir entre os esclarecidos e os não-esclarecidos dos altos montes é também pelo pilar.
verses.en_6th_ed: Among the high mountains, the distinction between those of Nihon and those of Kara is also to be made by the pillar.
verses.ro: takayama no nihon no mono to tojin to   wakeru moyo mo kore mo hashira ya
verses.jp1: 高山のにほんのものととふぢんと
verses.jp2: わけるもよふもこれもはしらや
verses.kanji: 高山の日本の者と唐人と   分ける模様もこれも柱や
verses.english: I am preparing to distinguish between those who understand My teachings early and those who will understand My teachings later on the high mountains. This shall be accomplished also by virtue of the pillar.

verses.pt: Quanto à distinção entre os não-esclarecidos e os esclarecidos, distinguirei colocando o fogo e a água.
verses.en_6th_ed: In distinguishing between those of Kara and those of Nihon, I shall use fire and water to make the distinction.
verses.ro: tojin to nihon no mono to wakeru no wa   hii to mizu to o irete wakeru de
verses.jp1: とふじんとにほんのものとハけるのハ
verses.jp2: 火と水とをいれてハけるで
verses.kanji: 唐人と日本の者と分けるのは   火と水とを入れて分けるで
verses.english: Using fire and water, I will distinguish between those who understand My teachings early and those who will understand My teachings later.

verses.pt: Desta vez, retirem urgente e rapidamente as construções do lado interno do portão.
verses.en_6th_ed: At this time, set about quickly to clear away the structure from within the gate.
verses.ro: konotabi wa mon no uchi yori tachimono o   hayaku isoide toriharai seyo
verses.jp1: このたびハもんのうちよりたちものを
verses.jp2: はやくいそいでとりはらいせよ
verses.kanji: この度は門の内より建ち物を   早く急いで取り払いせよ
verses.english: This time quickly clear away the hut from within the gate!

verses.pt: Terminando completamente a limpeza, peço esticar urgentemente as cordas demarcatórias.
verses.en_6th_ed: When you have completed the sweeping, please rope off the ground plan quickly.
verses.ro: sukiyaka ni soji shitateta koto naraba   nawamune isogi tanomi iru zo ya
verses.jp1: すきやかにそふぢしたてた事ならば
verses.jp2: なハむねいそぎたのみいるそや
verses.kanji: 清きやかに掃除仕立てた事ならば   縄棟急ぎ頼み入るぞや
verses.english: I request that, after you have accomplished the sweeping thoroughly, you quickly stretch a straw rope as a sign of the ground plan.

verses.pt: Feita a limpeza com sinceridade, o espírito se animará com devoção única a Deus.
verses.en_6th_ed: After you have truly finished the sweeping, your mind will be spirited by being single-hearted with God.
verses.ro: shinjitsu ni soji o shitaru sono nochi wa   Kami ichijo de kokoro isamuru
verses.jp1: しんぢつにそふぢをしたるそのゝちハ
verses.jp2: 神一ぢよで心いさむる
verses.kanji: 真実に掃除をしたるその後は   神一条で心勇むる
verses.english: After the sweeping is truly finished, you shall go on the way of single-hearted devotion to God and your mind shall become cheered up.

verses.pt: Se o espírito de todas as pessoas se animar gradualmente, isto estabelecerá a paz na região dos esclarecidos.
verses.en_6th_ed: When the minds of the world are spirited step by step, peace will come to Nihon.
verses.ro: dandan to sekai no kokoro isamu nara   kore ga nihon no osamari to naru
verses.jp1: だん／＼とせかいの心いさむなら
verses.jp2: これがにほんのをさまりとなる
verses.kanji: 段々と世界の心勇むなら   これが日本の治まりとなる
verses.english: When the minds of the world become cheered up step by step, peace shall be realized in the region where My teachings spread early.

verses.pt: Até agora, não entenderam coisa alguma. Doravante, os sinais maravilhosos serão vistos.
verses.en_6th_ed: Until now, you have understood nothing, but from now on you will see wondrous signs.
verses.ro: imamade wa nani yono koto mo wakari nai   korekara mieru fushigi aizu ga
verses.jp1: いまゝでハなによの事もハかりない
verses.jp2: これからみゑるふしぎあいづが
verses.kanji: 今迄は何よの事も分かり無い   これから見える不思議合図が
verses.english: Hitherto nothing has been truly known. But from now on marvellous signs shall come into sight.

verses.pt: Não forçarei a vir aquele que não quer. Se vierem a seguir-me, estarão bem para sempre.
verses.en_6th_ed: I do not force you to come along if you do not wish to, but if you should, you will be blessed forever.
verses.ro: kon mono ni muri ni koi towa yu de nashi   tsukikuru naraba itsu made mo yoshi
verses.jp1: こんものにむりにこいとハゆうでなし
verses.jp2: つきくるならばいつまでもよし
verses.kanji: 来ん者に無理に来いとは言うで無し   付き来るならば何時迄も良し
verses.english: I never compel you to come along with Me when you do not want to come. But if you do come along, it will be good forever.

verses.pt: Doravante, explicarei alegorizando em água. Compreenderão através das palavras “pura” e “suja”.
verses.en_6th_ed: From now on, I shall speak in the metaphor of water. Be enlightened by the words "clear" and "muddy.
verses.ro: korekara wa mizu ni tatoete hanashi suru   sumu to nigori de satori toru nari
verses.jp1: これからハ水にたとゑてはなしする
verses.jp2: すむとにごりでさとりとるなり
verses.kanji: これからは水に例えて話する   澄むと濁りで悟り取るなり
verses.english: From now on I will talk in the metaphor of water. Realize the truth by the word clear or muddy!

verses.pt: A verdadeira instância do espírito de Deus é o desejo de colocar depressa o pilar central.
verses.en_6th_ed: Truly, the hastening in the mind of God is to put in the central pillar quickly.
verses.ro: shinjitsu ni Kami no kokoro no sekikomi wa   shin no hashira o hayaku iretai
verses.jp1: しんぢつに神の心のせきこみわ
verses.jp2: しんのはしらをはやくいれたい
verses.kanji: 真実に神の心の急き込みは   真の柱を早く入れたい
verses.english: The mind of God is truly hastening to take in the central pillar as quickly as possible.

verses.pt: Embora pense em colocar depressa este pilar, não posso reconhecer o lugar, pois a água está suja.
verses.en_6th_ed: Though I desire to put in the pillar quickly, I cannot find where to put it because of the muddy water.
verses.ro: kono hashira hayaku ireyo to omoedomo   nigori no mizu de tokoro wakaran
verses.jp1: このはしらはやくいれよとをもへども
verses.jp2: にごりの水でところわからん
verses.kanji: この柱早く入れようと思えども   濁りの水で所分からん
verses.english: Though I desire to take in this pillar quickly, I cannot find a place to put it because of the muddy water.

verses.pt: Preparem depressa a purificação desta água. Purifiquem-na passando pelo filtro e areia.
verses.en_6th_ed: Arrange to clear this water quickly. Purify it by using a filter and sand.
verses.ro: kono mizu o hayaku sumasuru moyodate   suino to suna ni kakete sumase yo
verses.jp1: この水をはやくすまするもよふだて
verses.jp2: すいのとすなにかけてすませよ
verses.kanji: この水を早く澄まする模様建て   水嚢と砂に掛けて澄ませよ
verses.english: To make arrangements for quickly clearing this water, purify it using a filter and sand!

verses.pt: Não pensem onde se encontra este filtro. O coração e a boca são a areia e o filtro.
verses.en_6th_ed: Do not wonder where this filter can be found. Your heart and mouth are the sand and filter.
verses.ro: kono suino doko ni aru ya to omouna yo   mune to kuchi to ga suna to suino ya
verses.jp1: このすいのどこにあるやとをもうなよ
verses.jp2: むねとくちとがすなとすいのや
verses.kanji: この水嚢何処に有るやと思うなよ   胸と口とが砂と水嚢や
verses.english: Never worry about where this filter can be found! Heart and mouth are the sand and the filter.

verses.pt: Se compreenderem prontamente estas palavras, colocarei imediatamente o pilar central.
verses.en_6th_ed: If you quickly understand this talk, I shall put in the central pillar at once.
verses.ro: kono hanashi sumiyaka satori tsuita nara   sono mama ireru shin no hashira o
verses.jp1: このはなしすみやかさとりついたなら
verses.jp2: そのまゝいれるしんのはしらを
verses.kanji: この話速やか悟り付いたなら   その侭入れる真の柱を
verses.english: As soon as you comprehend this talk, I will take in the central pillar at once.

verses.pt: Se ao menos este pilar for colocado firmemente, o mundo virá a pacificar-se certamente.
verses.en_6th_ed: If only the pillar is firmly established, the whole world will truly settle.
verses.ro: hashira sai shikkari ireta koto naraba   kono yo tashikani osamari ga tsuku
verses.jp1: はしらさいしいかりいれた事ならば
verses.jp2: このよたしかにをさまりがつく
verses.kanji: 柱さい確り入れた事ならば   この世確かに治まりが付く
verses.english: If only I have firmly settled this pillar, peace shall surely reign all over the world.

verses.pt: Estas palavras requerem apenas a compreensão. Quando as entenderem, terão a prova evidente.
verses.en_6th_ed: This talk requires only your enlightenment. With enlightenment will come tested proof.
verses.ro: kono hanashi satori bakari de aru hodoni   kore satoritara shoko dameshi ya
verses.jp1: このはなしさとりばかりであるほどに
verses.jp2: これさとりたらしよこだめしや
verses.kanji: この話悟りばかりで有る程に   これ悟りたら証拠試しや
verses.english: This talk solely rquires your spiritual awakening. If you can comprehend the truth, I will produce the evidence through a test.

verses.pt: Sou o Deus que iniciou os seres humanos do mundo, porém, não existe quem me conheça.
verses.en_6th_ed: I am God of Origin, who began the human beings of this world. Yet there may be no one who knows Me.
verses.ro: kono yo no ningen hajime moto no Kami   tare mo shiritaru mono wa arumai
verses.jp1: このよふのにんけんはじめもとの神
verses.jp2: たれもしりたるものハあるまい
verses.kanji: この世の人間初め元の神   誰も知りたる者は有るまい
verses.english: I am the original God who created human beings of this world. Yet, perhaps there may be no one who knows Me.

verses.pt: Do mar de lama, comecei a ensinar a providência, e isso tem-se desenvolvido gradualmente.
verses.en_6th_ed: I began to teach My providence in the muddy ocean, and you have come to prosper step by step.
verses.ro: doroumi no naka yori shugo oshiekake   sore ga dandan sakan naru zo ya
verses.jp1: どろうみのなかよりしゆごふをしへかけ
verses.jp2: それがたん／＼さかんなるぞや
verses.kanji: 泥海の中より守護教え掛け   それが段々盛んなるぞや
verses.english: I began to teach My providence in the muddy ocean. And then step by step you have grown to your present prosperity.

verses.pt: Desta vez, ao ensinar a dedicação única à salvação, estou também iniciando um fato inexistente.
verses.en_6th_ed: This time, I teach single-hearted salvation, beginning once more that which never existed.
verses.ro: konotabi wa tasuke ichijo oshieru mo   kore mo nai koto hajime kakeru de
verses.jp1: このたびハたすけ一ぢよをしゑるも
verses.jp2: これもない事はしめかけるで
verses.kanji: この度は救け一条教えるも   これも無い事初め掛けるで
verses.english: This time also, in order to teach the way of single-hearted salvation, I am going to initiate things which have never existed before.

verses.pt: O fato de começar algo inexistente até agora, é porque sou o Deus criador da origem.
verses.en_6th_ed: I begin things which have never existed, because I am God, who made the origin.
verses.ro: imamade ni nai koto hajime kakeru no wa   moto koshiraeta Kami de aru kara
verses.jp1: いまゝでにない事はじめかけるのわ
verses.jp2: もとこしらゑた神であるから
verses.kanji: 今迄に無い事初め掛けるのは   元拵えた神で有るから
verses.english: I am going to initiate things which have never existed before, because I am the God who created this world in the beginning.

verses.pt: Embora, no dia-a-dia, as palavras de Deus estejam acumuladas, não posso transmiti-las, mesmo querendo.
verses.en_6th_ed: Day after day, the words of God pile up mountainously, stuck in My throat. I cannot speak them, though I so desire.
verses.ro: nichinichi ni Kami no hanashi ga yamayama to   tsukaete aredo toku ni tokaren
verses.jp1: にち／＼に神のはなしがやま／＼と
verses.jp2: つかゑてあれどとくにとかれん
verses.kanji: 日々に神の話が山々と   痞えて有れど説くに説かれん
verses.english: Day after day the words of God stick in My throat. I cannot teach them although there is much I wish to say.

verses.pt: Embora nada haja que não possa ser explicado, não há quem me ouça purificando o espírito.
verses.en_6th_ed: There is nothing that I cannot teach, but there is no one who listens with a purified mind.
verses.ro: nani nitemo tokaren koto wa nai keredo   kokoro sumashite kiku mono wa nai
verses.jp1: なにゝてもとかれん事ハないけれど
verses.jp2: 心すましてきくものハない
verses.kanji: 何にても説かれん事は無いけれど   心澄まして聞く者は無い
verses.english: It is not impossible to teach any and everything. But there is no one who listens with a purified mind.

verses.pt: Se purificarem prontamente o espírito e me ouvirem, farei as explicações de todas as coisas.
verses.en_6th_ed: If you quickly purify your mind and listen, I shall give you all of My teachings on everything.
verses.ro: sumiyaka ni kokoro sumashite kiku naraba   yorozu no hanashi mina tokikikasu
verses.jp1: すみやかに心すましてきくならば
verses.jp2: よろづのはなしみなときゝかす
verses.kanji: 速やかに心澄まして聞くならば   万の話皆説き聞かす
verses.english: If you quickly purify your mind and listen to Me, I will tell you all of My teachings on any and everything.

verses.pt: Tenho realizado certamente uma experiência no mundo. Creiam que não há nenhum erro nisso.
verses.en_6th_ed: I have put them to a test of certainty in this world. Be convinced that there is no error.
verses.ro: kono yo no tashika tameshi ga kakete aru   kore ni machigai nai to omoe yo
verses.jp1: このよふのたしかためしかかけてある
verses.jp2: これにまちがいないとをもゑよ
verses.kanji: この世の確か試しが掛けて有る   これに間違い無いと思えよ
verses.english: I have put this world to a test certainly. Be convinced that there is no mistake!

verses.pt: Se esta experiência for vista prontamente, verão que toda a minha explanação é verdadeira.
verses.en_6th_ed: If this test is quickly seen, you will understand that My words are always true.
verses.ro: kono tameshi sumiyaka mieta koto naraba   ikana hanashi mo mina makoto ya de
verses.jp1: このためしすみやかみゑた事ならば
verses.jp2: いかなはなしもみなまことやで
verses.kanji: この試し速やか見えた事ならば   如何な話も皆真やで
verses.english: When this test is quickly realized, you will understand that My words are always true.

verses.pt: Desde que faço toda e qualquer explanação, o que quer que diga, nunca pensem ser mentira.
verses.en_6th_ed: I shall teach you on any and every matter. Never take it to be false, whatever I may say.
verses.ro: nanimo kamo ikana hanashi mo toku hodoni   nani o yutemo uso to omouna
verses.jp1: なにもかもいかなはなしもとくほどに
verses.jp2: なにをゆうてもうそとをもうな
verses.kanji: 何もかも如何な話も説く程に   何を言うても嘘と思うな
verses.english: I will teach you any and everything. Never take it to be false, whatever I may say!

verses.pt: Quanto às palavras e às ações de Deus invisível, é difícil saber o que será realizado.
verses.en_6th_ed: It may be difficult to understand the sayings and workings of God, whom you cannot see.
verses.ro: me ni men Kami no yu koto nasu koto wa   nani o suru tomo chotto ni shiremai
verses.jp1: めへにめん神のゆう事なす事わ
verses.jp2: なにをするとも一寸にしれまい
verses.kanji: 目に見えん神の言う事為す事は   何をするとも一寸に知れまい
verses.english: Perhaps you cannot easily understand whatever God, invisible, says or works.

verses.pt: Desde que as explanações se evidenciam logo, isto será uma prova convincente.
verses.en_6th_ed: But My teachings can be seen quickly. This will be the proof that cannot be denied.
verses.ro: hayabaya to mieru hanashi de aru hodoni   kore ga tashikana shoko naru zo ya
verses.jp1: はや／＼とみへるはなしであるほどに
verses.jp2: これがたしかなしよこなるぞや
verses.kanji: 早々と見える話で有る程に   これが確かな証拠なるぞや
verses.english: My talk shall be realized so quickly. Indeed, this is the sure evidence.

verses.pt: Vendo isto, tenham prazer com tudo que ouvirem. Todas as explanações serão conforme este princípio.
verses.en_6th_ed: When you see this, be pleased with whatever you hear. All of My teachings proceed in this way.
verses.ro: kore o mite nani o kiitemo tanoshime yo   ikana hanashi mo mina kono dori
verses.jp1: これをみてなにをきいてもたのしめよ
verses.jp2: いかなはなしもみなこのどふり
verses.kanji: これを見て何を聞いても楽しめよ   如何な話も皆この道理
verses.english: When you see this, be pleased with whatever you hear! Whatever I may say, all shall be realized in accordance with this reason.

verses.pt: Se tomarem algo emprestado de alguém, precisarão pagar juros. Deverão devolvê-lo logo e agradecer.
verses.en_6th_ed: If you have borrowed something from another, you will need to pay interest. Return it quickly with a word of thanks.
verses.ro: hito no mono karitaru naraba ri ga iru de   hayaku hensai re o yu nari
verses.jp1: 人のものかりたるならばりかいるで
verses.jp2: はやくへんさいれゑをゆうなり
verses.kanji: 人の物借りたるならば利が要るで   早く返済礼を言うなり
verses.english: If you borrow something from others, you must pay interest. Quickly return it with a word of thanks!

verses.pt: Pensar que é a criança que chora à noite é errado. Não é a criança quem chora, é a persuasão de Deus.
verses.en_6th_ed: You are mistaking your child's crying at night. It is not a child's cry; it is God's persuasion.
verses.ro: ko no yonaki omou kokoro wa chigau de na   ko ga nakude nai Kami no kudoki ya
verses.jp1: 子のよなきをもふ心ハちがうでな
verses.jp2: こがなくでな神のくときや
verses.kanji: この夜泣き思う心は違うでな   子が泣くで無い神の口説きや
verses.english: It is a mistake that you are taking it simply as a baby's crying at night. It is not a baby crying; it is the persuasion of God.

verses.pt: Desde que Deus informa prontamente, ouçam bem e entendam o que quer que seja.
verses.en_6th_ed: As God desires to inform you quickly, you must understand whatever occurs.
verses.ro: hayabaya to Kami ga shirashite yaru hodoni   ikana koto demo shikato kikiwake
verses.jp1: はや／＼と神がしらしてやるほどに
verses.jp2: いかな事でもしかときゝわけ
verses.kanji: 早々と神が知らしてやる程に   如何な事でも確と聞き分け
verses.english: I, God, will let you know quickly. So you must listen attentively and comply with it, whatever it may be.

verses.pt: É melhor que os pais reflitam logo de modo que não cometam erros espirituais.
verses.en_6th_ed: Lest there be any error in the minds of you parents, you had better ponder quickly.
verses.ro: oyaoya no kokoro chigai no nai yoni   hayaku shiyan o suru ga yoi zo ya
verses.jp1: をや／＼の心ちがいのないよふに
verses.jp2: はやくしやんをするがよいぞや
verses.kanji: 親々の心違いの無い様に   早く思案をするが良いぞや
verses.english: Lest there should remain any mistake in the use of the minds of you parents, you had better ponder over it quickly.

verses.pt: Se tiverem o espírito sincero de salvar os outros, não terão nenhuma persuasão de Deus.
verses.en_6th_ed: If you are truly of a mind to save others, there is no need for the persuasion of God.
verses.ro: shinjitsu ni hito o tasukeru kokoro nara   Kami no kudoki wa nanimo nai zo ya
verses.jp1: しんぢつに人をたすける心なら
verses.jp2: 神のくときハなにもないぞや
verses.kanji: 真実に人を救ける心なら   神の口説きは何も無いぞや
verses.english: If your mind is truly determined to save others, there should be no necessity for the persuasion of God.

verses.pt: Quem pensa estar bem, só por estar bem no presente, está totalmente errado.
verses.en_6th_ed: The thought that all is well if the present is well for the self alone, is entirely mistaken.
verses.ro: meme ni imasai yokuba yoki koto to   omou kokoro wa mina chigau de na
verses.jp1: めへ／＼にいまさいよくばよき事と
verses.jp2: をもふ心ハみなちがうでな
verses.kanji: 銘々に今さい良くば良き事と   思う心は皆違うでな
verses.english: The mind is thoroughly mistaken, if it is satisfied only when things fare well for the individual and for the present moment.
