verses.english: Though nothing is visible today, look forward to the eighth month! Then everything shall appear.

verses.pt: Ainda não sabem o que poderá ser avistado. O amplo caminho será aberto dos altos montes.
verses.en_6th_ed: Perhaps you cannot foresee what is going to appear. From the high mountains, a broad path will open.
verses.ro: mieru no mo nanino koto yara shiremai na   takai yama kara okwan no michi
verses.jp1: みへるのもなにの事やらしれまいな
verses.jp2: 高い山からをふくハんのみち
verses.kanji: 見えるのも何の事やら知れまいな   高い山から往還の道
verses.english: Perhaps you cannot foresee what is going to appear. From the high mountains a broad way shall be opened.

verses.pt: Tenho feito preparações para abrir este caminho, porém, as pessoas próximas nada sabem.
verses.en_6th_ed: I have been preparing to open this path, but those of you close to Me know nothing of it.
verses.ro: kono michi o tsukeyo tote ni shikoshirae   soba naru mono wa nanimo shirazu ni
verses.jp1: このみちをつけよふとてにしこしらへ
verses.jp2: そばなるものハなにもしらすに
verses.kanji: この道を付け様とてに仕拵え   側なる者は何も知らずに
verses.english: I have been arranging to open this way, without being noticed by you who are close to Me.

verses.pt: O fato de vir chamar ou aparecer neste lugar é porque existe a intenção de Deus.
verses.en_6th_ed: Those who come here to summon or to investigate, come because it is God's intent.
verses.ro: kono toko e yobi ni kuru no mo detekuru mo   Kami no omowaku aru kara no koto
verses.jp1: このとこへよびにくるのもでゝくるも
verses.jp2: 神のをもハくあるからの事
verses.kanji: この所へ呼びに来るのも出て来るも   神の思惑有るからの事
verses.english: Those who come here to summon or investigate come because of the intention of God.

verses.pt: Sem saberem nada desse fato, os próximos julgam ser algo comum ao mundo.
verses.en_6th_ed: Knowing nothing about this, you close to Me think of it only in worldly terms.
verses.ro: sono koto o nanimo shirazu ni soba naru wa   sekainami naru koto o omote
verses.jp1: その事をなにもしらすにそばなるハ
verses.jp2: せかいなみなる事をふもをて
verses.kanji: その事を何も知らずに側なるは   世界並なる事を思うて
verses.english: Knowing nothing about this divine intention, you close to Me are thinking just as common worldly people do about this matter.

verses.pt: Seja em que for, não julguem ser algo comum ao mundo, pois haverá um caminho extraordinário.
verses.en_6th_ed: Do not think of anything in worldly terms. There is a new and marvelous path for you.
verses.ro: nani nitemo sekainami towa omouna yo   nanika mezurashi michi ga aru zo ya
verses.jp1: なにゝてもせかいなみとハをもうなよ
verses.jp2: なにかめつらしみちがあるぞや
verses.kanji: 何にても世界並とは思うなよ   何か珍し道が有るぞや
verses.english: Never take whatever kinds of matters to be worldly common! There will appear some remarkable way.

verses.pt: Os dias têm passado gradualmente desde quando iniciei este mundo, mas não há quem conheça a verdade.
verses.en_6th_ed: Though years have passed since the beginning of this world, there is yet no one who knows the truth.
verses.ro: dandan to kono yo hajimete hi wa tatedo   tare ka shinjitsu shirita mono nashi
verses.jp1: だん／＼とこのよはぢめてひハたてど
verses.jp2: たれかしんぢつしりたものなし
verses.kanji: 段々とこの世初めて日は経てど   誰か真実知りた者無し
verses.english: One by one the days have passed since I created this world. But there is no one who understands the truth.

verses.pt: Por mais que o espírito de Deus esteja apressado, o espírito de todos ainda permanece desatento.
verses.en_6th_ed: No matter how the mind of God hastens, the minds of all of you are yet inattentive.
verses.ro: ika hodoni Kami no kokoro wa seta tote   mina no kokoro wa mada ukkari to
verses.jp1: いかほどに神の心わせゑたとて
verses.jp2: みなの心ハまたうゝかりと
verses.kanji: 如何程に神の心は急いたとて   皆の心は未だうっかりと
verses.english: However impatiently the mind of God may hasten, the minds of all of you are thoughtlessly ignorant.

verses.pt: Reflitam logo sobre isto e apressem-se. Por que não começam o preparo para escavar a raiz?
verses.en_6th_ed: Quickly, try the pondering and then hasten. Why are you not preparing to dig up the root?
verses.ro: hayabaya to shiyan shite mite sekikome yo   ne horu moyo nande shiteden
verses.jp1: はや／＼としやんしてみてせきこめよ
verses.jp2: ねへほるもよふなんでしてでん
verses.kanji: 早々と思案してみて急き込めよ   根を掘る模様何でして出ん
verses.english: Ponder quickly over this and hurry! Why do you not prepare to dig up the root?

verses.pt: Não há absolutamente quem saiba como escavar a raiz, a verdade deste mundo.
verses.en_6th_ed: There is no one who knows the way to dig up the root, the truth of this world.
verses.ro: kono yo no shinjitsu ne no horikata o   shiritaru mono wa sarani nai node
verses.jp1: このよふのしんぢつねへのほりかたを
verses.jp2: しりたるものハさらにないので
verses.kanji: この世の真実根の掘り方を   知りたる者は更に無いので
verses.english: There is no one who knows how to dig up the fundamental truth of this world.

verses.pt: Quando escavarem verdadeiramente esta raiz, o caminho se tornará realmente promissor.
verses.en_6th_ed: If you have but truly dug up this root, this path will become truly promising.
verses.ro: kono ne o shinjitsu horita koto naraba   makoto tanomoshi michi ni naru no ni
verses.jp1: このねへをしんぢつほりた事ならば
verses.jp2: ま事たのもしみちになるのに
verses.kanji: この根を真実掘りた事ならば   誠頼もし道になるのに
verses.english: If you have truly finished digging up this root, it will become a truly delightful way.

verses.pt: Ao escavar e passar por este caminho, tanto os superiores como os inferiores se animarão juntos.
verses.en_6th_ed: When you have passed through this path, completing the digging, both the high and the low will be spirited.
verses.ro: kono michi o horikiri tori nuketa nara   kami shimo tomoni kokoro isamu ni
verses.jp1: このみちをほりきりとふりぬけたなら
verses.jp2: 上下ともに心いさむに
verses.kanji: この道を掘り切り通り抜けたなら   上下共に心勇むに
verses.english: If you go through this way digging up the root, both the upper and lower people will become heartily cheered up.

verses.pt: Doravante, de qualquer modo, farei somente o preparo para animar todas as pessoas do mundo.
verses.en_6th_ed: From now on, I shall make every effort solely for the preparations to make everyone in the world spirited.
verses.ro: korekara wa nandemo sekai ichiretsu o   isameru moyo bakari suru zo ya
verses.jp1: これからハなんでもせかい一れつを
verses.jp2: いさめるもよふばかりするそや
verses.kanji: これからは何でも世界一列を   勇める模様ばかりするぞや
verses.english: From now on I will single-heartedly arrange every means to cheer up people of the whole world.

verses.pt: Seja em que for, desejo gradualmente fazer com que não haja nada desconhecido para a região dos esclarecidos.
verses.en_6th_ed: I shall teach you step by step so that there will be nothing unknown in Nihon.
verses.ro: dandan to nani goto nitemo nihon niwa   shiran koto owa nai to yu yoni
verses.jp1: だん／＼となに事にてもにほんにハ
verses.jp2: しらん事をわないとゆうよに
verses.kanji: 段々と何事にても日本には   知らん事をは無いと言う様に
verses.english: Step by step I will teach you so that there shall remain nothing unknown in the region where My teachings spread early.

verses.pt: Desejo ensinar todas as coisas ao mundo inteiro, porque existe a profunda intenção de Deus.
verses.en_6th_ed: I desire to teach the whole world about all matters. The intention of God is truly deep.
verses.ro: nanimo kamo sekaiju e oshietai   Kami no omowaku fukaku aru no ni
verses.jp1: なにもかもせかいぢうゝへをしへたい
verses.jp2: 神のをもわくふかくあるのに
verses.kanji: 何もかも世界中へ教えたい   神の思惑深く有るのに
verses.english: I desire to teach any and everything to all people of the whole world. The intention of God is truly deep.

verses.pt: Sem saber disso, todas as pessoas do mundo estão pensando ser algo perigoso.
verses.en_6th_ed: Unaware of this, all the world thinks My teachings are somehow dangerous.
verses.ro: sore shirazu sekaiju wa ichiretsu ni   nando abunaki yoni omote
verses.jp1: それしらすせかいぢうゝハ一れつに
verses.jp2: なんどあぶなきよふにをもふて
verses.kanji: それ知らず世界中は一列に   何ぞ危なき様に思うて
verses.english: Unware of this, people of the whole world think that this way is somehow precarious.

verses.pt: Quaisquer coisas que sejam, são ditas por Deus. Que perigo poderia existir?
verses.en_6th_ed: Whatever I say, it is the word of God. What danger can there be?
verses.ro: dono yona koto demo Kami no yu koto ya   nanno abunaki koto ga aru zo ya
verses.jp1: とのよふな事でも神のゆう事や
verses.jp2: なんのあぶなき事があるそや
verses.kanji: どの様な事でも神の言う事や   何の危なき事が有るぞや
verses.english: Whatever I may say, it is all the word of God. There is nothing dangerous at all.

verses.pt: Embora venha dizendo gradualmente tudo sobre todas as coisas, não há quem as tenha entendido.
verses.en_6th_ed: Though people speak about any and all matters, there is no understanding.
verses.ro: nanimo kamo yorozu no koto o dandan to   yute inagara wakaritaru nashi
verses.jp1: なにもかもよろずの事をだん／＼と
verses.jp2: ゆうていながらわかりたるなし
verses.kanji: 何もかも万の事を段々と   言うて居ながら分かる目は無し
verses.english: There are many people who speak on any and everything. But there is no one who knows the truth.

verses.pt: Doravante, peço que preparem logo para purificar verdadeiramente o íntimo do coração.
verses.en_6th_ed: From now on, please quickly make preparations truly to purify your innermost heart.
verses.ro: korekara wa dozo shinjitsu mune no uchi   hayaku sumasuru moyo shite kure
verses.jp1: これからハどうぞしんぢつむねのうち
verses.jp2: はやくすまするもよふしてくれ
verses.kanji: これからはどうぞ真実胸の内   早く澄まする模様して呉れ
verses.english: From now on please hasten to arrange to truly purify your innermost heart!

verses.pt: Sendo numerosas as pessoas no mundo, purificá-las é algo difícil.
verses.en_6th_ed: As there are a great number of people in the world, to purify all of them will be difficult.
verses.ro: sekaiju oku no hito de aru karani   kore sumasuru ga mutsukashii koto
verses.jp1: せかいぢうをふくの人てあるからに
verses.jp2: これすまするがむつかしい事
verses.kanji: 世界中多くの人で有るからに   これ澄まするが難しい事
verses.english: As there are such a great number of people in the world, it may seem difficult to purify all of them.

verses.pt: Por mais que tenha dito ser difícil, vejam a verdade através do próprio espírito.
verses.en_6th_ed: However difficult it may be, see the truth through your own mind!
verses.ro: ika hodoni mutsukashi koto to yuta tote   waga kokoro yori shinjitsu o miyo
verses.jp1: いかほどにむつかし事とゆうたとて
verses.jp2: わが心よりしんちつをみよ
verses.kanji: 如何程に難し事と言うたとて   我が心より真実を見よ
verses.english: However difficult it may be, see the truth through your own mind!

verses.pt: Quando este espírito se purificar e entender, será vista tal como é.
verses.en_6th_ed: When the mind is made pure and open to reason, the truth will be seen of its own accord.
verses.ro: kono kokoro sumushi wakarita koto naraba   sono mama mieru koto de aru nari
verses.jp1: この心すむしわかりた事ならば
verses.jp2: そのまゝみゑる事であるなり
verses.kanji: この心澄みし分かりた事ならば   その侭見える事で有るなり
verses.english: When your mind becomes pure and open to reason, the truth will become visible at once.

verses.pt: Dia a dia, não há em absoluto quem conheça o verdadeiro trabalho de Deus.
verses.en_6th_ed: There may be no one at all who knows the true working of God day after day.
verses.ro: nichinichi ni Kami no shinjitsu hataraki o   shiritaru mono wa sarani arumai
verses.jp1: にち／＼に神のしんぢつはたらきを
verses.jp2: しりたるものハさらにあるまい
verses.kanji: 日々に神の真実働きを   知りたる者は更に有るまい
verses.english: There may be no one at all who knows the true working of God day by day.

verses.pt: Seja em que for, o que se diz onipotência de Deus, mostrarei realizando coisas extraordinárias.
verses.en_6th_ed: In whatever matters, I shall show you marvels through the free and unlimited workings of God.
verses.ro: nani nitemo Kami no juyo to yu mono wa   mezurashi koto o shite miseru de na
verses.jp1: なにゝても神のぢうよとゆうものハ
verses.jp2: めづらし事をしてみせるでな
verses.kanji: 何にても神の自由と言う物は   珍し事をして見せるでな
verses.english: In whatever kinds of things, the omnipotence of God will manifest remarkable working.

verses.pt: Embora digam ser coisas tão extraordinárias, são somente coisas que Deus faz e realiza.
verses.en_6th_ed: Whatever marvels you may see, they are none other than the workings of God.
verses.ro: dono yona mezurashi koto to yuta tote   Kami no suru koto nasu koto bakari
verses.jp1: とのよふなめつらし事とゆうたとて
verses.jp2: 神のする事なす事はかり
verses.kanji: どの様な珍し事と言うたとて   神のする事為す事ばかり
verses.english: However remarkable it may be, everything is solely what God does or works.

verses.pt: Nada pôde ser conhecido até agora. Porém, começou a ser visto um caminho estreito.
verses.en_6th_ed: Until now, you have known nothing, but now a narrow path is coming into your sight.
verses.ro: imamade wa nani yono koto mo shirenanda   choto miekaketa hosoi michisuji
verses.jp1: いままでハなによの事もしれなんだ
verses.jp2: 一寸みへかけたほそいみちすじ
verses.kanji: 今迄は何よの事も知れなんだ   一寸見え掛けた細い道筋
verses.english: Until now everything has been unknown. But now a narrow lane is coming into sight.

verses.pt: Se seguirem gradualmente e com afeição este caminho, certamente será visto adiante o caminho real.
verses.en_6th_ed: If you follow this path step by step, you will surely see the main path ahead.
verses.ro: kono michi o dandan shitoi iku naraba   nandemo muko ni mieru honmichi
verses.jp1: このみちをだん／＼しといいくならば
verses.jp2: なんてもむこにみへるほんみち
verses.kanji: この道を段々慕い行くならば   何でも向うに見える本道
verses.english: If you go along this lane step by step, you shall surely see the main road ahead.

verses.pt: No percurso que fizeram até agora, por não se distinguir a região dos não-esclarecidos da região dos esclarecidos...
verses.en_6th_ed: Until now, you have come through a path where there was no distinction between Kara and Nihon.
verses.ro: koremade ni torite kitaru michisuji wa   kara mo nihon mo wakari nai node
verses.jp1: これまでにとふりてきたるみちすぢハ
verses.jp2: からもにほんもわかりないので
verses.kanji: これ迄に通りて来たる道筋は   唐も日本も分かり無いので
verses.english: Hitherto you have passed through a way in which there is no distinction between the region where My teachings spread early and the region where My teachings shall spread later.

verses.pt: Doravante, embora digam tanto da região dos não-esclarecidos, a região dos esclarecidos nunca experimentará derrotas.
verses.en_6th_ed: Hereafter, however highly Kara is regarded, in no case will Nihon be overcome.
verses.ro: konosaki wa nanbo kara ya to yuta tote   nihon ga makeru tameshi nai zo ya
verses.jp1: このさきハなんぼからやとゆうたとて
verses.jp2: にほんがまけるためしないそや
verses.kanji: この先は何ぼ唐やと言うたとて   日本が負ける例し無いぞや
verses.english: Henceforth, it shall never occur that the people of the region where My teachings spread early will yield to the people of the region where My teachings shall spread later,however powerful the latter may be.

verses.pt: Permitirei que escavem a raiz da criação original deste mundo. Tentem escavá-la se tiverem força.
verses.en_6th_ed: I shall let you dig up the root of this world's origin. If you have the strength, do your best to dig it up.
verses.ro: kono yo no moto hajimari no ne o horaso   chikara aru nara horikirite miyo
verses.jp1: このよふのもとはじまりのねをほらそ
verses.jp2: ちからあるならほりきりてみよ
verses.kanji: この世の元初まりの根を掘らそ   力有るなら掘り切りて見よ
verses.english: I will let you dig up the root of the original creation of this world. If you have enough strength, do your best to dig it up!

verses.pt: Se ao menos escavarem completamente esta raiz, seja quem for, ninguém será capaz de enfrentá-los.
verses.en_6th_ed: If only you have dug up this root completely, no one will be your match, whoever one may be.
verses.ro: kono ne o horikiri saika shitaru nara   dono yona mono mo kanau mono nashi
verses.jp1: このねへをほりきりさいかしたるなら
verses.jp2: どのよなものもかなうものなし
verses.kanji: この根を掘り切りさいかしたるなら   どの様な者も敵う者無し
verses.english: If only you have dug up this root completely, no one will be able to be your match.

verses.pt: Ouçam bem. O que quer que digam ou pensem e onde quer que digam ou pensem...
verses.en_6th_ed: Listen carefully: whatever you may say or think, or wherever you may say or think,
verses.ro: shikato kike kuchi de yutemo omotemo   doko de yutemo omotaru tote
verses.jp1: しかときけくちでゆうてもをもふても
verses.jp2: どこでゆうてもをもふたるとて
verses.kanji: 確と聞け口で言うても思うても   何処で言うても思うたるとて
verses.english: Listen attentively!  Whatever you may say or think, and wherever you may say or think,

verses.pt: O que se diz devolução é isto: Deus se retirará. Fiquem todos cientes.
verses.en_6th_ed: I shall give a return just as you deserve. Beware, all of you, for God may withdraw!
verses.ro: sono mamani kayashi to yu wa kono koto ya   Kami ga shirizoku mina shochi seyo
verses.jp1: そのまゝにかやしとゆうハこの事や
verses.jp2: 神がしりぞくみなしよちせよ
verses.kanji: その侭に返しと言うはこの事や   神が退く皆承知せよ
verses.english: I will give a return just as you deserve. Be aware that God may withdraw!

verses.pt: Desta vez, começarei a dizer coisas extraordinárias. Ouçam, acalmando o espírito.
verses.en_6th_ed: This time, I shall begin to tell you something marvelous. Calm your minds and please listen.
verses.ro: konotabi wa mezurashi koto o yui kakeru   kokoro shizumete kore kiite kure
verses.jp1: このたひハめづらし事をゆいかける
verses.jp2: 心しずめてこれきいてくれ
verses.kanji: この度は珍し事を言い掛ける   心静めてこれ聞いて呉れ
verses.english: This time I will begin to speak about a remarkable matter. Keep your mind calm and listen to My words!

verses.pt: Qualquer coisa que Deus diga e faça, não causará preocupações aos próximos.
verses.en_6th_ed: Everything is what God says or does. I shall never cause trouble to you who are close to Me.
verses.ro: nani goto mo Kami no suru koto yu koto ya   soba ni shinpai kakeru koto nashi
verses.jp1: なに事も神のする事ゆう事や
verses.jp2: そばにしんバいかける事なし
verses.kanji: 何事も神のする事言う事や   側に心配掛ける事無し
verses.english: Everything is what God says or does. I, God, shall never trouble you close to Me.

verses.pt: Peço a todos que fiquem realmente cientes destas explanações, acalmando o espírito.
verses.en_6th_ed: All of you, please calm your minds and become truly convinced of this talk.
verses.ro: kono hanashi dodo shinjitsu ichiretsu wa   kokoro shizumete shochi shite kure
verses.jp1: このはなしどふどしんぢつ一れつわ
verses.jp2: 心しづめてしよちしてくれ
verses.kanji: この話どうぞ真実一列は   心静めて承知して呉れ
verses.english: Calming your mind, please comply with this talk, all of you!

verses.pt: Que imaginam ser este caminho? O caminho verdadeiro que trará paz ao mundo.
verses.en_6th_ed: What do you think this path is? It is the true path that will settle this world.
verses.ro: kono michi wa doyu koto ni omou kana   kono yo osameru shinjitsu no michi
verses.jp1: このみちハどふゆう事にをもうかな
verses.jp2: このよをさめるしんぢつのみち
verses.kanji: この道はどういう事に思うかな   この世治める真実の道
verses.english: What do you think of this way? This is the true way to bring peace on this earth.

verses.pt: Se o fogo e a água forem distintos entre os superiores, pacificará por si mesmo, repleto de alegria.
verses.en_6th_ed: When the distinction between fire and water in the high places is made, joyousness will settle of its own accord.
verses.ro: kami taru no hii to mizu to o waketa nara   hitori osamaru yokizukume ni
verses.jp1: 上たるの火と水とをわけたなら
verses.jp2: ひとりをさまるよふきづくめに
verses.kanji: 上たるの火と水とを分けたなら   独り治まる陽気ずくめに
verses.english: When I distinguish fire from water among the upper people, this world will become peaceful and full of joy naturally.

verses.pt: Saibam que, a fim de distinguir entre o fogo e a água, o Serviço Alegre é realizado neste lugar.
verses.en_6th_ed: Know that the distinction between fire and water will be made by the performance of the Joyous Service at this place.
verses.ro: kono hi mizu wakeru to yu wa kono tokoro   Yoki-zutome o suru to omoe yo
verses.jp1: この火水わけるとゆうハこのところ
verses.jp2: よふきづとめをするとをもゑよ
verses.kanji: この火水分けると言うはこの所   陽気勤めをすると思えよ
verses.english: Understand the truth that in order to distinguish fire from water I hasten to perform the Yoki-Zutome, the Joyous Service, at this place!

verses.pt: Tal como quando iniciei este mundo, mostrarei realizando coisas extraordinárias.
verses.en_6th_ed: I shall do marvelous things, the same as My beginning of this world.
verses.ro: kono yo o hajime kaketa mo onaji koto   mezurashi koto o shite miseru de na
verses.jp1: このよふをはじめかけたもをなぢ事
verses.jp2: めずらし事をしてみせるでな
verses.kanji: この世を初め掛けたも同じ事   珍し事をして見せるでな
verses.english: I will manifest remarkable work, just as remarkable as My creation of this world.

verses.pt: O Serviço não tido desde o início deste mundo, uma vez começado, por certo o pacificará.
verses.en_6th_ed: I shall begin a Service which has never existed since I began this world, and assuredly settle the world.
verses.ro: kono yo o hajimete karani nai Tsutome   mata hajime kake tashika osameru
verses.jp1: このよふをはじめてからにないつとめ
verses.jp2: またはじめかけたしかをさめる
verses.kanji: この世を初めてからに無い勤め   また初め掛け確か治める
verses.english: Beginning the Service which has never existed since the creation, I will assuredly bring peace.

verses.pt: A verdade do espírito de Tsukihi deste mundo, não há em absoluto quem a conheça.
verses.en_6th_ed: There may be no one at all who knows the truth of the mind of Tsukihi of this universe.
verses.ro: kono yo no Tsukihi no kokoro shinjitsu o   shiritaru mono wa sarani arumai
verses.jp1: このよふの月日の心しんぢつを
verses.jp2: しりたるものわさらにあるまい
verses.kanji: この世の月日の心真実を   知りたる者は更に有るまい
verses.english: There may be no one who knows the true sincerity of Tsukihi, God the Parent, who protects this universe.

verses.pt: Embora até agora falassem de muitos deuses, diziam que eram invisíveis aos olhos.
verses.en_6th_ed: Until now, you have been saying that you cannot see a god with your own eyes, whatever kind of god he may be.
verses.ro: koremade wa ika naru Kami to yuta tote   me ni mien to yute ita nari
verses.jp1: これまでハいかなる神とゆうたとて
verses.jp2: めゑにみへんとゆうていたなり
verses.kanji: これ迄は如何なる神と言うたとて   目に見えんと言うて居たなり
verses.english: Up to now you have been saying that you cannot see a god with your own eyes, whatever kind of god he may be.

verses.pt: Desta vez, sejam quaisquer deuses, revelando-os verdadeiramente, farei explanações.
verses.en_6th_ed: This time, truly revealing whatever gods there may be, I shall speak to you.
verses.ro: konotabi wa dono yona Kami mo shinjitsu ni   araware dashite hanashi suru nari
verses.jp1: このたびわとのよな神もしんぢつに
verses.jp2: あらハれだしてはなしするなり
verses.kanji: この度はどの様な神も真実に   現れ出して話するなり
verses.english: This time, I, the true God of all gods, reveal Myself and speak to you.

verses.pt: Doravante, o que quer que digam ou pensem, surgirá tal qual, prontamente. Isto é maravilhoso.
verses.en_6th_ed: From this time on, whatever you say or think will appear just as you say or think. This is the wonder.
verses.ro: imakara wa nani o yutemo omotemo   sono mama mieru kore ga fushigi ya
verses.jp1: いまからハなにをゆうてもをもふても
verses.jp2: そのまゝみへるこれがふしぎや
verses.kanji: 今からは何を言うても思うても   その侭見えるこれが不思議や
verses.english: Henceforth whatever you may say or think will appear just as it is. How marvellous it should be!

verses.pt: Todas as coisas serão vistas tendo outono como sinal. Comecem logo o Serviço Alegre.
verses.en_6th_ed: At the sign of the wheat harvest, all things will begin to appear. Hurry and begin the Joyous Service.
verses.ro: nanimo kamo aki o aizu ni mie kakeru   Yoki-zutome ni hayaku kakare yo
verses.jp1: なにもかもあきをあいづにみへかける
verses.jp2: よふきづとめにはやくかゝれよ
verses.kanji: 何もかも秋を合図に見え掛ける   陽気勤めに早く掛かれよ
verses.english: Everything shall begin to appear taking the harvest time of wheat as a signal. So hurry and begin the performance of the Yoki-Zutome, the Joyous Service!

verses.pt: Numerosas pessoas vivem no mundo inteiro. O íntimo de todos é tal como a névoa.
verses.en_6th_ed: There are a great number of people living throughout the world, but their minds are all as if in a haze.
verses.ro: sekaiju oku kurasuru sono uchi wa   ichiretsu wa mina moya no gotoku ya
verses.jp1: せかいぢうをふくくらするそのうちわ
verses.jp2: 一れつハみなもやのごとくや
verses.kanji: 世界中多く暮らするその内は   一列は皆もや(靄)の如くや
verses.english: There are a large number of people living in the whole world, but they are as if they were in a haze.

verses.pt: Dia a dia, purificando e compreendendo o íntimo dos corações, começará a avistar conforme a evolução.
verses.en_6th_ed: Day by day, your innermost heart will be purified and understanding will come. You will come to see the truth as you mature.
verses.ro: nichinichi ni sumushi wakarishi mune no uchi   sejin shidai miete kuru zo ya
verses.jp1: にち／＼にすむしわかりしむねのうち
verses.jp2: せゑぢんしたいみへてくるぞや
verses.kanji: 日々に澄むし分かりし胸の内   成人次第見えて来るぞや
verses.english: But day by day your innermost hearts will become purified and understanding. So everything shall become visible in accordance with the growth of your minds.

verses.pt: Quando este caminho for certamente visto, depois vivam seguramente com prazer.
verses.en_6th_ed: When this path is clearly seen, take delight. Your future will be promising.
verses.ro: kono michi ga tashika mietaru koto naraba   konosaki tashika tanoshun de iyo
verses.jp1: このみちがたしかみへたる事ならば
verses.jp2: このさきたしかたのしゆでいよ
verses.kanji: この道が確か見えたる事ならば   この先確か楽しんで居よ
verses.english: When this way comes surely into sight, expect your future with good hope!

verses.pt: Gradualmente, animando o espírito, apressem-se para sair logo ao caminho real.
verses.en_6th_ed: Step by step, hasten with spirited minds. I am hurrying to have you go out to the main path.
verses.ro: dandan to kokoro isande sekikome yo   hayaku honmichi isogi deru zo ya
verses.jp1: たん／＼と心いさんでせきこめよ
verses.jp2: はやくほんみちいそぎでるぞや
verses.kanji: 段々と心勇んで急き込めよ   早く本道急ぎ出るぞや
verses.english: Step by step cheer up your mind and hurry! I will hasten to go out onto the main road.

verses.pt: Quando Deus aceitar o espírito sincero dos dez executantes do pessoal do Serviço...
verses.en_6th_ed: When God has accepted the sincerity in the minds of the ten performers of the Service,
verses.ro: shinjitsu no Tsutome no ninju ju nin no   kokoro o Kami ga uketorita nara
verses.jp1: しんぢつのつとめの人ぢう十人の
verses.jp2: 心を神がうけとりたなら
verses.kanji: 真実の勤めの人衆十人の   心を神が受け取りたなら
verses.english: When I, God, have accepted the sincere minds of those ten performers of the Service,

verses.pt: Depois disso, seja o que for, explicarei gradualmente tudo sobre a intenção de Deus.
verses.en_6th_ed: Thereafter, I shall teach you all of the thoughts of God on every matter step by step.
verses.ro: sorekara wa dono yona koto mo dandan to   Kami no omowaku mina tokikikasu
verses.jp1: それからハどのよな事もたん／＼と
verses.jp2: 神のをもわくみなときゝかす
verses.kanji: それからはどの様な事も段々と   神の思惑皆説き聞かす
verses.english: Then I will teach you, one by one, any and every intention of God.

verses.pt: Embora o espírito de Deus apresse dia a dia, se não completarem os dez do pessoal...
verses.en_6th_ed: Though the mind of God hastens day after day, to what avail if the ten performers do not assemble?
verses.ro: nichinichi ni Kami no kokoro wa seta tote   ninju ju nin soroi nakeneba
verses.jp1: にち／＼に神の心わせゑたとて
verses.jp2: 人ぢう十人そろいなけねば
verses.kanji: 日々に神の心は急いたとて   人衆十人揃い無けねば
verses.english: However impatiently the mind of God may hasten day by day,if the number of ten performers cannot be completed,

verses.pt: Saibam que os três tidos como braços direitos dentre os dez, o fogo, água e vento se retirarão.
verses.en_6th_ed: Take warning: fire, water, and wind will withdraw from the three deemed as right-hand men among the ten.
verses.ro: ju nin no naka ni san nin kataude wa   hii mizu kaze tomo shirizoku to shire
verses.jp1: 十人のなかに三人かたうでわ
verses.jp2: 火水風ともしりそくとしれ
verses.kanji: 十人の中に三人片腕は   火水風とも退くと知れ
verses.english: I warn you: fire, water and wind shall withdraw altogether from the three persons who are deemed as right-hand men among the ten.

verses.pt: O que quer que seja, é realização de Deus. Jamais pensem que isto seja doença.
verses.en_6th_ed: Whatever happens, it is the work of God. Never think it is an illness.
verses.ro: dono yona koto demo Kami no suru koto ya   kore o yamai to sarani omouna
verses.jp1: どのよふな事でも神のする事や
verses.jp2: これをやまいとさらにをもうな
verses.kanji: どの様な事でも神のする事や   これを病と更に思うな
verses.english: Whatever kind of thing may happen, it is all the work of God. Never take it to be an illness!

verses.pt: Por desejar informar verdadeiramente a onipotência de Deus, mostrarei realizando todas as coisas.
verses.en_6th_ed: I work all matters because I truly desire to let you know of the free and unlimited workings of God.
verses.ro: nanimo kamo shinjitsu Kami no juyo o   shirashitai kara shite miseru de na
verses.jp1: なにもかもしんぢつ神のぢふよふを
verses.jp2: しらしたいからしてみせるでな
verses.kanji: 何もかも真実神の自由を   知らしたいからして見せるでな
verses.english: Any and everything do I manifest, because I desire to make you know the true omnipotence of God.

verses.pt: Quais sejam os caminhos passados até agora, estava retraído porque o dia não havia chegado.
verses.en_6th_ed: Until now, no matter what path you may have been on, I kept still because the day had not yet come.
verses.ro: koremade wa ika naru michi o toritemo   hi ga kitarande izumi ita nari
verses.jp1: これまでハいかなるみちをとふりても
verses.jp2: ひがきたらんでいづみいたなり
verses.kanji: これ迄は如何なる道を通りても   日が来たらんでいずみ居たなり
verses.english: Hitherto, whatever kinds of ways you may have been walking over, I was rather inactive because the day had not yet come.

verses.pt: De agora em diante, explicarei gradativamente a verdade real de todas e quaisquer coisas.
verses.en_6th_ed: Hereafter, I shall tell you the real truth of all matters step by step.
verses.ro: konosaki wa dono yona koto mo dandan to   honshinjitsu o yute kikasuru
verses.jp1: このさきハどのよな事もたん／＼と
verses.jp2: ほんしんぢつをゆうてきかする
verses.kanji: この先はどの様な事も段々と   本真実を言うて聞かする
verses.english: Henceforth I will tell you the prime truth of any and everything one after another.

verses.pt: Embora até agora tenham falado de inúmeros deuses como se fossem das preces e evocações...
verses.en_6th_ed: Until now, people have worshipped and prayed to a great many gods.
verses.ro: imamade wa ika naru Kami mo yamayama ni   ogami kito to yuta naredomo
verses.jp1: いまゝでハいかなる神も山／＼に
verses.jp2: をがみきとふとゆうたなれども
verses.kanji: 今迄は如何なる神も山々に   拝み祈祷と言うたなれども
verses.english: Until now there have been many gods to whom people bowed or offered prayers.

verses.pt: Se houver alguém que conheça esta origem, vão e tentem consultá-lo, pois Deus permite.
verses.en_6th_ed: Should there be anyone who knows the origin, God permits you to seek and inquire.
verses.ro: kono moto o shiritaru mono ga aru naraba   tazune ite miyo Kami ga yurusuru
verses.jp1: このもとをしりたるものかあるならば
verses.jp2: たづねいてみよ神がゆるする
verses.kanji: この元を知りたる者が有るならば   訪ね行って見よ神が許する
verses.english: If there is anyone who knows their origin, call upon him and ask about it! I, God, permit it.

verses.pt: No futuro, quando o caminho real for aberto, explicarei sobre o que quer que seja, gradualmente.
verses.en_6th_ed: In the future when the main path is opened, I shall teach you everything step by step.
verses.ro: matasaki wa dono yona koto mo dandan to   honmichi tsuketa koto de aru nara
verses.jp1: またさきハとのよな事もたん／＼と
verses.jp2: ほんみちつけた事であるなら
verses.kanji: また先はどの様な事も段々と   本道付けた事で有るなら
verses.english: In the future when the main road is opened, I will teach you everything step by step.

verses.pt: Contando só fatos inexistentes até agora, ensinarei o Serviço de todas as salvações.
verses.en_6th_ed: I shall begin to tell you solely of that which had never existed before, and teach you the Service for universal salvation.
verses.ro: imamade ni nai koto bakari yui kakete   yorozu tasuke no Tsutome oshieru
verses.jp1: いまゝでにない事ばかりゆいかけて
verses.jp2: よろづたすけのつとめをしへる
verses.kanji: 今迄に無い事ばかり言い掛けて   万救けの勤め教える
verses.english: Beginning to tell everything which has never existed before, I will teach you the Service for universal salvation.

verses.pt: Entre estes dez do pessoal deste Serviço, encontra-se o Parens da criação original.
verses.en_6th_ed: Among the ten performers of this Service, there are those who take the role of the Parent of the beginnings of origin.
verses.ro: kono Tsutome ju nin ninju sono naka ni   moto hajimari no Oya ga iru nari
verses.jp1: このつとめ十人にんぢうそのなかに
verses.jp2: もとはじまりのをやがいるなり
verses.kanji: この勤め十人人衆その中に   元初まりの親が居るなり
verses.english: Among the ten members of this Service, there are those who take the role of the original Parent.

verses.pt: Atraindo Izanagui e Izanami, ensinei-lhes as providências da criação dos seres humanos.
verses.en_6th_ed: I drew forth Izanagi and Izanami and taught them the providence of how to begin human beings.
verses.ro: Izanagi to Izanamii to o hikiyosete   ningen hajime shugo oshieta
verses.jp1: いざなぎといざなみいとをひきよせて
verses.jp2: にんけんはぢめしゆごをしゑた
verses.kanji: いざなぎといざなみとを引き寄せて   人間初め守護を教えた
verses.english: I, God the Parent, called forth both Izanagi and Izanami and taught them the providence how to create human beings.

verses.pt: Nesta origem, havia no mar de lama um sirênio e uma cobra branca. Tomando-os, criei o casal.
verses.en_6th_ed: At the origin were a fish and a serpent in the muddy ocean. I drew them up and began the first couple.
verses.ro: kono moto wa doroumi naka ni uo to mi to   sore hikidashite fufu hajimeta
verses.jp1: このもとハどろうみなかにうをとみと
verses.jp2: それひきだしてふう／＼はちめた
verses.kanji: この元は泥海中に魚と巳と   それ引き出して夫婦初めた
verses.english: Originally it was a muddy ocean and I found therein a fish and a serpent. Drawing them forth, I created the first husband and wife.

verses.pt: Na criação original, este mundo era um mar de lama, e nele havia muitos cadozes.
verses.en_6th_ed: In the beginnings of origin, this universe was a muddy ocean. Therein were only loaches.
verses.ro: kono yo no moto hajimari wa doro no umi   sono naka yori mo dojo bakari ya
verses.jp1: このよふの元はじまりハとろのうみ
verses.jp2: そのなかよりもどぢよばかりや
verses.kanji: この世の元初まりは泥の海   その中よりも泥鰌ばかりや
verses.english: The origin of this universe was a muddy ocean, living therein were nothing but a large number of loaches.

verses.pt: Onde estavam também o sirênio e a cobra branca, que bem observados, tinham faces de ser humano.
verses.en_6th_ed: Among them were a fish and a serpent. Looking closely, I saw that they had human faces.
verses.ro: sono uchi ni uo to mii to ga majiriiru   yoku misumaseba ningen no kao
verses.jp1: そのうちにうをとみいとがまちりいる
verses.jp2: よくみすませばにんげんのかを
verses.kanji: その内に魚と巳とが混じり居る   良く見澄ませば人間の顔
verses.english: Among them I found a fish and a serpent. And after gazing at them, I found that they had the faces of human beings.

verses.pt: Verificando isso, ocorreu-lhe a idéia que é somente do espírito sincero de Tsukihi.
verses.en_6th_ed: Seeing this, an idea came to none other than the sincere mind of Tsukihi.
verses.ro: sore o mite omoi tsuita wa shinjitsu no   Tsukihi no kokoro bakari naru zo ya
verses.jp1: それをみてをもいついたハしんぢつの
verses.jp2: 月日の心ばかりなるそや
verses.kanji: それを見て思い付いたは真実の   月日の心ばかりなるぞや
verses.english: By seeing them, an idea came to no one but the truly sincere mind of Tsukihi.

verses.pt: Se a eles reunisse os instrumentos e lhes ensinasse gradualmente a providência,
verses.en_6th_ed: If I should add instruments to them and teach them My providence step by step,
verses.ro: kono mono ni dogu o yosete dandan to   shugo oshieta koto de aru nara
verses.jp1: このものにどふくをよせてたん／＼と
verses.jp2: しゆこふをしゑた事であるなら
verses.kanji: この者に道具を寄せて段々と   守護を教えた事で有るなら
verses.english: It should be good, if I call together instruments to add to them, and teach them My providence one by one.

verses.pt: Se introduzisse estes instrumentos, Kunissazuti e Tsukiyomi, nos seus corpos,
verses.en_6th_ed: These instruments being Kunisazuchi and Tsukiyomi, if I should put them into their bodies,
verses.ro: kono dogu Kunisazuchii to Tsukiyomi to   kore minouchi e shikomitaru nara
verses.jp1: このどふくくにさづちいと月よみと
verses.jp2: これみのうちゑしこみたるなら
verses.kanji: この道具くにさづちと月よみと   これ身の内へ仕込みたるなら
verses.english: These instruments were Kunisazuchi and Tsukiyomi; if I put them into their bodies,

verses.pt: E se reunisse Kumoyomi, Kashikone, Otonobe e Taishokuten,
verses.en_6th_ed: And call together Kumoyomi, Kashikone, %Otonobe, and Taishokuten,
verses.ro: Kumoyomi to Kashikonee to Otonobe   Taishokuten to yoseta koto nara
verses.jp1: くもよみとかしこねへとをふとのべ
verses.jp2: たいしよく天とよせた事なら
verses.kanji: くもよみとかしこねとおおとのべ   たいしょく天と寄せた事なら
verses.english: If I call Kumoyomi, Kashikone, Otonobe and Taishokuten altogether,

verses.pt: Desde esse momento, as deliberações de Deus chegaram à firme decisão de iniciar o mundo.
verses.en_6th_ed: Then, after holding counsel, God came to the firm decision to begin this world.
verses.ro: sorekara wa tashika sekai o hajime yo to   Kami no sodan shimari tsuitari
verses.jp1: それからハたしかせかいを初よと
verses.jp2: かみのそふだんしまりついたり
verses.kanji: それからは確か世界を初めようと   神の相談締まり付いたり
verses.english: Then after a counsel with them I, God, came to the conclusion that the creation of this world must be positively commenced.

verses.pt: Doravante, o que se diz providências de Deus não tem sido nada fácil.
verses.en_6th_ed: Since that time, the providence of God has been by no means an easy matter.
verses.ro: korekara wa Kami no shugo to yu mono wa   nami taitei na koto de nai zo ya
verses.jp1: これからわ神のしゆごとゆうものハ
verses.jp2: なみたいていなことでないそや
verses.kanji: これからは神の守護と言うものは   並大抵な事で無いぞや
verses.english: Since then the providence of God has been by no means easy.

verses.pt: Criar todas as coisas inexistentes até agora e explicá-las são difíceis.
verses.en_6th_ed: It is indeed difficult to explain how I began things which had never existed.
verses.ro: imamade ni nai koto bakari hajimeru wa   nani o yu no mo mutsukashiki koto
verses.jp1: いまゝてにない事ばかりはちめるわ
verses.jp2: なにをゆうのもむつかしき事
verses.kanji: 今迄に無い事ばかり初めるは   何を言うのも難しき事
verses.english: It was indeed difficult, because I was beginning things which had never existed before.

verses.pt: Não há ninguém que tenha conhecido a verdade do início deste mundo.
verses.en_6th_ed: There may be no one who knows the truth of the beginning of this world.
verses.ro: kono yo o hajime kaketaru shinjitsu o   tare ka shiritaru mono wa arumai
verses.jp1: このよふをはちめかけたるしんぢつを
verses.jp2: たれかしりたるものハあるまい
verses.kanji: この世を初め掛けたる真実を   誰か知りたる者は有るまい
verses.english: I suppose that there is no one who knows the truth of the creation of this world.

verses.pt: Doravante, explicarei gradualmente seja o que for. Jamais julguem ser mentira.
verses.en_6th_ed: From now on, I shall tell you everything step by step. Never take it to be false.
verses.ro: korekara wa dono yona koto mo dandan to   yute kikasuru uso to omouna
verses.jp1: これからハとのよな事もたん／＼と
verses.jp2: ゆうてきかするうそとをもうな
verses.kanji: これからはどの様な事も段々と   言うて聞かする嘘と思うな
verses.english: Henceforth I will tell you any and everything one by one. Never take it to be false!

verses.pt: Criei os seres humanos com o sirênio e a cobra branca, tomando-os como viveiro e semente.
verses.en_6th_ed: I began human beings, taking a fish and a serpent as seed and seedbed.
verses.ro: ningen o hajime kaketa wa uo to mi to   kore nawashiro to tane ni hajimete
verses.jp1: にんけんをはぢめかけたハうをとみと
verses.jp2: これなわしろとたねにはじめて
verses.kanji: 人間を初め掛けたは魚と巳と   これ苗代と種に初めて
verses.english: I created human beings, taking a fish and a serpent as seed and seedbed.

verses.pt: Tsukihi introduziu-se nesses corpos e ensinou-lhes gradualmente as providências.
verses.en_6th_ed: Tsukihi entered their bodies and taught them the providence step by step.
verses.ro: kono mono ni Tsukihi tainai irikonde   dandan shugo oshie konda de
verses.jp1: このものに月日たいない入こんで
verses.jp2: たん／＼しゆごをしゑこんだで
verses.kanji: この者に月日体内入り込んで   段々守護教え込んだで
verses.english: Entering into their bodies, Tsukihi taught them the providence step by step.

verses.pt: O número de filhos foi novecentos milhões, noventa e nove mil, novecentos e noventa e nove.
verses.en_6th_ed: The number of children was nine hundred million, ninety-nine thousand, nine hundred and ninety-nine.
verses.ro: kono kokazu kuoku kuman ni kusen nin   kuhyaku kuju ni ku nin naru zo ya
verses.jp1: このこかす九をく九まんに九せん人
verses.jp2: 九百九十に九人なるそや
verses.kanji: この子数九億九万に九千人   九百九十に九人なるぞや
verses.english: The number of these children amounted to nine hundred million, ninety-nine thousand, nine hundred and ninety-nine.

verses.pt: Este número foi concebido em três dias e três noites, e ela permaneceu por três anos e três meses.
verses.en_6th_ed: The children were conceived in three days and three nights, and there Izanami stayed for three years and three months.
verses.ro: kono nin o mikka miyosa ni yadoshi komi   san nen mi tsuki todomarite ita
verses.jp1: この人を三か三よさにやどしこみ
verses.jp2: 三ねん三月とゝまりていた
verses.kanji: この人を三日三夜に宿し込み   三年三月留まりて居た
verses.english: It took three days and three nights to conceive these children, and Izanami stayed there for three years and three months.

verses.pt: Esses primeiros nascidos tinham cinco bu e eles foram crescendo de cinco em cinco bu.
verses.en_6th_ed: The first children born were five bu tall and grew taller gradually.
verses.ro: soreyori mo umare dashita wa go bu kara ya   go bu go bu to shite sejin o shita
verses.jp1: それよりもむまれだしたハ五分からや
verses.jp2: 五分五分としてせへぢんをした
verses.kanji: それよりも生まれ出したは五分からや   五分五分として成人をした
verses.english: The first born was five bu, or about half an inch, tall, and grew up by five bu repeatedly.

verses.pt: Com estas providências uma vez ensinadas, foram concebidos no mesmo corpo por três vezes.
verses.en_6th_ed: By this providence once taught, the children were conceived in the same body three times.
verses.ro: kono mono ni ichido oshieta kono shugo   onaji tainai sando yadorita
verses.jp1: このものに一どをしゑたこのしゆごふ
verses.jp2: をなぢたいない三どやどりた
verses.kanji: この者に一度教えたこの守護   同じ胎内三度宿りた
verses.english: By this providence once taught, children were conceived into the same womb three times.

verses.pt: O Deus verdadeiro deste mundo é Tsukihi. Os demais são instrumentos.
verses.en_6th_ed: The true and real God of this universe is Tsukihi. The others are all instruments.
verses.ro: kono yo no shinjitsu no Kami Tsukihi nari   ato naru wa mina dogu naru zo ya
verses.jp1: このよふのしんぢつの神月日なり
verses.jp2: あとなるわみなどふくなるそや
verses.kanji: この世の真実の神月日なり   後なるは皆道具なるぞや
verses.english: The true and real God of this universe is Tsukihi. The others are all instruments.

verses.pt: Reuni-os um após outro, usei-os para criar os seres humanos e concedi-lhes nomes divinos.
verses.en_6th_ed: Drawing them forth one after another, I used them to begin human beings and gave to each a sacred name.
verses.ro: ningen o hajime yo tote dandan to   yosete tsukota kore ni kamina o
verses.jp1: にんけんをはしめよふとてたん／＼と
verses.jp2: よせてつこふたこれに神なを
verses.kanji: 人間を初めようとて段々と   寄せて使うたこれに神名を
verses.english: To create human beings, I called together these instruments, and gave a sacred name to each of them.

verses.pt: Izanagui e Izanami são as principais providências e são consagrados no Grande Santuário de Teshoko.
verses.en_6th_ed: Izanagi and Izanami are the prime instruments. They are the basis of the Grand Shrine of Teshoko.
verses.ro: Izanagi to Izanamii to ga ichi no Kami   kore Teshoko no Daijingu nari
verses.jp1: いざなぎといざなみいとが一の神
verses.jp2: これてしよこの大じんくゝなり
verses.kanji: いざなぎといざなみとが一の神   これ天照皇太神宮なり
verses.english: Izanagi and Izanami are the names of the prime providence in the creation. In relation to this providence, the supreme god of this country is enshrined and respected in the Teishoko-no-Daijingu.

verses.pt: Doravante, ainda explicarei algo gradualmente. Serão só coisas desconhecidas até agora.
verses.en_6th_ed: In the days to come, I shall teach you everything step by step. It will be solely about things you have never known.
verses.ro: matasaki wa nanika dandan toku keredo   imamade shiran koto bakari ya de
verses.jp1: またさきハなにかたん／＼とくけれど
verses.jp2: いまゝてしらん事ばかりやで
verses.kanji: また先は何か段々説くけれど   今迄知らん事ばかりやで
verses.english: Henceforward I will teach you step by step any and everything of which you have never heard.

verses.pt: Doravante, tudo o que disser, será somente sobre os fatos da criação dos seres humanos.
verses.en_6th_ed: Hereafter, whatever I say will be solely about the beginnings of human beings.
verses.ro: konosaki wa nani o yutemo ningen o   hajime kaketaru koto bakari ya de
verses.jp1: このさきハなにをゆうてもにんげんを
verses.jp2: はぢめかけたる事ばかりやで
verses.kanji: この先は何を言うても人間を   初め掛けたる事ばかりやで
verses.english: Henceforth I will tell you exclusively about the creation of human beings.

verses.pt: É a Residência onde iniciei este mundo. É o Parens original da criação dos seres humanos.
verses.en_6th_ed: This is the Residence where I began this world. Therein lives the original Parent of human beginnings.
verses.ro: kono yo o hajime dashitaru yashiki nari   ningen hajime moto no Oya nari
verses.jp1: このよふをはぢめだしたるやしきなり
verses.jp2: にんけんはじめもとのをやなり
verses.kanji: この世を初め出したる屋敷なり   人間初め元の親なり
verses.english: This is the Residence where I created this human world. She is the original Parent who gave birth to all human beings.

verses.pt: Tendo-as verificado, Tsukihi desceu do céu porque desejava informar todas as coisas.
verses.en_6th_ed: Discerning this, Tsukihi descended from the desire to teach about all matters.
verses.ro: Tsukihi yori sore o misumashi amakudari   nanika yorozu o shirashitai kara
verses.jp1: 月日よりそれをみすましあまくだり
verses.jp2: なにかよろづをしらしたいから
verses.kanji: 月日よりそれを見澄まし天下り   何か万を知らしたいから
verses.english: After identifying this Preordination, I, Tsukihi, revealed Myself at this place to teach the truth of any and everything.

verses.pt: O espírito de Tsukihi pensa verdadeiramente em receber o sacrário de cada um.
verses.en_6th_ed: Truly, the thought in the mind of Tsukihi is to receive the shrine of each.
verses.ro: shinjitsu ni Tsukihi no kokoro omou niwa   meme no yashiro morota koto nara
verses.jp1: しんぢつに月日の心をもうにわ
verses.jp2: めへ／＼のやしろもろた事なら
verses.kanji: 真実に月日の心思うには   銘々の社貰ろた事なら
verses.english: I, God, truly desire that each providence is presented with a temple.

verses.pt: Depois disso, poderei fazer onipotentemente a explanação, a qualquer momento, como pretendo.
verses.en_6th_ed: Then I would teach exactly as I wish, freely and unlimitedly at any time.
verses.ro: soreyori mo juyojizai ni itsu nari to   omou mama naru hanashi shiyo mono
verses.jp1: それよりもぢうよぢざいにいつなりと
verses.jp2: をもうまゝなるはなしゝよもの
verses.kanji: それよりも自由自在に何時なりと   思う侭なる話しようもの
verses.english: Then I will tell you freely any and everything that I please at the time that I desire.

verses.pt: Embora tenha até agora obtido firmemente o Sacrário de Tsukihi, estava retraído.
verses.en_6th_ed: Even until now, though having firmly received the Shrine of Tsukihi, I have been keeping still.
verses.ro: imamade mo Tsukihi no yashiro shikkari to   morote aredomo izumi ita nari
verses.jp1: いまゝでも月日のやしろしいかりと
verses.jp2: もろてあれどもいづみいたなり
verses.kanji: 今迄も月日の社確りと   貰うて有れどいずみ居たなり
verses.english: Already I have firmly taken the Shrine of Tsukihi, but have been rather inactive.

verses.pt: Desta vez, revelando-me certamente ao mundo, explicarei tudo acerca de todas as coisas.
verses.en_6th_ed: This time, I shall surely reveal Myself openly and tell you the truth of all matters.
verses.ro: konotabi wa tashika omote i arawarete   nanika yorozu o mina yute kikasu
verses.jp1: このたびハたしかをもていあらハれて
verses.jp2: なにかよろつをみなゆてきかす
verses.kanji: この度は確か表へ現れて   何か万を皆言うて聞かす
verses.english: This time, however, I really reveal Myself to the fore, and teach you any and everything.

verses.pt: Como estive até agora atrás da persiana, seja o que for, nada tem sido visto.
verses.en_6th_ed: Until now, since I kept Myself behind a bamboo screen, nothing was able to be seen.
verses.ro: imamade wa misu no uchira ni itaru kara   nani yono koto mo miete nakeredo
verses.jp1: いままでハみすのうぢらにいたるから
verses.jp2: なによの事もみへてなけれど
verses.kanji: 今迄は御簾の内らに居たるから   何よの事も見えて無けれど
verses.english: Hitherto I have been sitting behind a bamboo screen, so nothing has yet appeared.

verses.pt: Desta vez, por ter saído para um lugar claro, o que quer que seja, se torna prontamente visível.
verses.en_6th_ed: This time, as I have come out into brightness, everything will be seen quickly.
verses.ro: konotabi wa akai tokoro i detaru kara   dono yona koto mo suguni mieru de
verses.jp1: このたびハあかいところいでたるから
verses.jp2: とのよな事もすぐにみゑるで
verses.kanji: この度は明い所へ出たるから   どの様な事も直ぐに見えるで
verses.english: But now, as I have come into the light, everything shall immediately be realized.

verses.pt: O que estão pensando ser este quimono vermelho? No seu interior, Tsukihi encontra-se abrigado.
verses.en_6th_ed: What do you think of these red clothes? Tsukihi dwells within.
verses.ro: kono akai kimono o nanto omote iru   naka ni Tsukihi ga komori iru zo ya
verses.jp1: このあかいきものをなんとをもている
verses.jp2: なかに月日がこもりいるそや
verses.kanji: この赤い着物を何と思うて居る   中に月日が篭り居るぞや
verses.english: What do you think of these red clothes? There is Tsukihi dwelling within.

verses.pt: Até agora, mesmo que tudo estivesse sob a vontade de Tsukihi, vieram sendo tolerados, pois o dia não havia chegado.
verses.en_6th_ed: Even until now, though everything was under the rule of Tsukihi, things were overlooked because the day had not yet come.
verses.ro: imamade mo Tsukihi no mama de aru naredo   hi ga kitarande miyurushite ita
verses.jp1: いまゝでも月日のまゝであるけれど
verses.jp2: ひがきたらんでみゆるしていた
verses.kanji: 今迄も月日の侭で有るけれど   日が来たらんで見許して居た
verses.english: Even until now everything has been managed by Me, Tsukihi. But I have been tolerant of this because the day has not yet come.

verses.pt: Desta vez, o dia já tem chegado plenamente. Submeterei todas as coisas à minha vontade.
verses.en_6th_ed: Now that the time is sufficiently full, I shall manage everything as I intend.
verses.ro: konotabi wa mo jubun ni hi mo kitari   nanika yorozu o mamani suru nari
verses.jp1: このたびハもふぢうふんにひもきたり
verses.jp2: なにかよろづをまゝにするなり
verses.kanji: この度はもう十分に日も来たり   何か万を侭にするなり
verses.english: Now the day has come enough. So I will manage any and everything as I intend.

verses.pt: Sem saber disso, o que estão pensando os altos montes ao submeterem todas as coisas à sua vontade?
verses.en_6th_ed: Unaware of this, what is the thinking of the high mountains who are managing everything as they please?
verses.ro: sore shirazu takayama nitewa nanimo kamo   nanto omote mamani suru zo ya
verses.jp1: それしらす高山にてハなにもかも
verses.jp2: なんとをもふてまゝにするぞや
verses.kanji: それ知らず高山にては何もかも   何と思うて侭にするぞや
verses.english: Unaware of this, with what thought are those who are on the high mountains managing any and everything as they please?

verses.pt: Seja em que for, neste lugar, não pensem jamais que haja o espírito humano.
verses.en_6th_ed: In any concerns, never think that there is a human mind at this place.
verses.ro: nani goto mo kono tokoro niwa ningen no   kokoro wa sarani aru to omouna
verses.jp1: なに事もこのところにハにんけんの
verses.jp2: 心ハさらにあるとをもうな
verses.kanji: 何事もこの所には人間の   心は更に有ると思うな
verses.english: Never think that I have a human mind at this place in whatever kinds of matters!

verses.pt: Tudo o que se diz ou escreve com a ponta do pincel, é indicação do espírito de Tsukihi.
verses.en_6th_ed: Whatever I may say or write by the tip of My brush, it is none other than directions from the mind of Tsukihi.
verses.ro: dono yona koto o yu nimo fudesaki mo   Tsukihi no kokoro sashizu bakari de
verses.jp1: どのよふな事をゆうにもふでさきも
verses.jp2: 月日の心さしすばかりで
verses.kanji: どの様な事を言うにも筆先も   月日の心指図ばかりで
verses.english: Whatever I may say or write with the tip of My writing brush, it is indeed nothing but the directions of Tsukihi.

verses.pt: O que quer que os altos montes digam e pensem, tudo é somente cogitação humana.
verses.en_6th_ed: Whatever the high mountains may say or think, it is all from their human thoughts.
verses.ro: takayama wa nani o yutemo omou nimo   mina ningen no kokoro bakari de
verses.jp1: 高山ハなにをゆうてもをもうにも
verses.jp2: みなにんけんのこころばかりで
verses.kanji: 高山は何を言うても思うにも   皆人間の心ばかりで
verses.english: Whatever the upper people may say or think, it is all from their human thoughts.

verses.pt: Retiraram o nome dado por Tsukihi. O que pensam a respeito deste pesar?
verses.en_6th_ed: They banned the name given by Tsukihi. What do you think of this regret of Mine?
verses.ro: Tsukihi yori tsuketa namai o toriharai   kono zannen o nanto omou zo
verses.jp1: 月日よりつけたなまいをとりはらい
verses.jp2: このさんねんをなんとをもうぞ
verses.kanji: 月日より付けた名前を取り払い   この残念を何と思うぞ
verses.english: They rejected the name given by Tsukihi. What do you think of this deep regret of Mine?

verses.pt: Compreendam que na verdade a ira e o pesar de Tsukihi não são coisas insignificantes.
verses.en_6th_ed: Know that in truth the anger and regret of Tsukihi are not small matters.
verses.ro: shinjitsu no Tsukihi rippuku zannen wa   yoi naru koto de nai to omoe yo
verses.jp1: しんちづの月日りいふくさんねんわ
verses.jp2: よいなる事でないとをもゑよ
verses.kanji: 真実の月日立腹残念は   容易なる事で無いと思えよ
verses.english: Understand that the true anger and regret of Tsukihi is not slight!

verses.pt: Embora até agora os altos montes viessem se alastrando, submetendo todas as coisas à sua vontade,
verses.en_6th_ed: Until now, the high mountains, boastful, have thrived and done as they pleased in every matter.
verses.ro: imamade wa takai yama ya to habikarite   nanika yorozu o mamani shitaredo
verses.jp1: いまゝでハ高い山やとはびかりて
verses.jp2: なにかよろづをまゝにしたれど
verses.kanji: 今迄は高い山やと蔓延りて   何か万を侭にしたれど
verses.english: Until now those who are on the high mountains have been rampant and managing everything as they please.

verses.pt: Doravante, Tsukihi os substituirá e submeterá à sua vontade. Tentem imitá-lo se puderem.
verses.en_6th_ed: But from now on, I, Tsukihi, shall do as I please instead. Copy what I do if you can.
verses.ro: korekara wa Tsukihi kawarite mamani suru   nanika no koto o mane o shite miyo
verses.jp1: これからハ月日かハりてまゝにする
verses.jp2: なにかの事をまねをしてみよ
verses.kanji: これからは月日代わりて侭にする   何かの事を真似をして見よ
verses.english: But from now on, in their place I, Tsukihi, will reign as I intend. Copy whatever I do, if you can!

verses.pt: O que quer que diga ou venha a fazer neste lugar, é somente intenção de Tsukihi.
verses.en_6th_ed: Whatever I may say or do at this place, it is none other than the thought of Tsukihi.
verses.ro: kono tokoro nani o yu nimo nasu koto mo   Tsukihi no omou koto bakari ya de
verses.jp1: このところなにをゆうにもなす事も
verses.jp2: 月日のをもう事ばかりやで
verses.kanji: この所何を言うにも為す事も   月日の思う事ばかりやで
verses.english: Whatever I may do or say, it is nothing but things which Tsukihi intends.

verses.pt: Doravante, serão realizadas somente preparações para dissipar o pesar do espírito de Tsukihi.
verses.en_6th_ed: From now on, I shall work solely on preparations to clear away the regret from the mind of Tsukihi.
verses.ro: korekara wa Tsukihi no kokoro zannen o   harasuru moyo bakari suru zo ya
verses.jp1: これからハ月日の心ざんねんを
verses.jp2: はらするもよふばかりするそや
verses.kanji: これからは月日の心残念を   晴らする模様ばかりするぞや
verses.english: Henceforth I will try to arrange single-heartedly to clear away the regret of Tsukihi.

verses.pt: Doravante, qualquer poeira que se levante, jamais pensem que isto seja doença.
verses.en_6th_ed: Hereafter, whatever dust may be stirred up, never think it is an illness.
verses.ro: konosaki wa dono yona hokori tatsu totemo   kore o yamai to sarani omouna
verses.jp1: このさきハどのよなほこりたつとても
verses.jp2: これをやまいとさらにをもうな
verses.kanji: この先はどの様な埃立つとても   これを病と更に思うな
verses.english: Whatever kind of dust may rise in the future, never take it to be an illness!

verses.pt: Será feita a devolução dos pesares de Tsukihi acumulados aos montes até o presente.
verses.en_6th_ed: I shall give returns for the regrets of Tsukihi piled mountainously high until now.
verses.ro: imamade mo Tsukihi zannen yamayama ni   tsumorite aru o kayashi suru zo ya
verses.jp1: いまゝでも月日さんねん山／＼に
verses.jp2: つもりてあるをかやしするぞや
verses.kanji: 今迄も月日残念山々に   積りて有るを返しするぞや
verses.english: This is the return for My regret which has hitherto piled up like a mountain.

verses.pt: Embora até o presente tivesse explicado sobre a devolução, o que estavam pensando ser isto?
verses.en_6th_ed: Even until now, though I spoke of My returns, you have been wondering what it could mean.
verses.ro: imamade mo kayashi to yute toitaredo   nanno koto ya to omote ita nari
verses.jp1: いまゝでもかやしとゆうてといたれど
verses.jp2: なんの事やとをもていたなり
verses.kanji: 今迄も返しと言うて説いたれど   何の事やと思うて居たなり
verses.english: Hitherto I have often told you of My return. But you were wondering what it could mean.

verses.pt: Na verdade, a citada devolução é este fato. Que os altos montes estejam todos cientes disso.
verses.en_6th_ed: This is what My returns mean in truth. Beware, all of you on the high mountains!
verses.ro: shinjitsu ni kayashi to yu wa kono koto ya   takayama wa mina shochi shite iyo
verses.jp1: しんぢつにかやしとゆうハこの事や
verses.jp2: 高山ハみなしよちしていよ
verses.kanji: 真実に返しと言うはこの事や   高山は皆承知して居よ
verses.english: Truly, what was called My return is this. Be aware of it, all who are on the high mountains!

verses.pt: Este mundo era um mar de lama, e dentro estava apenas Tsukihi.
verses.en_6th_ed: This world was a muddy ocean. Therein was Tsukihi alone.
verses.ro: kono yo wa doroumi naka no koto narushi   naka ni Tsukihi ga itaru made nari
verses.jp1: このよふわどろうみなかの事なるし
verses.jp2: なかに月日がいたるまでなり
verses.kanji: この世は泥海中の事なるし   中に月日が居たる迄なり
verses.english: This world was a muddy ocean. And therein was I, Tsukihi, living alone.

verses.pt: Na verdade, a idéia que ocorreu a Tsukihi, foi de começar, de algum modo, a criação do mundo.
verses.en_6th_ed: An idea came to Tsukihi: how promising it would be to begin a world.
verses.ro: Tsukihi yori shinjitsu omoi tsuitaru wa   nanto sekai o hajime kaketara
verses.jp1: 月日よりしんぢつをもいついたるわ
verses.jp2: なんとせかいをはじめかけたら
verses.kanji: 月日より真実思い付いたるわ   何と世界を初め掛けたら
verses.english: I, Tsukihi, was struck by an idea, imagining how hopeful it would be to create the world.

verses.pt: Foi difícil começar um mundo então inexistente. Preparos foram feitos para procurar os instrumentos.
verses.en_6th_ed: It was difficult to begin a world which did not exist. I prepared to find what could be used as instruments.
verses.ro: nai sekai hajime kakeru wa mutsukashii   nanto dogu o midasu moyo o
verses.jp1: ないせかいはじめかけるハむつかしい
verses.jp2: なんとどふぐをみたすもよふを
verses.kanji: 無い世界初め掛けるは難しい   何と道具を見出す模様を
verses.english: It is indeed difficult to create a world which does not exist. I prepared to find what could be used as instruments.

verses.pt: Ao examinar, foram vistos dentro os cadozes, o sirênio e a cobra branca, bem como os demais.
verses.en_6th_ed: Looking carefully within, I found loaches, a fish and a serpent, and other creatures, too.
verses.ro: misumaseba naka ni dojo mo uo mii mo   hoka naru mono mo miete aru nari
verses.jp1: みすませばなかにどぢよもうをみいも
verses.jp2: ほかなるものもみへてあるなり
verses.kanji: 身澄ませば中に泥鰌も魚巳も   他なる者も見えて有るなり
verses.english: Looking carefully through the muddy ocean, I found loaches, a fish and a serpent and others, too.

verses.pt: Atraindo todos, deliberei com eles para começar as providências da criação dos seres humanos.
verses.en_6th_ed: I called them together and conferred with them to begin My providence for human beings.
verses.ro: sono mono o mina hikiyosete danjiyai   ningen shugo hajime kaketara
verses.jp1: そのものをみなひきよせてたんぢやい
verses.jp2: にんけんしゆごはぢめかけたら
verses.kanji: その者を皆引き寄せて談じ合い   人間守護初め掛けたら
verses.english: I called those together and conferred with them how to begin to create human beings.

verses.pt: Para iniciar o mundo inexistente, Tsukihi tem-se dedicado gradualmente.
verses.en_6th_ed: In order to begin a world which did not exist, I, Tsukihi, devoted Myself at every step.
verses.ro: nai sekai hajime yo tote kono Tsukihi   dandan kokoro tsukushi taru yue
verses.jp1: ないせかいはじめよふとてこの月日
verses.jp2: たん／＼心つくしたるゆへ
verses.kanji: 無い世界初めようとてこの月日   段々心尽くしたる故
verses.english: Because I, Tsukihi, have endeavored step by step to create this world which did not exist.

verses.pt: Não há em absoluto quem conheça este caminho. O que pensam sobre o pesar de Tsukihi?
verses.en_6th_ed: There is no one who knows of this path. What do you think of this regret of Tsukihi?
verses.ro: kono michi o shiritaru mono wa sarani nashi   Tsukihi zannen nanto omou zo
verses.jp1: このみちをしりたるものハさらになし
verses.jp2: 月日ざんねんなんとをもうぞ
verses.kanji: この道を知りたる者は更に無し   月日残念何と思うぞ
verses.english: There is no one who knows of this way. What do you think of this regret of Tsukihi?

verses.pt: Com intenção tão profunda, este mundo foi iniciado. É grande o pesar no espírito de Tsukihi.
verses.en_6th_ed: So much thought has gone into beginning this world, how deep is the regret in the mind of Tsukihi!
verses.ro: kora hodoni omote hajimeta kono sekai   Tsukihi no kokoro nanto zannen
verses.jp1: こらほどにをもてはじめたこのせかい
verses.jp2: 月日の心なんとざんねん
verses.kanji: こら程に思うて初めたこの世界   月日の心何と残念
verses.english: This is the world which God created with so deep intention and strenuous efforts. What regret the mind of Tsukihi is feeling now!

verses.pt: Tsukihi tem-se empenhado inteira e gradualmente, e os seres humanos são frutos disso.
verses.en_6th_ed: Only through the exhaustive efforts of Tsukihi, made step by step, have you become the humans you are.
verses.ro: Tsukihi yori dandan kokoro tsukushi kiri   sono yue naru no ningen de aru
verses.jp1: 月日よりたん／＼心つくしきり
verses.jp2: そのゆへなるのにんけんである
verses.kanji: 月日より段々心尽くし切り   その故なるの人間で有る
verses.english: It is through the utmost exertion of Tsukihi that human beings have become what they are.

verses.pt: Sem saber disso, no presente momento, os altos montes estão todos se alastrando e agindo à vontade.
verses.en_6th_ed: Unaware of this, the high mountains at present are rampant and doing as they please.
verses.ro: sore shirazu ima no tokoro wa takayama wa   mina habikarite mamani shite iru
verses.jp1: それしらす今のところハ高山ハ
verses.jp2: みなはびかりてまゝにしている
verses.kanji: それ知らず今の所は高山は   皆蔓延りて侭にして居る
verses.english: Unaware of this, at present those who are on the high mountains are rampant and manage everything as they please.

verses.pt: Isto é o maior pesar de Tsukihi. Não sabem que espécie de devolução será feita.
verses.en_6th_ed: This is the greatest regret of Tsukihi. There is no knowing what I may give in return.
verses.ro: kono Tsukihi daiichi kore ga zannen na   donna kayashi o suru ya shiren de
verses.jp1: この月日大一これがざんねんな
verses.jp2: どんなかやしをするやしれんで
verses.kanji: この月日第一これが残念な   どんな返しをするや知れんで
verses.english: This is the cause of the prime regret of Tsukihi. There is no knowing what kind of return I may give.

verses.pt: Os desmoronamentos, os trovões, os terremotos e os tufões deste mundo são a ira de Tsukihi.
verses.en_6th_ed: In this world, landslides, thunder, earthquakes, and great winds are all from the anger of Tsukihi.
verses.ro: kono sekai yamague nazo mo kaminari mo   jishin okaze Tsukihi rippuku
verses.jp1: このせかい山ぐゑなそもかみなりも
verses.jp2: ぢしんをふかぜ月日りいふく
verses.kanji: この世界山崩え等も雷も   地震大風月日立腹
verses.english: In this world, land slides, thunder, earthquakes and typhoons are all the manifestations of the anger of Tsukihi.

verses.pt: Que os grandes templos e os altos montes, sejam quais forem, não se descuidem. Não se sabe quando Tsukihi sairá.
verses.en_6th_ed: Beware, you grand shrines and high mountains whoever! There is no knowing when Tsukihi will rush out.
verses.ro: dono yona taisha takayama yudan shina   nandoki Tsukihi tondederu yara
verses.jp1: どのよふなたいしや高山ゆたんしな
verses.jp2: なんとき月日とんてゞるやら
verses.kanji: どの様な大社高山油断しな   何時月日飛んで出るやら
verses.english: Be on the alert, grand shrines and peple on the high mountains! Because there is no knowing at what moment Tsukihi will rush out.

verses.pt: Todas as pessoas, cuidem cada qual do seu corpo, pois Tsukihi não fará cerimônia em absoluto.
verses.en_6th_ed: Let all of you in the world take care, for Tsukihi will never hold back!
verses.ro: ichiretsu wa minamina waga mi ki o tsuke yo   Tsukihi enryo wa sarani nai zo ya
verses.jp1: 一れつハみな／＼わがみきをつけよ
verses.jp2: 月日ゑんりよわさらにないぞや
verses.kanji: 一列は皆々我が身気を付けよ   月日遠慮は更に無いぞや
verses.english: Take care of your own bodies, all of you! Because I, Tsukihi, will work without reserve.

verses.pt: Após explicar ao máximo toda e qualquer coisa, Tsukihi começará os seus trabalhos.
verses.en_6th_ed: Having warned you about all matters as much as I can, Tsukihi will begin to work.
verses.ro: nanimo kamo seeippai ni kotowarite   sorekara kakaru Tsukihi shigoto o
verses.jp1: なにもかもせへいゝバいにことわりて
verses.jp2: それからかゝる月日しことを
verses.kanji: 何も彼も精一杯に断りて   それから掛かる月日仕事を
verses.english: Having warned you on any and everything as much as possible, I, Tsukihi, will begin My work.

verses.pt: Não tenham rancor do que quer que seja. Devem reprovar a si mesmos.
verses.en_6th_ed: In whatever things, bear no grudges. It is all a matter of your self-reproach.
verses.ro: dono yona koto mo urami ni omouna yo   mina meme no miurami de aru
verses.jp1: とのよふな事もらみにをもうなよ
verses.jp2: みなめへ／＼のみうらみである
verses.kanji: どの様な事も恨みに思うなよ   皆銘々の身恨みで有る
verses.english: Never bear a grudge against others in whatever kinds of matters! Rather reproach yourself in all matters.

verses.pt: Esta explanação foi feita gradual e insistentemente. Ouçam e entendam-na seguramente!
verses.en_6th_ed: I have told you this talk repeatedly step by step. Please understand it thoroughly.
verses.ro: kono hanashi dandan kudoki tsumete aru   kore shikkari to kikiwakete kure
verses.jp1: このはなしたん／＼くどきつめてある
verses.jp2: これしいかりときゝわけてくれ
verses.kanji: この話段々口説き詰めて有る   これ確りと聞き分けて呉れ
verses.english: This talk I have repeatedly told you step by step. Listen attentively and comprehend it well!

verses.pt: Todas as pessoas serão segundo o coração de cada um. Saibam que Tsukihi está discernindo.
verses.en_6th_ed: All humankind, everything depends on the heart of each of you. Know that Tsukihi is discerning it.
verses.ro: ichiretsu wa mina meme no mune shidai   Tsukihi miwakete iru to omoe yo
verses.jp1: 一れつハみなめへ／＼のむねしたい
verses.jp2: 月日みハけているとをもゑよ
verses.kanji: 一列は皆銘々の胸次第   月日見分けて居ると思えよ
verses.english: Realize that I, Tsukihi, am distinguishing each of your hearts just as they deserve!

verses.pt: Tsukihi verificará o espírito sincero e, tão logo o aceite, fará a devolução.
verses.en_6th_ed: Once Tsukihi has truly discerned your mind, I shall give you a return as soon as I have accepted it.
verses.ro: Tsukihi yori shinjitsu kokoro misadamete   uketori shidai kayashi suru nari
verses.jp1: 月日よりしんぢつ心みさだめて
verses.jp2: うけとりしたいかやしするなり
verses.kanji: 月日より真実心見定めて   受け取り次第返しするなり
verses.english: I, Tsukihi, will truly ascertain your sincerity, and as soon as I accept it, I will give a fair return.

verses.pt: Até agora, o que quer que tenham dito ou pensado, tudo era somente cogitação humana.
verses.en_6th_ed: Until now, whatever you have said or thought, it was only from the human mind.
verses.ro: imamade wa nani o yutemo omotemo   mina ningen no kokoro bakari de
verses.jp1: いまゝでハなにをゆうてもをもふても
verses.jp2: みなにんけんの心はかりで
verses.kanji: 今迄は何を言うても思うても   皆人間の心ばかりで
verses.english: Until now you have been speaking and thinking only with human thoughts.

verses.pt: Doravante, ao realizar tanto coisas boas como más, serão devolvidas tal qual prontamente.
verses.en_6th_ed: From now on, whether you do good or evil, I shall give you a return at once accordingly.
verses.ro: korekara wa yoki koto shite mo ashiki demo   sono mama suguni kayashi suru nari
verses.jp1: これからハよき事してもあしきでも
verses.jp2: そのまゝすぐにかやしするなり
verses.kanji: これからは善き事しても悪しきでも   その侭直ぐに返しするなり
verses.english: Henceforth I will give a return at once for whatever you have done, good or evil.

verses.pt: Embora até agora houvesse alguma compreensão, doravante, não haverá mais tal compreensão.
verses.en_6th_ed: Until now, I have looked on with understanding, but from now on there will be no allowances.
verses.ro: imamade wa nanika satori mo aritakedo   mo korekara wa satori nai zo ya
verses.jp1: いまゝでハなにかさとりもありたけど
verses.jp2: もふこれからハさとりないぞや
verses.kanji: 今迄は何か悟りも有りたけど   もうこれからは悟り無いぞや
verses.english: Until now there have been some allowances, but from now on nothing shall be overlooked.

verses.pt: Sou Tsukihi, o Parens verdadeiro deste mundo. Farei toda e qualquer providência.
verses.en_6th_ed: The true Parent of this universe is Tsukihi. It is I who protect you in everything.
verses.ro: kono yo no shinjitsu no Oya Tsukihi nari   nanika yorozu no shugo suru zo ya
verses.jp1: このよふのしんぢつのをや月日なり
verses.jp2: なにかよろづのしゆこするぞや
verses.kanji: この世の真実の親月日なり   何か万の守護するぞや
verses.english: The true and real Parent of this universe is I, Tsukihi. I will protect you in any and everything.

verses.pt: Doravante, não haverá mentira em tudo que for dito. Ouçam e compreendam que tudo é verdadeiro.
verses.en_6th_ed: Hereafter, nothing I say will be false. Take all My words to be true and understand them.
verses.ro: konosaki wa nani o yutemo uso wa nai   mina shinjitsu to omote kikiwake
verses.jp1: このさきハなにをゆうてもうそハない
verses.jp2: みなしんぢつとをもてきゝわけ
verses.kanji: この先は何を言うても嘘は無い   皆真実と思うて聞き分け
verses.english: Henceforth there shall be nothing false, whatever I may say. Listen and comprehend it well, taking My words to be all true!

verses.pt: Qualquer coisa que seja, são somente fatos que Tsukihi começou com sincera intenção.
verses.en_6th_ed: Everything there is, was begun by the sincere thoughts of Tsukihi.
verses.ro: dono yona koto demo Tsukihi shinjitsu ni   omote hajimeta koto bakari ya de
verses.jp1: どのよふな事でも月日しんぢつに
verses.jp2: をもてはじめた事ばかりやで
verses.kanji: どの様な事でも月日真実に   思うて初めた事ばかりやで
verses.english: Whatever kind of thing it may be, it was all commenced from the true sincerity of Tsukihi.

verses.pt: Embora até agora, ao falar de doença, ficassem todos preocupados com médicos e remédios,
verses.en_6th_ed: Until now, when there was illness, you turned to doctors and medicine. Though all of you have worried,
verses.ro: imamade wa yamai to yueba isha kusuri   mina shinpai o shitaru naredomo
verses.jp1: いまゝでハやまいとゆへばいしやくするり
verses.jp2: みなしんバいをしたるなれども
verses.kanji: 今迄は病と言えば医者薬   皆心配をしたるなれども
verses.english: Until now when you fell ill, you immediately called in doctors and took medicine. Thus all of you have worried yourselves.

verses.pt: Doravante, das dores, sofrimentos e feridas, todos serão salvos por meio de Iki e Teodori.
verses.en_6th_ed: From now on, I shall save you from any pains, sufferings, or tumors by the Breath and the Hand Dance.
verses.ro: korekara wa itami nayami mo dekimono mo   Iki Teodori de mina tasukeru de
verses.jp1: これからハいたみなやみもてきものも
verses.jp2: いきてをどりでみなたすけるで
verses.kanji: これからは痛み悩みも出来物も   息手踊りで皆救けるで
verses.english: But henceforth, by means of the Iki, the Grant of Breath, and the Teodori, the Grant of Hand Dance, I will save you all from any pains, sufferings or tumors.

verses.pt: Embora esta salvação fosse desconhecida até então, de agora em diante, experimentem-na.
verses.en_6th_ed: Though you have never known such salvation until now, from now on, try it and see!
verses.ro: kono tasuke imamade shiranu koto naredo   korekara saki wa tameshi shite miyo
verses.jp1: このたすけいまゝでしらぬ事なれど
verses.jp2: これからさきハためしゝてみよ
verses.kanji: この救け今迄知らぬ事なれど   これから先は試しして見よ
verses.english: Even though you have been ignorant of such salvation until now, henceforth try it!

verses.pt: Quão grave seja a doença, será salvo por meio da verdade de Iki.
verses.en_6th_ed: No matter how serious the illness may be, I shall save you by the truth of Breath.
verses.ro: dono yona mutsukashiki naru yamai demo   shinjitsu naru no Iki de tasukeru
verses.jp1: どのよふなむつかしきなるやまいでも
verses.jp2: しんぢつなるのいきでたすける
verses.kanji: どの様な難しきなる病でも   真実なるの息で救ける
verses.english: However critically ill you may be, I will save you by means of the truly sincere Iki, the Grant of Breath.

verses.pt: Verificando o espírito sincero, saibam que Tsukihi realizará qualquer providência.
verses.en_6th_ed: When Tsukihi has ascertained your mind's sincerity, know that I shall grant you every kind of protection.
verses.ro: Tsukihi yori shinjitsu kokoro misadamete   ikana shugo mo suru to omoe yo
verses.jp1: 月日よりしんじつ心みさためて
verses.jp2: いかなしゆこふもするとをもゑよ
verses.kanji: 月日より真実心見定めて   如何な守護もすると思えよ
verses.english: When I, Tsukihi, have truly ascertained the sincerity of your mind, I will work whatever protection.

verses.pt: Se os recém-nascidos viverem sem varíola nem sarampo e ainda sem se adoecer nem morrer...
verses.en_6th_ed: Your newborns shall be free from smallpox and measles. They shall live on without illness or death.
verses.ro: umare ko hoso hashika mo sen yoni   yamazu shinazu ni kurasu koto nara
verses.jp1: むまれこふほふそはしかもせんよふに
verses.jp2: やますしなすにくらす事なら
verses.kanji: 生まれ子を疱瘡麻疹もせん様に   病まず死なずに暮らす事なら
verses.english: I wish your newborn baby does not contact smallpox or measles, and grows up never falling ill nor dying early.

verses.pt: Ouçam bem! Seja qual for a onipotência, é somente do espírito de Tsukihi.
verses.en_6th_ed: Listen carefully: whatever free and unlimited workings I may do, it is all from the mind of Tsukihi.
verses.ro: shikato kike ikana juyo suru totemo   Tsukihi no kokoro bakari naru zo ya
verses.jp1: しかときけいかなぢうよふするとても
verses.jp2: 月日の心ばかりなるぞや
verses.kanji: 確と聞け如何な自由するとても   月日の心ばかりなるぞや
verses.english: Listen attentively! Whatever kind of omnipotence I may work, it is all from the mind of Tsukihi.

verses.pt: Embora explicasse quase tudo insistentemente até agora, ainda falta dizer sobre a intenção de Tsukihi.
verses.en_6th_ed: Though even until now I have made most of My appeals, still more needs to be said of Tsukihi's thoughts.
verses.ro: imamade mo taite kudoki mo toitaredo   mada yuitaran Tsukihi omowaku
verses.jp1: いまゝでもたいてくどきもといたれど
verses.jp2: まだゆいたらん月日をもわく
verses.kanji: 今迄も大抵口説きも説いたれど   未だ言い足らん月日思惑
verses.english: Hitherto I have tried to persuade you ever so often, yet there remains something more untold of the intention of Tsukihi.

verses.pt: Desta vez, deixo dito a respeito de tudo, porque o pesar de Tsukihi está acumulado.
verses.en_6th_ed: At this time, because the regret of Tsukihi has piled up so high, you shall hear all of it.
verses.ro: konotabi wa nanika Tsukihi no zannen o   tsumori aru kara mina yute oku
verses.jp1: このたびハなにか月日のざんねんを
verses.jp2: つもりあるからみなゆうてをく
verses.kanji: この度は何か月日の残念を   積り有るから皆言うて置く
verses.english: This time I will tell you all of the regret of Tsukihi, because it has piled up so much.

verses.pt: A dedicação única à salvação foi impedida neste lugar. Não é possível deixar de devolver o que quer que seja.
verses.en_6th_ed: Since the single-hearted salvation is being stopped at this place, I cannot bear but to give a return.
verses.ro: kono tokoro tasuke ichijo tomerarete   nandemo kayashi sezu ni iraren
verses.jp1: このところたすけ一ぢよとめられて
verses.jp2: なんてもかやしせすにいられん
verses.kanji: この所救け一条止められて   何でも返しせずに居られん
verses.english: As My single-hearted salvation is forbidden at present, I cannot help but give a due return for all things.

verses.pt: Esta devolução é retirar os grandes templos e os altos montes. Todos, igualmente, fiquem cientes.
verses.en_6th_ed: In this return, I shall clear away the grand shrines and high mountains. Let all of you be aware!
verses.ro: kono kayashi taisha takayama toriharai   mina ichiretsu wa shochi shite iyo
verses.jp1: このかやしたいしや高山とりはらい
verses.jp2: みな一れハしよちしていよ
verses.kanji: この返し大社高山取り払い   皆一列は承知して居よ
verses.english: In this return, grand shrines and those who are on the high mountains shall be all demolished. Remember this, all of you!

verses.pt: Com que pensamento estão ouvindo esta explanação? Chamas e chuvas de fogo no céu e maremotos.
verses.en_6th_ed: What are you thinking on hearing this talk? Flames of heaven, rains of fire, and tidal waves in the seas...
verses.ro: kono hanashi nanto omote kiite iru   tenbi hi no ame umi wa tsunami ya
verses.jp1: このはなしなんとをもふてきいている
verses.jp2: てんび火のあめうみわつなみや
verses.kanji: この話何と思うて聞いて居る   天火火の雨海は津波や
verses.english: What do you think on hearing this talk? The flames of heaven and rain of fire shall come down from the sky, and the sea shall swell into tidal waves.

verses.pt: Que pensa o mundo inteiro sobre esta preocupação tão intensa do espírito de Tsukihi?
verses.en_6th_ed: Such is the great anxiety in the mind of Tsukihi. What is the whole world thinking?
verses.ro: kora hodono Tsukihi no kokoro shinpai o   sekaiju wa nanto omoteru
verses.jp1: こらほどの月日の心しんバいを
verses.jp2: せかいぢうハなんとをもてる
verses.kanji: こら程の月日の心心配を   世界中は何と思うてる
verses.english: What do all of you of the whole world think of this serious anxiety in the mind of Tsukihi?

verses.pt: Embora, insistindo e lastimando, explique gradualmente, salvarei o espírito sincero.
verses.en_6th_ed: Though I appeal to you in sorrow over and over, I shall save you if you become of a sincere mind.
verses.ro: dandan to kudoki nageki wa toku keredo   shinjitsu naru no kokoro tasukeru
verses.jp1: たん／＼とくどきなけきハとくけれど
verses.jp2: しんぢつなるの心たすける
verses.kanji: 段々と口説き嘆きは説くけれど   真実なるの心救ける
verses.english: Even though I, God, teach you step by step so assiduously with lamentation, if your mind becomes truly sincere, I will surely save you.

verses.pt: Seja quem for, todos são igualmente meus filhos. Vejam a preocupação do espírito de Tsukihi.
verses.en_6th_ed: Whoever you are, you are all My children. Awaken to the anxiety in the mind of Tsukihi!
verses.ro: dono yona mono mo ichiretsu waga ko nari   Tsukihi no kokoro shinpai o miyo
verses.jp1: どのよふなものも一れつハかこなり
verses.jp2: 月日の心しんばいをみよ
verses.kanji: どの様な者も一列我が子なり   月日の心心配を見よ
verses.english: All of you are My children, whatever kind of person you may be. Feel for the anxiety in the mind of Tsukihi!

verses.pt: Todas as coisas deste mundo são Tsukihi; todos os corpos humanos são emprestados por Tsukihi.
verses.en_6th_ed: Everything in this universe is all by Tsukihi. All human bodies are things lent by Tsukihi.
verses.ro: kono yo wa ichiretsu wa mina Tsukihi nari   ningen wa mina Tsukihi kashimono
verses.jp1: このよふハ一れつハみな月日なり
verses.jp2: にんけんハみな月日かしもの
verses.kanji: この世は一列は皆月日なり   人間は皆月日貸し物
verses.english: This whole universe is the body of Tsukihi. So human bodies are all things lent by Tsukihi.

verses.pt: Se o mundo inteiro vier a conhecer esta verdade, não terá quem mostre o egoísmo e a ambição desmedida.
verses.en_6th_ed: If this truth is known all over the world, no one will remain selfish or greedy.
verses.ro: sekaiju kono shinjitsu o shirita nara   goki goyoku dasu mono wa nai
verses.jp1: せかいぢうこのしんぢつをしりたなら
verses.jp2: ごふきごふよくだすものわない
verses.kanji: 世界中この真実を知りたなら   強気強欲出す者は無い
verses.english: If the people of the whole world become awakened to this truth, no one will remain tenaciously selfish or avaricious.

verses.pt: Se ao menos o espírito entender a verdade, não haverá nada temeroso e nem perigoso.
verses.en_6th_ed: If only My mind is truly understood, there will be nothing fearful or dangerous.
verses.ro: kokoro sai shinjitsu yori mo wakaritara   nanimo kowami mo abunaki mo nai
verses.jp1: こゝろさいしんぢつよりもわかりたら
verses.jp2: なにもこわみもあふなきもない
verses.kanji: 心さい真実よりも分かりたら   何も怖みも危なきも無い
verses.english: If your mind heartily comprehends this truth, there shall remain nothing fearful or dangerous.

verses.pt: Apagando todas as coisas que Tsukihi ensina, o que fica é apenas o espírito humano.
verses.en_6th_ed: But you erased everything Tsukihi taught. What remains is only the human mind.
verses.ro: Tsukihi yori oshieru koto wa mina keshite   ato wa ningen gokoro bakari de
verses.jp1: 月日よりをしゑる事ハみなけして
verses.jp2: あとハにんけん心ばかりで
verses.kanji: 月日より教える事は皆消して   後は人間心ばかりで
verses.english: Putting out all teachings which I, Tsukihi, taught you, you behaved with only human thoughts.

verses.pt: Embora até agora tenha pensado em deixar ensinado a verdade sobre o início deste mundo...
verses.en_6th_ed: Even until now, though I wished to teach you the truth of the beginning of this world,
verses.ro: imamade mo kono yo hajimeta shinjitsu o   oshiete oko to omota naredomo
verses.jp1: いまゝでもこのよはじめたしんぢつを
verses.jp2: をしへてをことをもたなれども
verses.kanji: 今迄もこの世初めた真実を   教えて置こうと思うたなれども
verses.english: Although until now I have often thought of teaching you the truth of creating this world,

verses.pt: Embora o espírito de Tsukihi apresse dia a dia, saibam que estou esperando o tempo oportuno.
verses.en_6th_ed: And though the mind of Tsukihi hastens day after day, know that I am waiting for the appointed time.
verses.ro: Tsukihi yori nichinichi kokoro sekikomedo   kokugen machite iru to omoe yo
verses.jp1: 月日よりにち／＼心せきこめど
verses.jp2: こくげんまちているとをもゑよ
verses.kanji: 月日より日々心急き込めど   刻限待ちて居ると思えよ
verses.english: And even though I, Tsukihi, impatiently hasten day by day, I wait for the fixed time to come.

verses.pt: Com que pensamento estão ouvindo esta explanação? A intenção de Tsukihi consiste em uma imensa graça.
verses.en_6th_ed: What are you thinking on hearing this talk? Great blessings are intended by Tsukihi.
verses.ro: kono hanashi nanto omote kiite iru   Tsukihi omowaku fukai riyaku o
verses.jp1: このはなしなんとをもふてきいている
verses.jp2: 月日をもわくふかいりやくを
verses.kanji: この話何と思うて聞いて居る   月日思惑深い利益を
verses.english: What do you think on hearing this talk? I, Tsukihi, intend to bestow a deep divine favor.

verses.pt: Não pensem que isto seja comum ao homem, grande é a intenção do trabalho de Tsukihi.
verses.en_6th_ed: Never take this to be ordinary. Great is the intent in the workings of Tsukihi.
verses.ro: kore bakari hitonami ya towa omouna yo   Tsukihi no shigoto erai omowaku
verses.jp1: こればかり人なみやとハをもうなよ
verses.jp2: 月日のしごとゑらいをもわく
verses.kanji: こればかり人並やとは思うなよ   月日の仕事偉い思惑
