verses.ro: kono hanashi doyu koto de aro nara   Kanrodai ni hirabachi o nose
verses.jp1: このはなしどふゆう事であろをなら
verses.jp2: かんろふたいにひらばちをのせ
verses.kanji: この話どういう事で有ろうなら   甘露台に平鉢を乗せ
verses.english: You may wonder what I mean by this talk. Put a flat vessel on the Kanrodai!

verses.pt: Saibam que, de agora em diante, Tsukihi cuidará advertindo com vários incômodos no corpo.
verses.en_6th_ed: Hereafter, bodily disorders will appear here and there. Know that it is the care being given by Tsukihi.
verses.ro: konosaki wa atchi kotchi ni mi ni sawari   Tsukihi teiri o suru to omoe yo
verses.jp1: このさきハあゝちこゝちにみにさハり
verses.jp2: 月日ひていりをするとをもゑよ
verses.kanji: この先はあっちこっちに身に障り   月日手入りをすると思えよ
verses.english: Henceforth here and there shall appear disorders in the body of this or that person. Believe that it is the putting-in of the hand of Tsukihi!

verses.pt: Quando vierem, comparem com o próprio incômodo. Se houver semelhança, façam logo a limpeza.
verses.en_6th_ed: When you come, compare your disorder with this place. If the condition is the same, quickly begin the sweeping.
verses.ro: kitaru nara waga mi sawari to hikiyawase   onaji koto nara hayaku soji o
verses.jp1: きたるならわがみさハりとひきやハせ
verses.jp2: をなじ事ならはやくそふぢふ
verses.kanji: 来たるなら我が身障りと引き合わせ   同じ事なら早く掃除を
verses.english: When you come back here, compare it to the disorder of your own body! And if you find it the same, quickly begin to sweep both your mind and the ground!

verses.pt: Ao andar no local limpo, onde os pés pararem, será o local do Kanrodai.
verses.en_6th_ed: Walk over where you have swept, and you will come to a standstill. There, the Kanrodai...
verses.ro: soji shita tokoro o aruki tachidomari   sono tokoro yori Kanrodai o
verses.jp1: そふぢしたところをあるきたちとまり
verses.jp2: そのところよりかんろふだいを
verses.kanji: 掃除した所を歩き立ち止まり   その所より甘露台を
verses.english: Walk around the premises where you have cleanly swept! If your feet come to a standstill, set up the Kanrodai at that place!

verses.pt: Feito isto, completem os membros e comecem logo o Serviço. O espírito se animará.
verses.en_6th_ed: When it is done, assemble the performers and quickly begin the Service. Your minds will be spirited.
verses.ro: shitaru nara soreyori Tsutome te o soroi   hayaku kakare yo kokoro isamu de
verses.jp1: したるならそれよりつとめてをそろい
verses.jp2: はやくかゝれよ心いさむで
verses.kanji: したるならそれより勤め手を揃え   早く掛かれよ心勇むで
verses.english: After that quickly begin the Service with the performers in full numbers! Then your mind shall become cheered up.

verses.pt: Mesmo que procurem, não o encontrarão. Este é o pilar central da região dos esclarecidos.
verses.en_6th_ed: Indeed, wherever else you may seek it, it will never be found. It is the central pillar of Nihon.
verses.ro: kore bakari doko tazunetemo nai hodoni   kore nippon no shin no hashira ya
verses.jp1: こればかりどこたづねてもないほどに
verses.jp2: これにいほんのしんのはしらや
verses.kanji: こればかり何処尋ねても無い程に   これ日本の真の柱や
verses.english: Just this, wherever you may seek after it, it shall never be found at any other place. This is the central pillar which shall be set up in the region where My teachings spread early.

verses.pt: Se ao menos isto for certamente visto, não haverá o que temer, seja quem for.
verses.en_6th_ed: If only this comes surely into being, there will be no one whoever to fear.
verses.ro: kore saika tashika miekita koto naraba   donna mono demo osoru mono nashi
verses.jp1: これさいかたしかみへきた事ならば
verses.jp2: とんなものでもをそるものなし
verses.kanji: これさいか確か見え来た事ならば   どんな者でも怖る者無し
verses.english: If only this is surely realized, there shall be no one whom you must be afraid of.

verses.pt: O que quer que diga, se não for vista a prova da verdade, não serão possíveis os preparos posteriores.
verses.en_6th_ed: In any case, unless you are able to see the proof of the truth, I cannot set out on My next preparations.
verses.ro: nani yu mo shinjitsu naru no shoko ga   mien koto niwa ato no moyo o
verses.jp1: なにゆうもしんぢつなるのしよこふが
verses.jp2: みゑん事にわあとのもよふを
verses.kanji: 何に言うも真実なるの証拠が   見えん事には後の模様を
verses.english: In any case, unless the evidence of the truth is realized, I cannot set out on My next arrangements.

verses.pt: Embora sejam pessoas de quão altos lugares, farei as explanações onipotentemente.
verses.en_6th_ed: On however high a place you may be, I shall talk to you freely.
verses.ro: dono yona takai tokoro no mono ya tote   juyoshidai ni hanashi suru nari
verses.jp1: とのよふな高いところのものやとて
verses.jp2: ぢうよしだいにはなしするなり
verses.kanji: どの様な高い所の者やとて   自由自在に話するなり
verses.english: However high your position may be, I will freely talk to you.

verses.pt: Até agora, o que quer que tenha dito, vieram julgando como se fosse algo do espírito humano.
verses.en_6th_ed: Until now, whatever I said, you thought it had come from the mind of a human being.
verses.ro: imamade wa nani o yutemo ningen no   kokoro no yoni omote itaredo
verses.jp1: いまゝでハなにをゆうてもにんけんの
verses.jp2: 心のよふにをもていたれど
verses.kanji: 今迄は何を言うても人間の   心の様に思うて居たれど
verses.english: Until now you have thought that whatever I have said had come from the mind of a human being.

verses.pt: Desta vez, no que quer que diga, não pensem em absoluto que haja espírito humano.
verses.en_6th_ed: This time, whatever I may say, never think that it comes from a human mind.
verses.ro: konotabi wa nani o yutemo ningen no   kokoro aru towa sarani omouna
verses.jp1: このたびハなにをゆうてもにんけんの
verses.jp2: 心あるとハさらにをもうな
verses.kanji: この度は何を言うても人間の   心有るとは更に思うな
verses.english: This time, whatever I may say, never think that it comes from a human mind!

verses.pt: Seja o que for, ouçam atentamente. Não mesclo em absoluto o espírito humano.
verses.en_6th_ed: Please listen closely to whatever I say. Never is there mixed the least bit of a human mind.
verses.ro: dono yona koto demo shikato kiite kure   ningen gokoro sarani mazen de
verses.jp1: どのよふな事でもしかときいてくれ
verses.jp2: にんけん心さらにまぜんで
verses.kanji: どの様な事でも確と聞いて呉れ   人間心更に混ぜんで
verses.english: Please listen to Me attentively, whatever I may say! I will never mix it with human thoughts.

verses.pt: Tsukihi começará a dizer firmemente o que quer que seja; que ouçam isto.
verses.en_6th_ed: Tsukihi is going to tell you clearly about all matters. Listen to Me, please.
verses.ro: Tsukihi yori dono yona koto mo shikkari to   yuikakeru de na kore kiite kure
verses.jp1: 月日よりどのよな事もしいかりと
verses.jp2: ゆいかけるでなこれきいてくれ
verses.kanji: 月日よりどの様な事も確りと   言い掛けるでなこれ聞いて呉れ
verses.english: I, Tsukihi, am going to tell you any and everything clearly. Please listen to it!

verses.pt: Se as duas pessoas tomadas como sacrários por Tsukihi forem postas em quartos separados...
verses.en_6th_ed: I desire that the two persons received as shrines by Tsukihi each be given a separate room.
verses.ro: Tsukihi yori yashiro to naru o futari tomo   betsuma hedatete oite morotara
verses.jp1: 月日よりやしろとなるを二人とも
verses.jp2: べつまへだてゝをいてもろたら
verses.kanji: 月日より社となるを二人共   別間隔てて置いて貰うたら
verses.english: I desire to place both of the two persons who transmit the intention of Tsukihi in separate and special rooms.

verses.pt: Desde então, o que quer que peçam, comprometo-me em fazer a salvação. Observem atentamente.
verses.en_6th_ed: Then, in whatever you pray, your salvation will be assured. Watch closely!
verses.ro: nani yu mo soreyori shikato ukeyote   tasuke suru zo ya shikato mite iyo
verses.jp1: なにゆうもそれよりしかとうけよふて
verses.jp2: たすけするぞやしかとみていよ
verses.kanji: 何言うもそれより確と請け合うて   救けするぞや確と見て居よ
verses.english: Then I will assuredly save you in whatever you pray. Watch closely!

verses.pt: Doravante, farei toda e qualquer salvação porque tudo é a base do meu compromisso.
verses.en_6th_ed: This is the basis by which any salvation will be assured hereafter.
verses.ro: konosaki wa dono yona tasuke suru no mo na   mina ukeyau no moto de aru kara
verses.jp1: このさきハどのよなたすけするのもな
verses.jp2: みなうけやうのもとであるから
verses.kanji: この先はどの様な救けするのもな   皆請け合うの元で有るから
verses.english: This is the basis on which I assure any and every salvation to be realized in the future.

verses.pt: Não desprezem qualquer coisa que diga; peço que fiquem cientes, ouvindo atentamente.
verses.en_6th_ed: Do not disregard anything I say. Listen closely and comply with it, please.
verses.ro: dono yona koto o yutemo kesan yo   tashika kikisumi shochi shite kure
verses.jp1: どのよふな事をゆうてもけさんよふ
verses.jp2: たしかきゝすみしよちしてくれ
verses.kanji: どの様な事を言うても消さぬ様   確か聞き澄み承知して呉れ
verses.english: Whatever I may say, never put it out! Please listen to it and comply with it!

verses.pt: Doravante, por mais difíceis que sejam as doenças, salvarei todos, comprometendo-me de tudo.
verses.en_6th_ed: Hereafter, however serious your illness may be, I assure you salvation in every case.
verses.ro: konosaki wa donna mutsukashi yamai demo   mina ukeyote tasuke suru zo ya
verses.jp1: このさきハどんなむつかしやまいでも
verses.jp2: みなうけよふてたすけするぞや
verses.kanji: この先はどんな難し病でも   皆請け合うて救けするぞや
verses.english: Henceforth, however serious your disease may be, I will always save you assuredly.

verses.pt: Embora não haja o que se diz doença no homem, não há quem conheça o início deste mundo.
verses.en_6th_ed: Though there should be nothing called illness in human beings, no one knows the beginning of this world.
verses.ro: ningen ni yamai to yute nai keredo   kono yo hajimari shirita mono nashi
verses.jp1: にんけんにやまいとゆうてないけれど
verses.jp2: このよはじまりしりたものなし
verses.kanji: 人間に病と言うて無いけれど   この世初まり知りた者無し
verses.english: For human beings there is nothing that should be called illness. But no one knows the truth of the creation of this world.

verses.pt: Por desejar informar gradualmente este fato, criei médicos e remédios para tratamento e fertilização.
verses.en_6th_ed: Because of My desire to have you know this, I began doctors and medicine for weeding and fertilizing.
verses.ro: kono koto o shirashitai kara dandan to   shuri ya koe ni isha kusuri o
verses.jp1: この事をしらしたいからたん／＼と
verses.jp2: しゆりやこゑにいしやくすりを
verses.kanji: この事を知らしたいから段々と   修理や肥に医者薬を
verses.english: To make this known to you, I have begun doctors and medicine as a means of weeding and fertilizing.

verses.pt: Doravante, explicarei tudo sobre todas as coisas, escutem atentamente seja o que for.
verses.en_6th_ed: From now on, I shall teach you everything about all matters. Listen closely to whatever I say.
verses.ro: korekara wa nanika yorozu o mina toku de   donna koto demo shikato kiku nari
verses.jp1: これからハなにかよろづをみなとくで
verses.jp2: どんな事でもしかときくなり
verses.kanji: これからは何か万を皆説くで   どんな事でも確と聞くなり
verses.english: From now on I will teach you any and everything. Listen attentively to whMatever I may say!

verses.pt: Até agora, embora tenha explicado quase tudo, ainda há verdades não ditas.
verses.en_6th_ed: Though even until now I have taught most of My teachings, there remains a truth yet untold.
verses.ro: koremade mo taite hanashi mo toitaredo   mada yute nai shinjitsu no koto
verses.jp1: これまでもたいてはしもといたれど
verses.jp2: まだゆうてないしんぢつの事
verses.kanji: これ迄も大抵話も説いたれど   未だ言うて無い真実の事
verses.english: Hitherto I have told you almost all My teachings. But there remains the ultimate truth untold.

verses.pt: De hoje em diante, não sabem o que poderei dizer. O espírito de Tsukihi está realmente apressado.
verses.en_6th_ed: What do you think I shall say from today on? The mind of Tsukihi truly hastens.
verses.ro: kyokara wa dono yona koto o yu yara na   Tsukihi no kokoro makoto sekikomi
verses.jp1: けふからハどのよな事をゆうやらな
verses.jp2: 月日の心まことせきこみ
verses.kanji: 今日からはどの様な事を言うやらな   月日の心真急き込み
verses.english: Starting from today I will tell you things which you have never dreamed of. The mind of Tsukihi is impatiently hastening.

verses.pt: O que se apressa dia a dia? É apenas o preparo para Tsukihi sair.
verses.en_6th_ed: What is it that I hasten day after day? It is solely the preparation for Tsukihi to rush out.
verses.ro: nichinichi ni nani sekikomu to yu naraba   Tsukihi tobideru moyo bakari o
verses.jp1: にち／＼になにせきこむとゆうならば
verses.jp2: 月日とびでるもよふばかりを
verses.kanji: 日々に何急き込むと言うならば   月日飛び出る模様ばかりを
verses.english: What do you think I am hastening about day by day? I, Tsukihi, am solely hastening arrangements for rushing out.

verses.pt: Ouvindo atentamente estas explanações, fiquem cientes. Não sabem o que poderá realizar.
verses.en_6th_ed: Listen closely to this talk and understand it well. There is no knowing what I shall do.
verses.ro: kono hanashi shikkari kiite shochi seyo   donna koto oba suru ya shiren de
verses.jp1: このはなししいかりきいてしよちせよ
verses.jp2: どんな事をばするやしれんで
verses.kanji: この話確り聞いて承知せよ   どんな事をばするや知れんで
verses.english: Listen attentively to My words and comply with them! I will manifest that which no one can foresee.

verses.pt: Compreendam bem as condições do caminho a trilhar daqui em diante. É pedido de Tsukihi.
verses.en_6th_ed: Please understand well what I say about the conditions of the path ahead. This is the request of Tsukihi.
verses.ro: konosaki no michi no yodai shikkari to   kikiwakete kure Tsukihi tanomi ya
verses.jp1: このさきのみちのよふだいしいかりと
verses.jp2: きゝわけてくれ月日たのみや
verses.kanji: この先の道の様態確りと   聞き分けて呉れ月日頼みや
verses.english: Listen attentively and understand well the state of this way in the future! I, Tsukihi, request you to do it.

verses.pt: Ao ouvirem que Tsukihi tem saído, apresentem depressa o Kanrodai.
verses.en_6th_ed: When you hear that Tsukihi has rushed out, quickly bring out the Kanrodai.
verses.ro: Tsukihi yori tobideta koto o kiita nara   Kanrodai o hayaku dasu yo
verses.jp1: 月日よりとびでた事をきいたなら
verses.jp2: かんろふだいをばやくだすよふ
verses.kanji: 月日より飛び出た事を聞いたなら   甘露台を早く出すよう
verses.english: Bring out the Kanrodai immediately upon hearing that Tsukihi has rushed out!

verses.pt: Preparem firmemente o espírito para Jiba, o local a ser assentado o Kanrodai.
verses.en_6th_ed: Prepare your minds for the place of the Jiba, the place where the Kanrodai is to be set up.
verses.ro: Kanrodai sueru tokoro o shikkari to   Jiba no tokoro o kokoro zumori o
verses.jp1: かんろたいすへるところをしいかりと
verses.jp2: ぢばのところを心づもりを
verses.kanji: 甘露台据える所を確りと   地場の所を心積りを
verses.english: Prepare your mind to surely identify the Jiba, the place where the Kanrodai is to be set up!

verses.pt: Se ao menos isto for certamente determinado, seja em que for, não haverá qualquer perigo.
verses.en_6th_ed: If only this is surely settled, there will be no danger in anything at all.
verses.ro: kore saika tashika sadamete oita nara   donna koto demo abunaki wa nai
verses.jp1: これさいかたしかさだめてをいたなら
verses.jp2: とんな事でもあふなきハない
verses.kanji: これさいか確か定めて置いたなら   どんな事でも危なきは無い
verses.english: If only you have settled this spot surely, there will be nothing dangerous at all.

verses.pt: Uma palavra sobre aonde Tsukihi sairá. Será nos lugares altos e nos locais distantes.
verses.en_6th_ed: Just a word on where Tsukihi will rush out: to the high and the distant places.
verses.ro: Tsukihi yori tobideru tokoro choto hanashi   takai tokoro ya toi tokoro i
verses.jp1: 月日よりとびでるところ一寸はなし
verses.jp2: 高いところやとふいところい
verses.kanji: 月日より飛び出る所一寸話   高い所や遠い所い
verses.english: Just a word on the place to which Tsukihi shall rush out. It is a place high or a place far.

verses.pt: Ouvindo essa explanação, todas as pessoas admirarão: Como Tsukihi é grandioso!
verses.en_6th_ed: When people hear of this story, there will be talk among everyone of Tsukihi's greatness.
verses.ro: sono hanashi kiitaru naraba ichiretsu wa   nanto Tsukihi wa erai mono ya to
verses.jp1: そのはなしきいたるならば一れつわ
verses.jp2: なんと月日ハゑらいものやと
verses.kanji: その話聞いたるならば一列は   何と月日は偉い者やと
verses.english: When all people of the world hear of it, they will admire Tsukihi, saying how great Tsukihi is.

verses.pt: O mundo inteiro virá gradualmente a falar disso. Quando esse dia chegar, os corações se tornarão radiantes.
verses.en_6th_ed: Step by step, everyone in the world will speak of it. When that day comes, your heart will be brightened.
verses.ro: sekaiju mina dandan to yu de aro   sono hi kitareba mune ga hareru de
verses.jp1: せかいぢうみなたん／＼とゆうてあろ
verses.jp2: その日きたればむねかはれるで
verses.kanji: 世界中皆段々と言うで有ろ   その日来たれば胸が晴れるで
verses.english: Thus one by one all people of the whole world shall be filled with admiration. When such a day comes, all regret shall be thoroughly cleared away.

verses.pt: Compadeço-me realmente dos pesares acumulados nos corações desde trinta e oito anos antes até agora.
verses.en_6th_ed: From thirty-eight years ago until now, the regret in your heart: how pitiful it is.
verses.ro: imamade wa sanju hachi nen izen kara   mune no zannen makoto kinodoku
verses.jp1: いまゝでハ三十八ねんいせんから
verses.jp2: むねのさんねんまこときのどく
verses.kanji: 今迄は三十八年以前から   胸の残念真気の毒
verses.english: I am very sorry for the regret which has accumulated in your heart from thirty-eight years ago until now.

verses.pt: Desta vez, informarei firmemente a respeito de tudo a todas as pessoas igualmente.
verses.en_6th_ed: At this time, I shall make all things clearly known to everyone in the world.
verses.ro: konotabi wa dono yona koto mo shikkari to   mina ichiretsu ni shirasu koto nari
verses.jp1: このたびハどのよな事もしいかりと
verses.jp2: みな一れつにしらす事なり
verses.kanji: この度はどの様な事も確りと   皆一列に知らす事なり
verses.english: This time I will make any and everything clearly known to all people of the world.

verses.pt: O que pensam que informarei? Certamente, informarei sobre o Parens original.
verses.en_6th_ed: What do you think it is that I shall make known? I shall make the Parent of Origin clearly known.
verses.ro: shirasuru mo nani shirasuru to omou kana   moto naru Oya o tashika shirasuru
verses.jp1: しらするもなにしらするとをもうかな
verses.jp2: もとなるをやをたしかしらする
verses.kanji: 知らするも何知らすると思うかな   元なる親を確か知らする
verses.english: I am going to make it known. What do you think it is? I am going to make the original Parent surely known.

verses.pt: O fato de informar sobre tais coisas, não há quem saiba o que possa ser.
verses.en_6th_ed: Though I begin to speak to make such a thing known, perhaps no one knows what it is about.
verses.ro: kono yona koto o yuikake shirasuru mo   nanno koto yara tare mo shiromai
verses.jp1: このよふな事をゆいかけしらするも
verses.jp2: なんの事やらたれもしろまい
verses.kanji: この様な事を言い掛け知らするも   何の事やら誰も知ろまい
verses.english: Although I begin to tell you and let you know these things, perhaps no one can understand the true meaning of My words.

verses.pt: Começarei a informar a verdade a todas as pessoas igualmente, por desejar salvar este mundo.
verses.en_6th_ed: I begin to make the truth known to all humankind from My desire to save this world.
verses.ro: kono yo o ichiretsu naru ni shinjitsu o   tasuketai kara shirashi kakeru de
verses.jp1: このよふを一れつなるにしんちつを
verses.jp2: たすけたいからしらしかけるで
verses.kanji: この世を一列なるに真実を   救けたいから知らし掛けるで
verses.english: I begin to make the truth known to all people of the world, because of My earnest desire to save you all.

verses.pt: Desde que realizo a salvação não tida até agora, não posso deixar de informar sobre a origem.
verses.en_6th_ed: Now that I shall work salvation unknown until now, it is necessary to make the origin known.
verses.ro: imamade ni nai tasuke oba suru kara wa   moto o shirasan koto ni oite wa
verses.jp1: いまゝでにないたすけをばするからハ
verses.jp2: もとをしらさん事にをいてわ
verses.kanji: 今迄に無い救けをばするからは   元を知らさん事に於いては
verses.english: In order to manifest remarkable salvation which has never existed before, it is necessary to make the origin clearly known.

verses.pt: Para ensinar coisas desconhecidas até agora, certamente informarei sobre o Parens original.
verses.en_6th_ed: To teach you things unknown until now, I shall make the Parent of Origin clearly known.
verses.ro: imamade mo shiranu koto oba oshieru wa   moto naru Oya o tashika shirasuru
verses.jp1: いまゝでもしらぬ事をばをしへるハ
verses.jp2: もとなるをやふたしかしらする
verses.kanji: 今迄も知らぬ事をば教えるは   元なる親を確か知らする
verses.english: As I am going to teach you those things which have never been known before, I will make the original Parent surely known.

verses.pt: Se conhecerem certamente o Parens original, me encarregarei de toda e qualquer coisa.
verses.en_6th_ed: When you come to know the Parent of Origin clearly, I shall give you My assurance on anything whatever.
verses.ro: moto naru no Oya o tashikani shirita nara   donna koto demo mina hikiukeru
verses.jp1: 元なるのをやふたしかにしりたなら
verses.jp2: とんな事でもみなひきうける
verses.kanji: 元なるの親を確かに知りたなら   どんな事でも皆引き受ける
verses.english: When you come to know the original Parent positively, I will take charge of anything, whatever it may be.

verses.pt: Não pensem quem é que faz estas explanações. É somente o espírito de Tsukihi.
verses.en_6th_ed: Do not wonder who speaks these words. They are from none other than the mind of Tsukihi.
verses.ro: kono hanashi tare ga yu towa omouna yo   Tsukihi no kokoro bakari naru zo ya
verses.jp1: このはなしたれがゆうとハをもうなよ
verses.jp2: 月日の心ばかりなるぞや
verses.kanji: この話誰が言うとは思うなよ   月日の心ばかりなるぞや
verses.english: Never wonder who is saying these words! It is nothing but the mind of Tsukihi.

verses.pt: Observem todos do mundo por todas as épocas; o que se diz doença, há vários tipos.
verses.en_6th_ed: Look all over the world and through all ages. You will find many kinds of illnesses so-called.
verses.ro: yorozuyo no sekai ichiretsu miwatase yo   yamai to yu mo iroiro ni aru
verses.jp1: よろづよのせかい一れつみハたせよ
verses.jp2: やまいとゆうもいろ／＼にある
verses.kanji: 万代の世界一列見渡せよ   病と言うも色々に有る
verses.english: Look all over the world and through all ages! Then you shall find varieties of so-called illness, sickness or disease.

verses.pt: Desta vez, quão grave seja a doença, comprometendo-me, salvarei e ensinarei o seu segredo.
verses.en_6th_ed: This time, no matter how serious your illness may be, I shall teach you the family recipe for your assured salvation.
verses.ro: konotabi wa donna mutsukashi yamai demo   ukeyote tasuke kaden oshieru
verses.jp1: このたびハどんなむつかしやまいでも
verses.jp2: うけよてたすけかでんをしゑる
verses.kanji: この度はどんな難し病でも   請け合うて救け家伝教える
verses.english: This time I will teach you the family recipe to cure assuredly whatever kinds of serious diseases.

verses.pt: Doravante, explicarei certamente sobre os remédios. O que quer que diga, fiquem cientes.
verses.en_6th_ed: From now on, I shall tell you clearly about the ingredients. Please understand well, whatever I say.
verses.ro: korekara wa tashikani yakumi yute kikasu   nani o yutemo shochi shite kure
verses.jp1: これからハたしかにやくみゆてきかす
verses.jp2: なにをゆうてもしよちしてくれ
verses.kanji: これからは確かに薬味言うて聞かす   何を言うても承知して呉れ
verses.english: From now on I will teach you positively how to arrange the spices. Understand it well, whatever I may say!

verses.pt: Deve ser penoso o sofrimento atual. Pense no prazer que virá posteriormente.
verses.en_6th_ed: Your suffering at this time must be trying. But look forward to the promise in your future.
verses.ro: konotabi no nayamu tokoro wa tsurakaro   ato no tokoro no tanoshimi o miyo
verses.jp1: このたびのなやむところハつらかろふ
verses.jp2: あとのところのたのしみをみよ
verses.kanji: この度の悩む所は辛かろう   後の所の楽しみを見よ
verses.english: It may be unbearably painful that you are now suffering from a disease. But look forward to the delight which shall come in the future!

verses.pt: Prevenindo ao máximo, tenho informado com antecedência. Procurem refletir.
verses.en_6th_ed: Before it occurred, I had given you as much notice as I was able. Ponder over it.
verses.ro: sakiyori ni seeippai ni kotowari ga   yute aru zo ya shiyan shite miyo
verses.jp1: さきよりにせへいゝばいにことハりが
verses.jp2: ゆうてあるぞやしやんしてみよ
verses.kanji: 先よりに精一杯に断りが   言うて有るぞや思案して見よ
verses.english: Beforehand I have warned you as much as I could. Ponder over it deeply!

verses.pt: Qualquer coisa que realize, é trabalho que começo após informar com antecedência.
verses.en_6th_ed: In whatever I do, I give you notice of it beforehand and then begin My workings.
verses.ro: dono yona koto o suru nimo saki i yori   kotowarita ue kakaru shigoto ya
verses.jp1: どのよふな事をするにもさきいより
verses.jp2: ことわりたゆへかゝるしことや
verses.kanji: どの様な事をするにも先いより   断りた故掛かる仕事や
verses.english: Before I begin My work, I always warn you beforehand. And then I begin to manifest My work.

verses.pt: O que pensam ser esta explanação? É o desejo de informar a onipotência de Tsukihi.
verses.en_6th_ed: What do you think of this talk? It is because I desire you to know the free and unlimited workings of Tsukihi.
verses.ro: kono hanashi doyu koto ni omou kana   Tsukihi juyo shirashitai yue
verses.jp1: このはなしどふゆう事にをもうかな
verses.jp2: 月日ぢうよふしらしたいゆゑ
verses.kanji: この話どういう事に思うかな   月日自由知らしたい故
verses.english: What do you think of this talk? I desire to let you know the omnipotence of Tsukihi.

verses.pt: Embora o espírito de Tsukihi apresse sinceramente esta verdade única,
verses.en_6th_ed: Though the mind of Tsukihi sincerely hastens to have you know this one truth quickly,
verses.ro: shinjitsu ni kono ichijo o hayabaya to   Tsukihi no kokoro sete iredomo
verses.jp1: しんぢつにこの一ぢよふはや／＼と
verses.jp2: 月日の心せへていれども
verses.kanji: 真実にこの一条を早々と   月日の心急いて居れども
verses.english: Truly I, Tsukihi, am impatiently hastening to let you know this one truth as quickly as possible.

verses.pt: Por mais que Tsukihi tenha pedido aos próximos, ninguém o compreende. Quanto pesar!
verses.en_6th_ed: No matter how much Tsukihi pleads with you close to Me, no one understands. Oh, how I regret.
verses.ro: soba naru ni ika hodo Tsukihi tanondemo   kikiwake ga nai nanto zannen
verses.jp1: そばなるにいかほど月日たのんでも
verses.jp2: きゝわけがないなんとさんねん
verses.kanji: 側なるに如何程月日頼んでも   聞き分けが無い何と残念
verses.english: But, however earnestly I, Tsukihi, may request it, you close to Me do not comply with me. How regrettable it is!

verses.pt: O que quer que diga, não pensem em absoluto que seja só sobre fatos presentes.
verses.en_6th_ed: Whatever I say, never think that I am speaking about things in the present.
verses.ro: dono yona koto o yutemo ima no koto   nani o yu towa sarani omouna
verses.jp1: どのよふな事をゆうてもいまの事
verses.jp2: なにをゆうとハさらにをもうな
verses.kanji: どの様な事を言うても今の事   何を言うとは更に思うな
verses.english: Whatever I may say, never think that I am talking of the present!

verses.pt: Em todas explanações que faço gradualmente, deixo dito só coisas futuras.
verses.en_6th_ed: Whatever I may tell you step by step, it is solely about things which are to be.
verses.ro: dandan to nanino hanashi o suru nimo na   saki naru koto o bakari yute oku
verses.jp1: だん／＼となにのはなしをするにもな
verses.jp2: さきなる事をばかりゆてをく
verses.kanji: 段々と何の話をするにもな   先なる事をばかり言うて置く
verses.english: Whatever I may tell you step by step, I always tell you exclusively of the future.

verses.pt: Se indagarem o que explanarei de agora em diante, será unicamente a respeito do Kanrodai.
verses.en_6th_ed: To say what I shall speak about from now on: it will be solely about the Kanrodai.
verses.ro: korekara wa nanino hanashi o suru naraba   Kanrodai no hanashi ichijo
verses.jp1: これからハなにのはなしをするならば
verses.jp2: かんろふだいのはなし一ぢよ
verses.kanji: これからは何の話をするならば   甘露台の話一条
verses.english: What do you think I am going to tell you? I will tell you single-heartedly about the Kanrodai.

verses.pt: O presente Kanrodai, a que me refiro, não é nada mais do que um simples modelo.
verses.en_6th_ed: What is called the Kanrodai at the present time is but a mere model.
verses.ro: ima naru no Kanrodai to yu no wa na   choto no shinagata made no koto ya de
verses.jp1: いまなるのかんろふだいとゆうのハな
verses.jp2: 一寸のしながたまでの事やで
verses.kanji: 今なるの甘露台と言うのはな   一寸の雛型迄の事やで
verses.english: The Kanrodai, which is so called now, is but a mere pattern.

verses.pt: Doravante, explicarei gradual e firmemente, somente sobre o preparo do Kanrodai.
verses.en_6th_ed: From now on, I shall teach you clearly, step by step, solely about the preparations for the Kanrodai.
verses.ro: korekara wa dandan shikato yute kikasu   Kanrodai no moyo bakari o
verses.jp1: これからハだん／＼しかとゆてきかす
verses.jp2: かんろふだいのもよふばかりを
verses.kanji: これからは段々確と言うて聞かす   甘露台の模様ばかりを
verses.english: Since now step by step I will definitely teach you exclusively the plan of the Kanrodai.

verses.pt: Construa este pedestal com a largura de três shaku e em hexagonal, perfurando um pouco.
verses.en_6th_ed: Make the base of this Stand three shaku across and six-sided with a mortise at its center.
verses.ro: kono dai o sukoshi horikomi sashiwatashi   san jaku ni shite rokkaku ni seyo
verses.jp1: このだいをすこしほりこみさしハたし
verses.jp2: 三尺にして六かくにせよ
verses.kanji: この台を少し掘り込み差し渡し   三尺にして六角にせよ
verses.english: This Stand should be hexagonal and three shaku, about three feet, in diameter at the first step with a mortise at its centre.

verses.pt: As várias explanações feitas até agora foram só preparos para assentar este pedestal.
verses.en_6th_ed: Until now, I have taught you various things, but they are all preparations for setting up this Stand.
verses.ro: imamade ni iroiro hanashi toitaru wa   kono dai sueru moyo bakari de
verses.jp1: いまゝでにいろ／＼はなしといたるハ
verses.jp2: このだいすへるもよふばかりで
verses.kanji: 今迄に色々話説いたるは   この台据える模様ばかりで
verses.english: Till now I have taught you so assiduously, just because I hasten solely arrangements for setting up this Stand.

verses.pt: Se ao menos deixarem firmemente assentado, não haverá nada temeroso nem perigoso.
verses.en_6th_ed: If only this Stand has been put firmly in place, there will be nothing fearful or dangerous.
verses.ro: kore saika shikkari suete oita nara   nanimo kowami mo abunaki mo nai
verses.jp1: これさいかしいかりすへてをいたなら
verses.jp2: なにもこわみもあふなきもない
verses.kanji: これさいか確り据えて置いたなら   何も怖みも危なきも無い
verses.english: If only this Stand should be firmly set up, there shall remain nothing fearful or dangerous.

verses.pt: Se impedirem a construção feita inteiramente sob a indicação de Tsukihi, o próprio corpo parará.
verses.en_6th_ed: Should anyone dare to stop what is ordered by Tsukihi, his own life will be stopped.
verses.ro: Tsukihi yori sashizu bakari de shita koto o   kore tometa nara waga mi tomaru de
verses.jp1: 月日よりさしずばかりでした事を
verses.jp2: これとめたならハがみとまるで
verses.kanji: 月日より指図ばかりでした事を   これ止めたなら我が身止まるで
verses.english: Should anyone dare to stop this construction which is ordered by no one but Tsukihi, his own life shall be stopped.

verses.pt: Vendo-o, ficarão realmente satisfeitos e saberão que o ensinamento de Tsukihi é verdadeiro.
verses.en_6th_ed: When you see it, you will be truly satisfied and know that Tsukihi's teachings are indeed marvelous.
verses.ro: kore o mite makoto shinjitsu kekko to   kore wa Tsukihi no oshie naru ka yo
verses.jp1: これをみてまことしんぢつけへこふと
verses.jp2: これハ月日のをしゑなるかよ
verses.kanji: これを見て誠真実結構と   これは月日の教えなるかよ
verses.english: When you look at this Stand being set up, you will admire it and say: 'How truly splendid it is! This surely must be the teachings of Tsukihi.'

verses.pt: Tão logo este pedestal seja concluído, realizarão o Serviço e nada deixará de ser atendido.
verses.en_6th_ed: As soon as this Stand is completed, the Service will be done. Nothing will remain that cannot be realized.
verses.ro: kono dai ga deketachi shidai Tsutome suru   donna koto demo kanawan de nashi
verses.jp1: このだいがでけたちしだいつとめする
verses.jp2: どんな事でもかなハんでなし
verses.kanji: この台が出来建ち次第勤めする   どんな事でも叶わんで無し
verses.english: As soon as this Stand is set up, the performance of the Service shall be commenced. Then any and every prayer shall be heard.

verses.pt: Não direi quando e como fazer este pedestal. Realizarão o Serviço tão logo fique concluído.
verses.en_6th_ed: About this Stand: I do not say when or how, but when it is completed, the Service will be done.
verses.ro: kono dai mo itsu dose to yuwan de na   deketachita nara Tsutome suru zo ya
verses.jp1: このだいもいつどふせへとゆハんでな
verses.jp2: でけたちたならつとめするぞや
verses.kanji: この台も何時どうせいと言わんでな   出来建ちたなら勤めするぞや
verses.english: I never say when or what you must do to set up this Stand. But as soon as it is set up, the Service must be performed.

verses.pt: Se ao menos o Serviço for iniciado, jamais direi haver algo que não seja atendido.
verses.en_6th_ed: If only this Service is begun, nothing will remain that cannot be realized.
verses.ro: kore saika Tsutome ni kakari deta naraba   nani kanawan to yu de nai zo ya
verses.jp1: これさいかつとめにかゝりでたならば
verses.jp2: なにかなハんとゆうでないぞや
verses.kanji: これさいか勤めに掛かり出たならば   何叶わんと言うで無いぞや
verses.english: Once this Service is performed, there shall remain no prayer which cannot be heard.

verses.pt: Vejam isto! Tsukihi entregará seguramente a dádiva do alimento celeste.
verses.en_6th_ed: Watch! Tsukihi will surely bestow the Gift, the Food of Heaven, without fail.
verses.ro: kore o miyo tashikani Tsukihi jikimotsu no   atae shikkari tashika watasuru
verses.jp1: これをみよたしかに月日ぢきもつの
verses.jp2: あたゑしいかりたしかわたする
verses.kanji: これを見よ確かに月日食物の   与え確り確か渡する
verses.english: Look at this! I, Tsukihi, will assuredly bestow you the Gift of the Jikimotsu, the Heavenly Food.

verses.pt: Seja o que for, se não houver certamente uma prova verdadeira, será algo inseguro.
verses.en_6th_ed: In whatever matters, unless there is clear proof of the truth, it should remain questionable.
verses.ro: dono yona koto demo tashika shinjitsu no   shoko nakeneba ayaukii koto
verses.jp1: とのよふな事でもたしかしんちつの
verses.jp2: しよこなけねばあやうきい事
verses.kanji: どの様な事でも確か真実の   証拠無けねば危うきい事
verses.english: On whatever things, if there is no real and true evidence, it should be questionable.

verses.pt: Doravante, explicarei gradualmente seja o que for em detalhes. Não contrariem isto.
verses.en_6th_ed: From now on, I shall teach you everything in detail step by step. Do not go against My words.
verses.ro: korekara wa dono yona koto mo dandan to   komakashiku toku kore somukuna yo
verses.jp1: これからハとのよな事もたん／＼と
verses.jp2: こまかしくとくこれそむくなよ
verses.kanji: これからはどの様な事も段々と   細かしく説くこれ背くなよ
verses.english: From now on I will tell you step by step any and everything in detail. Never go against My words!

verses.pt: Não pensem do que se trata esta explanação. É unicamente sobre o preparo do Kanrodai.
verses.en_6th_ed: Do not wonder what it is that I am saying. It is solely about the preparations for the Kanrodai.
verses.ro: kono hanashi nani o yu ya to omouna yo   Kanrodai no moyo ichijo
verses.jp1: このはなしなにをゆうやとをもうなよ
verses.jp2: かんろふだいのもよふ一ぢよ
verses.kanji: この話何を言うやと思うなよ   甘露台の模様一条
verses.english: Never think that this talk is a mere trifle! I am speaking single-heartedly on the plan to set up the Kanrodai.

verses.pt: Este pedestal, empilhando os blocos um a um, e ainda no topo, outro com dois shaku e quatro sun,
verses.en_6th_ed: This Stand is to be made one block atop another step by step. The uppermost is to be two shaku and four sun.
verses.ro: kono dai mo dandan dan to tsumiagete   mata sono ue wa ni shaku shi sun ni
verses.jp1: このだいもたん／＼／＼とつみあけて
verses.jp2: またそのゆへハ二尺四すんに
verses.kanji: この台も段々々と積み上げて   またその上は二尺四寸に
verses.english: This Stand shall be built with each block piled upon another. The uppermost one should be two shaku and four sun.

verses.pt: E se um tacho raso for colocado em cima disso, desde então, darei certamente o alimento celeste.
verses.en_6th_ed: Place a flat vessel on top, and I shall surely bestow the Food of Heaven.
verses.ro: sono ue e hirabachi nosete oita nara   soreyori tashika jikimotsu o yaro
verses.jp1: そのうゑゝひらばちのせてをいたなら
verses.jp2: それよりたしかぢきもつをやろ
verses.kanji: その上へ平鉢載せて置いたなら   それより確か食物をやろ
verses.english: Put a flat vessel on it! Then I will surely bestow the Jikimotsu, the Heavenly Food.

verses.pt: Se querem saber a quem darei o alimento celeste, entregarei ao Parens, que iniciou este mundo.
verses.en_6th_ed: On whom do you think the Food of Heaven is to be bestowed? It is to be bestowed on the Parent who began this world.
verses.ro: jikimotsu o tare ni ataeru koto naraba   kono yo hajimeta Oya ni watasuru
verses.jp1: ぢきもつをたれにあたへる事ならば
verses.jp2: このよはじめたをやにわたする
verses.kanji: 食物を誰に与える事ならば   この世初めた親に渡する
verses.english: You may wonder upon whom this Jikimotsu, the Heavenly Food, will be bestowed. I will bestow it to the Parent who originated this human world.

verses.pt: Não há quem tenha compreendido o espírito do Parens que receberá a dádiva do céu.
verses.en_6th_ed: There is no one who knows the mind of the Parent who is to receive the Gift from Heaven.
verses.ro: ten yori ni atae o morau sono Oya no   kokoro o tare ka shirita mono nashi
verses.jp1: 天よりにあたへをもらうそのをやの
verses.jp2: 心をたれかしりたものなし
verses.kanji: 天よりに与えを貰うその親の   心を誰か知りた者無し
verses.english: There is no one who knows the mind of the Parent who shall receive the Gift from Heaven.

verses.pt: Tsukihi, tendo verificado certamente o espírito, entregará o alimento celeste.
verses.en_6th_ed: After Tsukihi surely ascertains the mind, then the Food of Heaven will be bestowed.
verses.ro: Tsukihi yori tashikani kokoro misadamete   soreyori watasu jikimotsu no koto
verses.jp1: 月日よりたしかに心みさだめて
verses.jp2: それよりハたすぢきもつの事
verses.kanji: 月日より確かに心見定めて   それより渡す食物の事
verses.english: Making sure of the mind, I, Tsukihi, will bestow the Jikimotsu, the Heavenly Food.

verses.pt: Se Tsukihi lhe deixar entregue este alimento, depois será entregue pelo Parens segundo o espírito.
verses.en_6th_ed: Once Tsukihi has bestowed it, the rest is up to the mind of the Parent.
verses.ro: Tsukihi niwa kore o watashite oita nara   ato wa Oya yori kokoro shidai ni
verses.jp1: 月日にハこれをハたしてをいたなら
verses.jp2: あとハをやより心したいに
verses.kanji: 月日にはこれを渡して置いたなら   後は親より心次第に
verses.english: I, Tsukihi, bestow this to the Parent, then the Parent is to bestow it to anyone at will.

verses.pt: A respeito da dádiva que será entregue do céu por Tsukihi, verificando o espírito sincero,
verses.en_6th_ed: About the Gift bestowed from Heaven after Tsukihi discerns the sincere mind:
verses.ro: shinjitsu no kokoro Tsukihi ga misadamete   ten yori watasu atae naru no wa
verses.jp1: しんぢつの心月日がみさだめて
verses.jp2: 天よりわたすあたゑなるのわ
verses.kanji: 真実の心月日が見定めて   天より渡す与えなるのは
verses.english: Making sure of the truly sincere mind, I, Tsukihi, will bestow the Gift from Heaven.

verses.pt: Jamais pensem ser algo insignificante, pois existe uma intenção profunda do céu.
verses.en_6th_ed: Never take it as a trivial matter. The intention of Heaven is profound.
verses.ro: choto shitaru koto towa sarani omouna yo   ten yori fukai omowaku ga aru
verses.jp1: 一寸したる事とハさらにをもうなよ
verses.jp2: 天よりふかいをもハくがある
verses.kanji: 一寸したる事とは更に思うなよ   天より深い思惑が有る
verses.english: Never take it as a trivial matter! It is from the deep intention of Heaven.

verses.pt: Quanto a esta explanação, trata-se de purificar o espírito também na região dos não-esclarecidos e na dos longínquos.
verses.en_6th_ed: To explain what this talk is about: I shall purify the minds of those in Kara and Tenjiku.
verses.ro: kono hanashi doyu koto de aro nara   kara tenjiku mo kokoro sumashite
verses.jp1: このはなしどふゆう事であろふなら
verses.jp2: からてんじくも心すまして
verses.kanji: この話どういう事で有ろうなら   唐天竺も心澄まして
verses.english: You may wonder what the true meaning of this talk is. I intend to cleanse the minds of all people who are living in the regions where My teachings shall spread later and last also.

verses.pt: Se indagarem como se purificarão estes espíritos, Tsukihi sairá aqui e acolá.
verses.en_6th_ed: How will those minds be purified? Tsukihi will rush out to places near and far.
verses.ro: kono kokoro doshite sumasu koto naraba   Tsukihi tobidete atchi kotchi to
verses.jp1: この心どふしてすます事ならば
verses.jp2: 月日とびでゝあゝちこゝちと
verses.kanji: この心どうして澄ます事ならば   月日飛び出てあっちこっちと
verses.english: You may wonder how it is possible to cleanse those minds. I, Tsukihi, will rush out to manifest My working here and there.

verses.pt: Tsukihi, introduzindo-se gradualmente nos corpos, começará a realizar a sua onipotência.
verses.en_6th_ed: Step by step, Tsukihi will enter bodies and begin free and unlimited workings.
verses.ro: dandan to Tsukihi tainai irikonde   juyojizai o shite kakaru de na
verses.jp1: たん／＼と月日たいない入こんで
verses.jp2: ぢうよぢざいをしてかゝるでな
verses.kanji: 段々と月日体内入り込んで   自由自在をして掛かるでな
verses.english: Step by step I, Tsukihi, will enter into your bodies, and will begin to manifest My omnipotence.

verses.pt: Se assim fizer, mesmo que digam ser da região dos não-esclarecidos, jamais poderão resistir aos esclarecidos.
verses.en_6th_ed: Then, however boastful those of Kara may be, they will never rival those in Nihon.
verses.ro: shitaru nara nanbo kara ya to yuta tote   nihon no mono ni kore wa kanawan
verses.jp1: したるならなんぼからやとゆうたとて
verses.jp2: にほんのものにこれハかなわん
verses.kanji: したるなら何ぼ唐やと言うたとて   日本の者にこれは敵わん
verses.english: Then however clever they may be, the people who shall understand My teachings later shall never be able to match those who understand My teachings early.

verses.pt: Convençam-se com aquilo que se vê dia a dia. Não sabem quando e que explanação poderão ouvir.
verses.en_6th_ed: Be convinced by the things that appear day by day. There is no knowing when or what you will hear.
verses.ro: nichinichi ni mieru tokoro de tokushin se   nandoki donna hanashi kiku yara
verses.jp1: にち／＼にみへるところでとくしんせ
verses.jp2: なんどきどんなはなしきくやら
verses.kanji: 日々に見える所で得心せ   何時どんな話聞くやら
verses.english: Look at things which turn up day by day, and understand well! There is no knowing when and what you shall hear.

verses.pt: Qual seja a explanação que ouvirem, esta é a explanação de Tsukihi feita com antecedência.
verses.en_6th_ed: Whatever you hear, it was taught beforehand in the talks of Tsukihi.
verses.ro: dono yona hanashi kiitemo saki i yori   kore wa Tsukihi no hanashi naru no ya
verses.jp1: どのよふなはなしきいてもさきいより
verses.jp2: これわ月日のはなしなるのや
verses.kanji: どの様な話聞いても先いより   これは月日の話なるのや
verses.english: Of whatever occurrences you may hear, they were all foretold to you by Tsukihi.

verses.pt: De agora em diante, Tsukihi apoiará gradualmente os esclarecidos. Fiquem observando.
verses.en_6th_ed: From now on, Tsukihi will favor those in Nihon step by step. Watch!
verses.ro: korekara wa nihon no mono wa dandan to   Tsukihi hikitate kore o mite iyo
verses.jp1: これからハにほんのものハたん／＼と
verses.jp2: 月日ひきたてこれをみていよ
verses.kanji: これからは日本の者は段々と   月日引き立てこれを見て居よ
verses.english: From now on those who understand My teachings early shall become favored by Tsukihi step by step. Wait and see it!

verses.pt: Ensinarei toda e qualquer coisa e farei com que não haja nada desconhecido.
verses.en_6th_ed: I shall teach you everything about all things so that nothing will remain which you do not know.
verses.ro: nanimo kamo dono yona koto mo mina oshie   shiran koto owa nai yoni suru
verses.jp1: なにもかもどのよな事もみなをしへ
verses.jp2: しらん事をハないよふにする
verses.kanji: 何もかもどの様な事も皆教え   知らん事をは無い様にする
verses.english: I will teach you any and everything so that there shall remain nothing which you do not know.

verses.pt: Se levantarem o pilar na região dos esclarecidos, farei com que não tenham doença, morte e enfraquecimento.
verses.en_6th_ed: When the pillar is set up in Nihon, you shall no longer fall ill, die, or become weakened.
verses.ro: nihon niwa hashira o tateta koto naraba   yamazu shinazu ni yowari naki yoni
verses.jp1: にほんにハはしらをたてた事ならば
verses.jp2: やまずしなすによハりなきよに
verses.kanji: 日本には柱を建てた事ならば   病まず死なずに弱り無き様に
verses.english: When the pillar is set up in the region where My teachings shall spread early, I will protect you from illness, death and decay.

verses.pt: Até agora, a região dos não-esclarecidos veio se alastrando e agindo à vontade; desta vez, será feita a devolução.
verses.en_6th_ed: Until now, those of Kara have rampantly done as they pleased. This time, I shall give them a return.
verses.ro: imamade wa kara ya to yute habikarite   mamani shite ita kondo kayashi o
verses.jp1: いまゝでハからやとゆうてはびかりて
verses.jp2: まゝにしていたこんどかやしを
verses.kanji: 今迄は唐やと言うて蔓延りて   侭にして居た今度返しを
verses.english: Hitherto those who shall understand My teachings later have been rampant and working as they please. But this time I will give them a return for it.

verses.pt: Esta explanação não diz a ninguém o que fazer. Tsukihi, revelando-se, fará à sua vontade.
verses.en_6th_ed: By this talk, I do not tell anyone to do anything. I, Tsukihi, shall rush out and do as I please.
verses.ro: kono hanashi tare ni dose to yu de nashi   Tsukihi tobidete mamani suru nari
verses.jp1: このはなしたれにどふせとゆうでなし
verses.jp2: 月日とびでゝまゝにするなり
verses.kanji: この話誰にどうせいと言うで無し   月日飛び出て侭にするなり
verses.english: By this talk I do not tell anyone to do anything. I, Tsukihi, will rush oMut and work My omnipotence.

verses.pt: Não houve até agora quem ignorasse a Lua e o Sol, mas não há quem tenha conhecido a origem real.
verses.en_6th_ed: Even until now, everyone has known the moon and the sun, but there is no one who knows the true origin.
verses.ro: koremade mo Tsukihi o shiran mono wa nai   naredo honmoto shirita mono nashi
verses.jp1: これまでも月日をしらんものハない
verses.jp2: なれとほんもとしりたものなし
verses.kanji: これ迄も月日を知らん者は無い   なれど本元知りた者無し
verses.english: Even until now there has been no one who does not know the moon and the sun; but no one has known their true origin.

verses.pt: Desta vez, explicarei a verdade de toda e qualquer coisa e apressarei a salvação.
verses.en_6th_ed: This time, I shall teach the truth of all matters and hasten to save you.
verses.ro: konotabi wa dono yona koto mo shinjitsu o   yute kikashite tasuke isogu de
verses.jp1: このたびハどのよな事もしんぢつを
verses.jp2: ゆうてきかしてたすけいそぐで
verses.kanji: この度はどの様な事も真実を   言うて聞かして救け急ぐで
verses.english: This time I will tell you any and every truth, and hasten to save you all.

verses.pt: Se indagarem quando será este dia, será logo que termine o tratamento das terras irrigadas.
verses.en_6th_ed: To say when this will come: it will come as soon as the weeding of the rice fields is done.
verses.ro: kono higara itsu goro naru to yu naraba   ta no shuri o shimai shidai ni
verses.jp1: このひがらいつころなるとゆうならば
verses.jp2: たあのしゆりをしまいしだいに
verses.kanji: この日柄何時頃なると言うならば   田の修理を終まい次第に
verses.english: If you ask when the day will come, it shall come as soon as the weeding of the paddy fields is finished.

verses.pt: Desde então, o caminho se tornará extraordinário. Todo o pessoal do Serviço virá a se reunir.
verses.en_6th_ed: Then, a marvelous path will open, and the performers of the Service will all assemble.
verses.ro: sorekara wa nanika mezurashi michi ni naru   Tsutome no ninju mina yorite kuru
verses.jp1: それからハなにかめづらしみちになる
verses.jp2: つとめのにんぢうみなよりてくる
verses.kanji: それからは何か珍し道になる   勤めの人衆皆寄りて来る
verses.english: Then there shall be opened a remarkable novel way. And the members for the Service will all come together.

verses.pt: O espírito se animará diária e gradualmente, quão abundante e excelente a produção em Yamato!
verses.en_6th_ed: Step by step and day by day, the mind will become spirited. What a rich harvest will appear in Yamato!
verses.ro: dandan to nichinichi kokoro isamu de na   nanto Yamato wa erai honen
verses.jp1: たん／＼とにち／＼心いさむでな
verses.jp2: なんとやまとハゑらいほふねん
verses.kanji: 段々と日々心勇むでな   何と大和はえらい豊年
verses.english: Step by step and day by day, the minds of the world shall become cheered up. And people admiring will say what a rich harvest has appeared in Yamato!

verses.pt: Apressem diariamente o Serviço, assim estarão livres de todo e qualquer infortúnio.
verses.en_6th_ed: Day by day, hasten to begin the Service. You will escape any danger whatever.
verses.ro: nichinichi ni hayaku Tsutome o sekikome yo   ika naru nan mo mina nogareru de
verses.jp1: にち／＼にはやくつとめをせきこめよ
verses.jp2: いかなるなんもみなのがれるで
verses.kanji: 日々に早く勤めを急き込めよ   如何なる難も皆逃れるで
verses.english: Hasten day by day to perform the Service at once! Then you shall escape whatever kinds of dangers.

verses.pt: Quão grave e difícil seja a doença, todos serão salvos com dedicação única ao Serviço.
verses.en_6th_ed: However serious your illness may be, you will all be saved by the Service done single-heartedly.
verses.ro: dono yona mutsukashiku naru yamai demo   Tsutome ichijo de mina tasukaru de
verses.jp1: とのよふなむつかしくなるやまいでも
verses.jp2: つとめ一ぢよてみなたすかるで
verses.kanji: どの様な難しくなる病でも   勤め一条で皆助かるで
verses.english: However serious your disease may be, you shall be saved by the single-hearted performance of the Service.

verses.pt: Quanto ao serviço a ser realizado, será a dedicação única ao Serviço do Kanrodai.
verses.en_6th_ed: As to the Service to be done, it is none other than the Service of the Kanrodai.
verses.ro: Tsutome demo doyu Tsutome suru naraba   Kanrodai no Tsutome ichijo
verses.jp1: つとめでもどふゆうつとめするならば
verses.jp2: かんろふだいのつとめいちゞよ
verses.kanji: 勤めでもどういう勤めするならば   甘露台の勤め一条
verses.english: If you wonder what kind of Service it is, I hasten to perform single-heartedly the Kanrodai-no-Tsutome,the Service around the Kanrodai.

verses.pt: O que pensam ser este pedestal? Este é o Parens da região dos esclarecidos.
verses.en_6th_ed: What do you think this Stand is? It is the Parent of Nihon.
verses.ro: kono dai o doyu koto ni omou kana   kore nippon no Oya de aru zo ya
verses.jp1: このたいをどふゆう事にをもうかな
verses.jp2: これにいほんのをやであるぞや
verses.kanji: この台をどういう事に思うかな   これ日本の親で有るぞや
verses.english: What do you think of this Stand? This is the Parent which will be set up in the region where My teachings spread early.

verses.pt: Se ao menos aceitarem isso com sinceridade verdadeira, Tsukihi se encarregará de tudo, distinguindo-os.
verses.en_6th_ed: If you but sincerely think this to be true, Tsukihi will discern it and assure anything whatever.
verses.ro: kore saika makoto shinjitsu omou nara   Tsukihi miwakete mina hikiukeru
verses.jp1: これさいかまことしんぢつをもうなら
verses.jp2: 月日みハけてみなひきうける
verses.kanji: これさいか誠真実思うなら   月日見分けて皆引き受ける
verses.english: If only you firmly believe in this truth, I, Tsukihi, will ascertain your mind and will take charge of everything to save you.

verses.pt: Se é Tsukihi quem diz que se encarregará, não existe absolutamente um mínimo de erro.
verses.en_6th_ed: Since I, Tsukihi, give My assurance, there will not be even a single error in a thousand.
verses.ro: Tsukihi yori hikiuke suru to yu kara wa   sen ni hitotsu mo chigau koto nashi
verses.jp1: 月日よりひきうけするとゆうからわ
verses.jp2: せんに一つもちがう事なし
verses.kanji: 月日より引き受けすると言うからは   千に一つも違う事無し
verses.english: Once I, Tsukihi, have said that I take charge, there shall not be even a single error out of one thousand.

verses.pt: Como estão ouvindo esta explanação a respeito do Serviço do Kanrodai?
verses.en_6th_ed: How are you hearing this talk? It is about the Service of the Kanrodai.
verses.ro: kono hanashi doyu koto ni kiite iru   Kanrodai no Tsutome naru no wa
verses.jp1: このはなしどふゆう事にきいている
verses.jp2: かんろふだいのつとめなるのわ
verses.kanji: この話どういう事に聞いて居る   甘露台の勤めなるのは
verses.english: How are you listening to this talk? Now I am going to tell you about the Kanrodai-no-Tsutome, the Service around the Kanrodai.

verses.pt: Não julguem ser um Serviço insignificante. É de trinta e seis pessoas que estou desejando.
verses.en_6th_ed: Do not think of this Service as being trivial. I desire as many as thirty-six people.
verses.ro: choto shitaru Tsutome naru towa omounayo   sanju roku nin nin ga hoshii de
verses.jp1: 一寸したるつとめなるとハをもうなよ
verses.jp2: 三十六人にんがほしいで
verses.kanji: 一寸したる勤めなるとは思うなよ   三十六人人が欲しいで
verses.english: Never regard it as a trivial Service! I desire to assemble thirty-six persons to begin with.

verses.pt: Desejo ainda dezenove pessoas, incluindo as dos instrumentos musicais, para o Serviço de Kagura.
verses.en_6th_ed: In time, I shall need nineteen performers for the Kagura Service, including those for the musical instruments.
verses.ro: sono uchi ni narimono irete ju ku nin   Kagura-zutome no ninju hoshii de
verses.jp1: そのうちになりものいれて十九人
verses.jp2: かぐらづとめの人ぢうほしいで
verses.kanji: その内に鳴り物入れて十九人   神楽勤めの人衆欲しいで
verses.english: In due time I shall need nineteen persons to perform the Kagura-Zutome, the Service with the Holy Masks, including those who play the musical instruments.

verses.pt: Meditem determinando sinceramente o espírito. Mediadores, peço-lhes o firme empenho.
verses.en_6th_ed: Truly settle your mind and ponder. I make this a firm request of you, My intermediaries.
verses.ro: shinjitsu ni kokoro sadamete shiyan seyo   toritsugi no hito shikato tanomu de
verses.jp1: しんぢつに心さだめてしやんせよ
verses.jp2: とりつぎの人しかとたのむで
verses.kanji: 真実に心定めて思案せよ   取次の人確と頼むで
verses.english: Ponder over it well, with determined sincerity of your mind! I request it firmly from the toritsugi, My mediators.

verses.pt: A fim de construir este pedestal, Tsukihi está preparando gradativamente o pessoal.
verses.en_6th_ed: To construct this Stand, Tsukihi is making preparations for the performers step by step.
verses.ro: kono dai o koshirae yo tote dandan ni   Tsukihi ninju no moyo suru nari
verses.jp1: このだいをこしらゑよとてたん／＼に
verses.jp2: 月日人ぢうのもよふするなり
verses.kanji: この台を拵えようとて段々に   月日人衆の模様するなり
verses.english: To accomplish the setting-up of this Stand, I, Tsukihi, am arranging to bring together the necessary members one by one.

verses.pt: Se o pessoal vier a reunir-se seguramente, o pedestal será construído por si mesmo.
verses.en_6th_ed: When the performers are fully assembled, the Stand, also, will be completed of its own accord.
verses.ro: ninju ga shikato yoritaru koto naraba   sono mama dai mo dekeru koto ya de
verses.jp1: 人ぢうがしかとよりたる事ならば
verses.jp2: そのまゝだいもでける事やで
verses.kanji: 人衆が確と寄りたる事ならば   その侭台も出来る事やで
verses.english: When the full number of the members is surely assembled, the construction of the Stand shall also naturally be accomplished.

verses.pt: Se indagarem como será o caminho para se fazer isto, Tsukihi ensinará as mãos do Serviço...
verses.en_6th_ed: To explain what this path is about: Tsukihi will teach them the hand movements of the Service, and then,
verses.ro: kono michi wa doyu koto de aru naraba   Tsukihi Tsutome no tee o oshiete
verses.jp1: このみちハどふゆう事であるならば
verses.jp2: 月日つとめのてゑをふしへて
verses.kanji: この道はどういう事で有るならば   月日勤めの手を教えて
verses.english: What do you think this way is? I, Tsukihi, will teach the hand-gestures of the Service.

verses.pt: Desde então, se Tsukihi sair conduzindo-o pelo mundo todo, será construído por si mesmo.
verses.en_6th_ed: When Tsukihi takes them forth all over the world, the Stand will be completed of itself.
verses.ro: soreyori mo Tsukihi ichiretsu sekaiju   tsurete deta nara hitori dekeru de
verses.jp1: それよりも月日一れつせかゑぢう
verses.jp2: つれてゞたならひとりでけるで
verses.kanji: それよりも月日一列世界中   連れて出たなら独り出来るで
verses.english: After that I, Tsukihi, will bring out these members all over the world. Then the Stand shall be set up itself.

verses.pt: Se ao menos isto for certamente construído, jamais haverá qualquer falha no Serviço mensal.
verses.en_6th_ed: If only this is surely completed, the Service each month will be done without error.
verses.ro: kore saika tashikani deketa koto naraba   tsukizuki Tsutome chigau koto nashi
verses.jp1: これさいかたしかにでけた事ならば
verses.jp2: 月々つとめちがう事なし
verses.kanji: これさいか確かに出来た事ならば   月々勤め違う事無し
verses.english: If only this is surely accomplished, the Service will be performed every month without a mistake.

verses.pt: Quando o Serviço for realizado sem falha, a dádiva do céu também jamais falhará.
verses.en_6th_ed: If only the Service is done without error, the Gift of Heaven, also, will be given without fail.
verses.ro: Tsutome sai chigawan yoni natta nara   ten no atae mo chigau koto nashi
verses.jp1: つとめさいちがハんよふになあたなら
verses.jp2: 天のあたゑもちがう事なし
verses.kanji: 勤めさい違わん様に成りたなら   天の与えも違う事無し
verses.english: Only if the Service comes to be performed without a mistake, the Gift of Heaven will also be bestowed without fail.

verses.pt: Este é o caminho da sinceridade verdadeira, um caminho difícil. Meditem todos.
verses.en_6th_ed: This path is a path of true sincerity and is difficult to follow. Everyone must ponder well.
verses.ro: kono michi wa makoto shinjitsu mutsukashii   michi de aru zo ya mina shiyan seyo
verses.jp1: このみちハまことしんぢつむつかしい
verses.jp2: みちであるぞやみなしやんせよ
verses.kanji: この道は誠真実難しい   道で有るぞや皆思案せよ
verses.english: This way is difficult for you to follow with true sincerity. Ponder over it well, all of you!

verses.pt: Não se sabe onde se encontra este pessoal, porém, Tsukihi distinguirá e atrairá todos.
verses.en_6th_ed: You may not know where these performers are. Tsukihi will discern them and draw them all forth.
verses.ro: kono ninju doko ni aru yara shiromai na   Tsukihi miwakete mina hikiyoseru
verses.jp1: この人ぢうどこにあるやらしろまいな
verses.jp2: 月日みわけてみなひきよせる
verses.kanji: この人衆何処に有るやら知ろまいな   月日見分けて皆引き寄せる
verses.english: Perhaps you do not know where these members can be found. But I, Tsukihi, will discern and draw hither all these members.

verses.pt: De que localidade sejam as pessoas, Tsukihi demonstrará a sua onipotência.
verses.en_6th_ed: No matter where these people may be, Tsukihi will do this by free and unlimited workings.
verses.ro: dono yona tokoro no mono to yuta tote   Tsukihi juyo shite miseru de na
verses.jp1: どのよふなところのものとゆうたとて
verses.jp2: 月日ぢうよふしてみせるでな
verses.kanji: どの様な所の者と言うたとて   月日自由して見せるでな
verses.english: Wherever the person may be living, I, Tsukihi, will work My omnipotence.

verses.pt: Após completar gradualmente o pessoal, indicarei as funções discernindo a sua sinceridade.
verses.en_6th_ed: After the performers are assembled step by step, I shall discern their sincerity and assign their roles.
verses.ro: dandan to ninju sorota sono ue de   shinjitsu o mite yakuwari o suru
verses.jp1: だん／＼と人ぢうそろふたそのゆへで
verses.jp2: しんぢつをみてやくわりをする
verses.kanji: 段々と人衆揃うたその上で   真実を見て役割をする
verses.english: And when the number of the members is filled up one by one, I will look at the true sincerity of their minds and will assign their roles in the Service.

verses.pt: Quanto a essas funções, são dez para o Kagura e demais para os instrumentos musicais.
verses.en_6th_ed: To explain what the roles are to be: ten for the Kagura and others for the musical instruments.
verses.ro: yakuwari mo doyu koto de aru naraba   Kagura ju nin ato i narimono
verses.jp1: やくハりもどふゆう事であるならば
verses.jp2: かぐら十人あといなりもの
verses.kanji: 役割もどういう事で有るならば   神楽十人後い鳴り物
verses.english: You may wonder how the roles should be assigned. First I need ten persons for the Kagura and then others for the musical instruments.

verses.pt: Se ao menos isto for completado depressa e seguramente, nada haverá que não se realize.
verses.en_6th_ed: If only this assemblage is quickly completed, nothing will remain that cannot be achieved.
verses.ro: kore saika hayaku shikkari sorota nara   donna koto demo deken koto nashi
verses.jp1: これさいかはやくしいかりそろたなら
verses.jp2: どんな事でもでけん事なし
verses.kanji: これさいか早く確り揃うたなら   どんな事でも出来ん事無し
verses.english: Once the number is quickly and definitely filled up, there shall remain nothing which cannot be achieved.

verses.pt: De hoje em diante, mudarei de expressão gradualmente, direi somente coisas desconhecidas até agora.
verses.en_6th_ed: From today, I shall change the topic step by step and speak solely of things you have not known before.
verses.ro: kyokara wa dandan monku kawaru de na   imamade shiran koto bakari yu
verses.jp1: けふからハだん／＼もんくかハるでな
verses.jp2: いまゝでしらん事ばかりゆう
verses.kanji: 今日からは段々文句変わるでな   今迄知らん事ばかり言う
verses.english: From today the topic of My words shall be changed. I will tell you solely whatever things which you have never known before.

verses.pt: Embora até agora houvesse vários caminhos, nada há que não fosse ensinado por Tsukihi.
verses.en_6th_ed: Even until now, there have been various paths, but there is nothing that has not been taught by Tsukihi.
verses.ro: imamade mo dono yona michi mo aru keredo   Tsukihi oshien koto wa nai zo ya
verses.jp1: いまゝでもどのよなみちもあるけれど
verses.jp2: 月日をしへん事わないぞや
verses.kanji: 今迄もどの様な道も有るけれど   月日教えん事は無いぞや
verses.english: Hitherto there have been various ways. But there is nothing which has not been taught by Tsukihi.

verses.pt: Tsukihi veio ensinando gradualmente quase tudo a respeito de todas as coisas.
verses.en_6th_ed: Though Tsukihi has already taught you most everything step by step,
verses.ro: Tsukihi yori taite nanimo dandan to   oshiete kitaru koto de aredomo
verses.jp1: 月日よりたいてへなにもだん／＼と
verses.jp2: をしゑてきたる事であれども
verses.kanji: 月日より大抵何も段々と   教えて来たる事で有れども
verses.english: I, Tsukihi, have taught step by step almost any and everything.

verses.pt: Além disso, desta vez, explicará todas as verdades que são ainda desconhecidas.
verses.en_6th_ed: This time, I shall teach you further all the truths yet unknown to you.
verses.ro: konotabi wa mata sono ue no shiran koto   nanimo shinjitsu mina yute kikasu
verses.jp1: このたびハまたそのゆへのしらん事
verses.jp2: なにもしんぢつみなゆてきかす
verses.kanji: この度はまたその故の知らん事   何も真実皆言うて聞かす
verses.english: This time I will tell you furthermore on whatever truth which you have never known.

verses.pt: Até agora, dizendo-se a região dos não-esclarecidos, alastrou-se, porém, isto também foi ensinado por Tsukihi.
verses.en_6th_ed: Until now, those of Kara have been boastfully thriving, but they also have been taught by Tsukihi.
verses.ro: koremade wa kara ya to yute habikarita   kore mo Tsukihi ga oshie kitaru de
verses.jp1: これまでハからやとゆうてはびかりた
verses.jp2: これも月日がをしへきたるで
verses.kanji: これ迄は唐やと言うて蔓延りた   これも月日が教え来たるで
verses.english: Hitherto those who shall understand My teachings later have been rampant. But these also have been taught by Tsukihi.

verses.pt: Desta vez, Tsukihi, retrocedendo à origem, revela seguramente toda a raiz da árvore.
verses.en_6th_ed: This time, returning to the origin, Tsukihi will clearly reveal the whole root of the tree.
verses.ro: konotabi wa Tsukihi moto e to tachikairi   ki no ne shikkari mina arawasu de
verses.jp1: このたびハ月日元ゑとたちかいり
verses.jp2: 木のねしいかりみなあらハすで
verses.kanji: この度は月日元へと立ち返り   木の根確り皆現すで
verses.english: This time I, Tsukihi, have come back to the origin and will clearly manifest all the power of the root of the tree.

verses.pt: Seja de onde for, não há absolutamente quem conheça realmente a origem deste mundo.
verses.en_6th_ed: There is perhaps no one anywhere who clearly knows the origin of this world.
verses.ro: kono yono moto o shikkari shirita mono   doko no mono demo sarani arumai
verses.jp1: このよふの元をしいかりしりたもの
verses.jp2: どこのものでもさらにあるまい
verses.kanji: この世の元を確り知りた者   何処の者でも更に有るまい
verses.english: In whatever place, there shall be found no one who knows clearly the origin of this world.

verses.pt: Onde quer que possam ir, se ao menos conhecerem realmente esta origem...
verses.en_6th_ed: If you but clearly know this origin, you will always be assured, wherever you may go.
verses.ro: shinjitsu ni kono moto saika shikkari to   shiritaru naraba doko i ita tote
verses.jp1: しんぢつにこの元さいかしいかりと
verses.jp2: しりたるならばどこいいたとて
verses.kanji: 真実にこの元さいか確りと   知りたるならば何処へ行たとて
verses.english: If only you can clearly understand this origin, you shall be always assured wherever you may go.

verses.pt: Com que pensamento estão ouvindo esta explanação? Desejo instruir isto aos mediadores.
verses.en_6th_ed: What do you think on hearing this talk? I desire to train My intermediaries in this.
verses.ro: kono hanashi nanto omote kiite iru   kore toritsugi ni shikomitai no ya
verses.jp1: このはなしなんとをもふてきいている
verses.jp2: これとりつぎにしこみたいのや
verses.kanji: この話何と思うて聞いて居る   これ取次に仕込みたいのや
verses.english: What do you think on hearing this talk? I desire to teach this to the toritsugi, My mediators.

verses.pt: Tudo que Tsukihi está pensando é revelar a origem dos seres humanos ao mundo inteiro.
verses.en_6th_ed: All that Tsukihi desires is to have the whole world know the origin of human beings.
verses.ro: dono yona koto o Tsukihi no omou niwa   ningen moto o kore sekaiju e
verses.jp1: どのよふな事を月日のをもうにハ
verses.jp2: にんけんもとをこれせかゑぢうへ
verses.kanji: どの様な事を月日の思うには   人間元をこれ世界中へ
verses.english: You may wonder what I, Tsukihi, am intending. I desire to teach the origin of human beings to all people of the world.

verses.pt: Se informar logo esta verdade igualmente a todos, entenderão as minhas explanações.
verses.en_6th_ed: If this truth becomes quickly known to all humankind, My talks will be understood.
verses.ro: hayabaya to kono shinjitsu o ichiretsu ni   shirashitaru nara hanashi wakaru de
verses.jp1: はや／＼とこのしんちつを一れつに
verses.jp2: しらしたるならはなしハかるで
verses.kanji: 早々とこの真実を一列に   知らしたるなら話分かるで
verses.english: If I make this truth quickly known to all mankind, they shall come to understand My words clearly.

verses.pt: Por mais que explique e faça ouvir as explanações, se não deixar informado a origem...
verses.en_6th_ed: No matter how I strive to explain My teachings, unless I teach you the origin...
verses.ro: ika hodoni hanashi o toite kikashitemo   moto o shirashite okan koto niwa
verses.jp1: いかほどにはなしをといてきかしても
verses.jp2: もとをしらしてをかん事にハ
verses.kanji: 如何程に話を説いて聞かしても   元を知らして置かん事には
verses.english: However repeatedly I may teach you the truth, unless I let you know the origin,

verses.pt: Se ao menos deixar explicado claramente a origem, o que quer que venha a dizer, compreenderão tudo.
verses.en_6th_ed: If only I have taught you the origin clearly, you will understand everything I say.
verses.ro: moto saika shikkari yute oita nara   nani o yutemo mina kikiwakeru
verses.jp1: もとさいかしいかりゆうてをいたなら
verses.jp2: なにをゆうてもみなきゝハける
verses.kanji: 元さいか確り言うて置いたなら   何を言うても皆聞き分ける
verses.english: If only I teach you the origin clearly, then you shall come to understand everything whatever I may say.

verses.pt: A terra e o céu deste mundo são o verdadeiro Parens. Os seres humanos foram formados deles.
verses.en_6th_ed: The earth and heaven of this world is your real Parent. Out of this, human beings were born.
verses.ro: kono yo no jii to ten towa jitsu no Oya   soreyori deketa ningen de aru
verses.jp1: このよふのぢいと天とハぢつのをや
verses.jp2: それよりでけたにんけんである
verses.kanji: この世の地と天とは実の親   それより出来た人間で有る
verses.english: The earth and heaven of this world is your real Parent. From this bosom human beings were born.

verses.pt: Doravante, direi somente o que a região dos não-esclarecidos e a dos esclarecidos desconhecem. Escutem bem!
verses.en_6th_ed: From now on, I shall tell you solely of things unknown to both Kara and Nihon. Listen closely!
verses.ro: korekara wa kara mo nihon mo shiran koto   bakari yu zo ya shikato kiku nari
verses.jp1: これからハからもにほんもしらん事
verses.jp2: ばかりゆうぞやしかときくなり
verses.kanji: これからは唐も日本も知らぬ事   ばかり言うぞや確と聞くなり
verses.english: From now on I will tell you solely things which were unknown to both those who understand My teachings early and those who shall understand My teachings later. Listen attentively to My words!

verses.pt: Desejo instruir tudo a todos igualmente, para que jamais digam não conhecer seja o que for.
verses.en_6th_ed: I wish to train you all in everything so that you need not say that you do not know.
verses.ro: dono yona koto mo shiran to yuwan yo   mina ichiretsu ni shikomitai kara
verses.jp1: どのよふな事もしらんとゆハんよふ
verses.jp2: みな一れつにしこみたいから
verses.kanji: どの様な事も知らんと言わん様   皆一列に仕込みたいから
verses.english: I desire to teach any and everything to all of you equally, lest in the future you should say that you do not know anything.

verses.pt: Dia a dia, o que Tsukihi pensa é sobre o íntimo do coração de muitas pessoas.
verses.en_6th_ed: Day after day, the concern in the mind of Tsukihi is the innermost hearts of a great number of people.
verses.ro: nichinichi ni Tsukihi no kokoro omou niwa   oku no hito no mune no uchi oba
verses.jp1: にち／＼に月日の心をもうにわ
verses.jp2: をゝくの人のむねのうちをば
verses.kanji: 日々に月日の心思うには   多くの人の胸の内をば
verses.english: Day after day, the mind of Tsukihi desires to purify the innermost hearts of a great number of people.

verses.pt: Como fazer para entender este espírito? Desejo distinguir isto depressa.
verses.en_6th_ed: How can I have you understand My mind? I so desire that your minds be purified quickly.
verses.ro: kono kokoro doshita naraba wakaru yara   dodo hayaku ni kore o waketai
verses.jp1: この心どふしたならばわかるやら
verses.jp2: どふどはやくにこれをわけたい
verses.kanji: この心どうしたならば分かるやら   どうぞ早くにこれを分けたい
verses.english: How can I purify these minds? I desire earnestly to make these hearts clean quickly.

verses.pt: Se o mundo inteiro entender sinceramente o íntimo do coração, quanto prazer terá Tsukihi!
verses.en_6th_ed: When all the world is truly purified from the innermost heart, it will be Tsukihi's delight.
verses.ro: sekaiju shinjitsu yori mo mune no uchi   wakarita naraba Tsukihi tanoshimi
verses.jp1: せかいぢうしんぢつよりもむねのうち
verses.jp2: わかりたならば月日たのしみ
verses.kanji: 世界中真実よりも胸の内   分かりたならば月日楽しみ
verses.english: When people of the whole world become truly clean from their innermost hearts, I, Tsukihi, will be delighted.

verses.pt: Desde então, se o íntimo do coração de todos entender, a partir disso, Tsukihi,
verses.en_6th_ed: When all humankind is purified from the innermost heart, Tsukihi will, then,
verses.ro: sorekara wa ichiretsu naru no mune no uchi   wakarita naraba Tsukihi soreyori
verses.jp1: それからハ一れつなるのむねのうち
verses.jp2: わかりたならば月日それより
verses.kanji: それからは一列なるの胸の内   分かりたならば月日それより
verses.english: When the innermost hearts of all mankind become clean, then I, Tsukihi, will begin My work.

verses.pt: Animará diária e gradualmente os espíritos, ensinando a todos a vida repleta de alegria.
verses.en_6th_ed: Make your minds spirited step by step and day by day, and teach joyousness to all of you.
verses.ro: dandan to nichinichi kokoro isame kake   yokizukume o mina ni oshiete
verses.jp1: だん／＼とにち／＼心いさめかけ
verses.jp2: よふきづくめをみなにをしへて
verses.kanji: 段々と日々心勇め掛け   陽気ずくめを皆に教えて
verses.english: Day by day and step by step, I will make your mind cheerful and will teach all of you a life full of joy.

verses.pt: Se o íntimo do coração de numerosas pessoas do mundo se purificar completamente,
verses.en_6th_ed: When the innermost hearts of a great number of people all over the world have been purified,
verses.ro: sekaiju oku no hito no mune no uchi   mina sumashitaru koto de aru nara
verses.jp1: せかいぢうをふくの人のむねのうち
verses.jp2: みなすましたる事であるなら
verses.kanji: 世界中多くの人の胸の内   皆澄ましたる事で有るなら
verses.english: When I have purified the innermost hearts of a great number of people in the whole world,

verses.pt: Desde então, Tsukihi ficará animado e ensinará tudo acerca do que quer que seja.
verses.en_6th_ed: Then the mind of Tsukihi will spring forth spiritedly, and I shall teach you everything about all matters.
verses.ro: soreyori mo Tsukihi no kokoro isami dete   donna koto demo mina oshieru de
verses.jp1: それよりも月日の心いさみでゝ
verses.jp2: どんな事でもみなをしゑるで
verses.kanji: それよりも月日の心勇み出て   どんな事でも皆教えるで
verses.english: Then the mind of Tsukihi shall spring forth cheerfully and teach any and everything to all of you.

verses.pt: Qualquer coisa que seja, Tsukihi deseja ensinar tudo a todos igualmente com sincera intenção.
verses.en_6th_ed: Tsukihi desires to teach the truth of everything to all humankind equally.
verses.ro: dono yona koto demo Tsukihi shinjitsu ni   mina ichiretsu ni oshietai no ya
verses.jp1: とのような事でも月日しんぢつに
verses.jp2: みな一れつにをしゑたいのや
verses.kanji: どの様な事でも月日真実に   皆一列に教えたいのや
verses.english: Truly I, Tsukihi, desire to teach any and everything to all of you equally.

verses.pt: Tsukihi deseja o espírito sincero para poder instruir toda e qualquer coisa.
verses.en_6th_ed: Tsukihi desires you to have a sincere mind because I wish to train you in all matters.
verses.ro: shinjitsu no kokoro ga hoshii Tsukihi niwa   donna koto demo shikomitai kara
verses.jp1: しんぢつの心がほしい月日にわ
verses.jp2: どんな事でもしこみたいから
verses.kanji: 真実の心が欲しい月日には   どんな事でも仕込みたいから
verses.english: I, Tsukihi, desire the true sincerity of your mind, because I desire to teach any and everything to you.

verses.pt: O que pensam que instruirei com esta explanação? Será sobre todos os cursos do caminho do porvir.
verses.en_6th_ed: In what do you think I wish to train you by this talk? For the countless courses of paths from now on.
verses.ro: kono hanashi nani o shikomu to omou kana   korekara saki no yorozu michisuji
verses.jp1: このはなしなにをしこむとをもうかな
verses.jp2: これからさきのよろづみちすじ
verses.kanji: この話何を仕込むと思うかな   これから先の万道筋
verses.english: What do you think I am going to teach? I will teach you any and every way you may take in the future.

verses.pt: Embora até hoje nada tenha sido visto, quando o dia se aproximar, tudo se avistará naturalmente.
verses.en_6th_ed: Until today, you have not been able to see anything. But when the time draws near, things will be seen naturally.
verses.ro: kyomade wa nani yono koto mo mienedomo   hi ga chikazukeba hitori mieru de
verses.jp1: けふまてハなによの事もみへねども
verses.jp2: ひがちかづけばひとりみへるで
verses.kanji: 今日迄は何よの事も見えねども   日が近付けば独り見えるで
verses.english: Until today nothing has really appeared. But when the day comes near, everything shall naturally come into your sight.

verses.pt: Seja o que for, jamais julguem ser doença; tudo é cuidado de Tsukihi.
verses.en_6th_ed: Do not think of anything as an illness. Everything is the care of Tsukihi.
verses.ro: dono yona koto mo yamai to omouna yo   nanika yorozu wa Tsukihi teiri ya
verses.jp1: とのよふな事もやまいとをもうなよ
verses.jp2: なにかよろづハ月日ていりや
verses.kanji: どの様な事も病と思うなよ   何か万は月日手入りや
verses.english: Never take it for an illness, whatever disorder you may suffer! Any and everything is the putting-in of the hand of Tsukihi.

verses.pt: Não sabem que preparação Tsukihi fará, instando o espírito dia a dia.
verses.en_6th_ed: As the mind of Tsukihi hastens day after day, there is no knowing what I am preparing.
verses.ro: Tsukihi yori nichinichi kokoro sekikonde   donna moyo o suru ya shiren de
verses.jp1: 月日よりにち／＼心せきこんで
verses.jp2: どんなもよふをするやしれんで
verses.kanji: 月日より日々心急き込んで   どんな模様をするや知れんで
verses.english: As the mind of Tsukihi hastens impatiently day by day, there is no knowing whatever kinds of arrangements shall be made.

verses.pt: Quanto à instância, não sabem a que se refere. É somente sobre o preparo do Kanrodai.
verses.en_6th_ed: You may not know what My hastening is about. It is solely about the preparations for the Kanrodai.
verses.ro: sekikomi mo nanino koto yara shiromai na   Kanrodai no moyo bakari o
verses.jp1: せきこみもなにの事やらしろまいな
verses.jp2: かんろふだいのもよふばかりを
verses.kanji: 急き込みも何の事やら知ろまいな   甘露台の模様ばかりを
verses.english: Perhaps you do not know what I hasten to do. I single-heartedly hasten arrangements for setting up the Kanrodai.

verses.pt: Se, no dia-a-dia, surgir incômodo no corpo, isto é cuidado de Tsukihi.
verses.en_6th_ed: In your days, if a disorder comes to the body, know that it is the care of Tsukihi.
verses.ro: nichinichi ni minouchi sawari tsuita nara   kore wa Tsukihi no teiri naru ka yo
verses.jp1: にち／＼にみのうちさハりついたなら
verses.jp2: これハ月日のていりなるかよ
verses.kanji: 日々に身の内障り付いたなら   これは月日の手入りなるかよ
verses.english: In case you feel disorder in your body, you must understand that it is nothing but the putting-in of the hand of Tsukihi.

verses.pt: Ao observar gradualmente todos os locais do mundo, compadecido, desejo mudar minhas expressões.
verses.en_6th_ed: Looking throughout the world step by step, I feel pity for you, so I desire to make changes.
verses.ro: dandan to misumasu tokoro sekaiju   kinodoku na kara monku kaetai
verses.jp1: だん／＼とみすますところせかいぢう
verses.jp2: きのどくなからもんくかへたい
verses.kanji: 段々と見澄ます所世界中   気の毒なから文句変えたい
verses.english: Looking through the whole world step by step, I find all people living a pitiful life. So I am determined to change the state of the human world.

verses.pt: Reflitam! O que quer que seja dito, é preciso que haja uma prova convincente.
verses.en_6th_ed: Ponder: whatever is said by mouth, if there is no sure proof, it will not do.
verses.ro: shiyan seyo kuchi de nani goto yuta tote   tashikana shoko nakuba ikan de
verses.jp1: しやんせよくちでなに事ゆうたとて
verses.jp2: たしかなしよこなくばいかんで
verses.kanji: 思案せよ口で何事言うたとて   確かな証拠無くばいかんで
verses.english: Ponder over it! Whatever I may say by mouth, if there is no sure evidence, no one will be able to believe it.

verses.pt: Tsukihi, introduzindo-se no corpo, fará a onipotente indicação, que é a prova.
verses.en_6th_ed: This is proof: Tsukihi has entered this body and gives directions freely and unlimitedly.
verses.ro: Tsukihi yori tainai yori mo irikonde   juyojizai no sashizu shoko ya
verses.jp1: 月日よりたいないよりも入こんで
verses.jp2: ぢうよぢざいのさしずしよこや
verses.kanji: 月日より体内よりも入り込んで   自由自在の指図証拠や
verses.english: I, Tsukihi, have entered into this body and give indication freely and unrestrictedly. This is the sure evidence.

verses.pt: Por isso, começarei dizendo somente coisas até agora inexistentes, onde quer que seja.
verses.en_6th_ed: Because of this, I begin things, speaking solely about that which has never existed anywhere.
verses.ro: soreyue ni imamade doko ni nai koto o   bakari yuute hajime kakeru de
verses.jp1: それゆへにいまゝでどこにない事を
verses.jp2: ばかりゆううてはじめかけるで
verses.kanji: それ故に今迄何処に無い事を   ばかり言うて初め掛けるで
verses.english: Therefore I will begin My work, solely speaking of what has never existed before in any place.

verses.pt: Dizer coisas inexistentes até agora é também o ensinamento de Tsukihi.
verses.en_6th_ed: Though I speak solely about things which have never existed, they are all the teachings of Tsukihi.
verses.ro: imamade mo nai koto bakari yu no mo na   kore mo Tsukihi no mina oshie ya de
verses.jp1: いまゝでもない事ばかりゆうのもな
verses.jp2: これも月日のみなをしへやで
verses.kanji: 今迄も無い事ばかり言うのもな   これも月日の皆教えやで
verses.english: I am going to tell you everything which has never existed before. But it is all the teachings of Tsukihi.

verses.pt: O Kanrodai referido desta vez, é algo desconhecido também até agora.
verses.en_6th_ed: The matter of the Kanrodai at this time is also that which has been unknown before.
verses.ro: konotabi no Kanrodai to yu no mo na   kore mo imamade shiran koto ya de
verses.jp1: このたびのかんろふだいとゆうのもな
verses.jp2: これもいまゝでしらん事やで
verses.kanji: この度の甘露台と言うのもな   これも今迄知らん事やで
verses.english: This time I hasten to set up the Kanrodai. This also you have never known before.

verses.pt: Qualquer coisa que diga, é tudo Tsukihi, que deseja ensinar fatos desconhecidos.
verses.en_6th_ed: Whatever is said, it is all by Tsukihi. I speak because I desire to teach you things unknown.
verses.ro: dono yona koto o yu no mo mina Tsukihi   shiran koto oba oshietai kara
verses.jp1: どのよふな事をゆうのもみな月日
verses.jp2: しらん事をばをしゑたいから
verses.kanji: どの様な事を言うのも皆月日   知らん事をば教えたいから
verses.english: It is all I, Tsukihi, who speak of whatever kinds of things. I desire to teach you things which you have never known before.

verses.pt: Assento o Kanrodai nesta Residência como a prova de que criei os seres humanos.
verses.en_6th_ed: That I place the Kanrodai in this Residence is the proof that I began human beings.
verses.ro: kono yashiki Kanrodai o sueru no wa   ningen hajime kaketa shoko
verses.jp1: このやしきかんろふだいをすへるのハ
verses.jp2: にんけんはじめかけたしよこふ
verses.kanji: この屋敷甘露台を据えるのは   人間初め掛けた証拠
verses.english: That I am going to set up the Kanrodai in this Residence is the evidence of the creation of human beings.

verses.pt: Começando tudo desta maneira, purificarei os espíritos do mundo.
verses.en_6th_ed: Beginning everything in this way, I shall purify the minds of the whole world.
verses.ro: nani goto mo mina kono tori hajime kake   sekaiju no kokoro sumasuru
verses.jp1: なに事もみなこのとふりはちめかけ
verses.jp2: せかいぢううの心すまする
verses.kanji: 何事も皆この通り初め掛け   世界中の心澄まする
verses.english: Beginning everything in this way, I will purify the minds of people of the whole world.

verses.pt: Dia a dia, de qualquer modo, farei somente o preparo para animar todas as pessoas do mundo.
verses.en_6th_ed: Day by day, I shall make every effort solely for the preparations to make everyone in the world spirited.
verses.ro: nichinichi ni nandemo sekai ichiretsu o   isameru moyo bakari suru zo ya
verses.jp1: にち／＼になんでもせかい一れつを
verses.jp2: いさめるもよふばかりするぞや
verses.kanji: 日々に何でも世界一列を   勇める模様ばかりするぞや
verses.english: Day by day by all means I will solely arrange to cheer up the minds of people of the whole world equally.

verses.pt: Se o espírito de todas as pessoas se animar gradualmente, também as colheitas serão todas animadoras.
verses.en_6th_ed: As the minds of the world are spirited step by step, the growth of all crops, also, will be spirited.
verses.ro: dandan to sekai no kokoro isamu nara   ryuke morotomo mina isami deru
verses.jp1: だん／＼とせかいの心いさむなら
verses.jp2: りうけもろともみないさみでる
verses.kanji: 段々と世界の心勇むなら   立毛諸共皆勇み出る
verses.english: When step by step the minds of all people become cheered up, accordingly all harvests shall spring forth cheerfully.

verses.pt: Se indagarem como este espírito se animará, Tsukihi sairá conduzindo os servidores.
verses.en_6th_ed: To explain how these minds are to be spirited: Tsukihi will go forth, taking My workers along.
verses.ro: kono kokoro doshite isamu koto naraba   Tsukihi ninsoku tsurete deru zo ya
verses.jp1: この心どふしていさむ事ならば
verses.jp2: 月日にんそくつれてゞるぞや
verses.kanji: この心どうして勇む事ならば   月日人足連れて出るぞや
verses.english: You may wonder how I can make these minds cheerful. I will go forth bringing My workers with Me.

verses.pt: Até então, todos ouvirão aqui e ali gradualmente qualquer espécie de explanações.
verses.en_6th_ed: Until then, you will all hear of various things here and there and one after another.
verses.ro: soremade ni atchi kotchi to dono yona   hanashi dandan mina kiku de aro
verses.jp1: それまでにあゝちこふちとどのよふな
verses.jp2: はなしだん／＼みなきくであろ
verses.kanji: それ迄にあっちこっちとどの様な   話段々皆聞くで有ろう
verses.english: Until then you shall hear whatever kind of news here and there one by one.
